loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret W. M. is 47 years old. She has three children who range in age from 20 to 25 years old. She makes a living in the town of Ngong, Kenya by raising cows and selling their milk. She would like to diversify her business by applying for a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy inventory for a new retail shop. While she does this, she hopes to continue to engage in her true passion, which is dairy farming. She works very hard to keep her business doing well and hopes to make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Siupolu

texts.en:
Siupolu C. is 36 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Siupolu has 4 years of experience in this business.  Siupolu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Siupolu joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Siupolu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Siupolu C. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD :http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Zenny's Group

texts.en:
Zenny S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran ZDS. She is 28 years old. Zenny is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Zenny is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Zenny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The income for her business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Zenny has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately PHP12,000.00  a month for these activities.

In 2008, Zenny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Zenny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Zenny is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Zenny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Milene

texts.es: Milene tiene 23 años, casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus familiares. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos con su esposo, por lo que han arrendado un terreno cerca de su casa. Hoy es su fuente principal de ingresos, que le ayuda a sostener a su familia, por tal motivo se dedica a este trabajo todos los días. Además ha tenido la necesidad de contratar mano de obra, que le ayuda en la preparación de sus ladrillos; mientras que Milene se dedica a la venta y en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Durante estos años ha visto que la fabricación y venta de ladrillos le ha sido muy rentable, ahora tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, por lo que tendrá que arrendar otro terreno. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente ser responsable con sus pagos, considera además este aporte le será  muy útil para desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de insumos que le servirá para aumentar la producción de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Milene is 23 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son at home with her family. Over eight years ago, Milene began to make bricks with her husband, and leased land near their home to use for their business. These days the business is their main source of income, and so they focus on this work every day. They also had to hire more labor in order to help prepare bricks. Milene is focused on sales and searching for new customers. Recently Milene has noticed that the manufacture and sale of bricks has been very profitable, and now she has plans to expand the business. Therefore she will have to lease another site. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. She considers this microloan contribution useful for her business, and with the requested loan, Milene will invest in inventory to increase her brick production.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her brick production

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Caracucho, un zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en pequeños caseríos dispersos, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Betty se dedica a trabajar como confeccionista de faldas, vestidos y blusas desde hace mas de dos años, cuenta con una máquina de coser en su vivienda donde trabaja constantemente para confeccionar las prendas de vestir que le solicita un comerciante que, a su vez, las vende en algunas ciudades de la sierra del país. Con las ganancias que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía de su familia.

Esta actividad también le ayuda a sentirse activa, por lo que ella gusta mucho de la labor que realiza. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por lo que ella está pensando en comprar más materiales como hilos y telas para confeccionar mas prendas de vestir, para lograr su objetivo Betty se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Betty es una joven que siempre apoya a sus padres en labores agrícolas y de crianza de animales, ya que estas son las principales fuentes de sustento con las que cuentan. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ampliar su taller para poder seguir trabajando y brindarle una oportunidad de trabajo a otras mujeres de la zona.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Caracucho, an rural area in the District of Mórrope where most of the population is scattered among several small villages. This area is part of the Province of Lambayeque and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Betty has been manufacturing skirts, dresses, and blouses for more than two years. She has a sewing machine in her home where she works constantly to produce clothing requested by a merchant, who then sells them in some of the mountain cities. Using the earnings she receives from her work, Betty is able to help her parents with the family finances.

Her business also allows her to stay active since she enjoys her work tremendously. Since the business has been well-received, Betty is thinking about buying additional materials, such as thread and fabric, to make more clothing. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Betty is a young woman who has always supported her parents with their farming and animal husbandry endeavors, the main sources of income on which they depend. Her greatest wish is to expand her workshop so that she can continue working and provide employment opportunities to other women in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida P., 37, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is single and makes sure that she helps her parents earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been in her food-vending business for quite some time now.

Adelaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Adelaida would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying raw meats and ingredients to continue production of her business.

Adelaida dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can buy her own house and lot.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw meats and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Eleswida

texts.en: Eleswida F. is a married woman who owns a small business in Tanzania. She runs a food shop in Yombo Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells different types of crop-based food products, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, groundnuts, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She purchases the goods from wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo city shopping center. The income from this business enabled her to open onother business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan of TZS 1,400,000 to buy more products to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of his house & pay for some household expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials (iron roofing, iron, cement, sand and other items)

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon G. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Ma. Corazon is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ma. Corazon owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ma. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ma. Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fishes to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Santa Cruz, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat M., 34, and her husband Mr. Samrith Deth, 38, have been married since 1996 and have three children — one son and two daughters, all in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Tat M. has been a silk weaver for eight years and her husband has been a taxi driver for fourteen years. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 50 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Jerry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jerry from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El cliente Noel Antonio Rostran Urrutia. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peño departamento león, tiene 3 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña el cargo como técnico de proyecto. 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación en mal estado, propia el cual el destino del crédito es para la mejora de su hogar.  
El destino del crédito es para la compra de ladrillos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Noel Antonio Rostran U.lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peño municipality, in the Leon department.  He has 3 children in his care, and he currently works for the municipality of Santa Rosa Del Peño as a project technician.

He owns a home that is in bad condition, and he will use this loan to make repairs to his home.  Specifically, he will buy bricks to
use to make improvements to his home.  This will allow him to provide better living conditions which will improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy bricks

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
In the city that always has a reason to celebrate, people love to have fiestas! Esteban C. and his extensive family are not an exception, and what is a party without a moonwalk? The kids in Esteban’s family always wished for moonwalks at their parties but they were too expensive, not to mention the required large deposit. Therefore, he decided to buy a couple of moonwalks and rent them out at affordable prices to his family and acquaintances. Eventually, Esteban realized there was quite a demand for moonwalks and other party supplies like chairs and tables. What started as a kind gesture to make moonwalks more available to kids in his neighborhood and family has turned into a thriving business!


 His present inventory of chairs is inadequate to meet the growing demand for his party supply business. Therefore, Esteban plans to use his loan to purchase more chairs. Esteban plans to continue growing his business, and eventually to pass it on to his grandson.

loans.use: Chairs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita  plants and harvests rice for sale. Angelita has been engaged in farming for more than 3 years. Her husband, who is also a farmer, was able to buy a motorcycle and now uses it to transport people around their community when he is free from farming duties.

Angelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP  to purchase farm supplies and repair the motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, de 25 años, está casada hace 6 años con Yuber, de 26 años, ambos tiene 2 hijos a los que educan con  mucho amor, ya que Melsi, de 6 años y Luciana, de 1 años y seis meses de nacida, son su mayor tesoro. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. El apoyo de su esposo Yuber, es vital, para ella, pues con las ganancias que obtiene en la comercialización de frutas al por mayor en el norte del país, puede alimentar y educar a sus hijos, y eso le ofrece una economía estable. Mientras que ella se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde hace ya 5 años que viene sembrando papa y arveja, que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad, con las ganancias que obtiene, puede darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. Como también está ahorrando, para poner un negocio de frutas a gran escala, donde pueda abastecer a todos los comercializadores de todo el Perú. Margot, está segura que con la experiencia ganada por su esposo lo logrará. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está segura, de que tomó una buena decisión, agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal, por ofrecerle la oportunidad de salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 20 sacos de abono orgánico, e invertirá en el pago del salario de los peones que le ayudarán.
texts.en:
Margot is 25 years old.  She has been married for six years to 26 year-old Yuber.  The couple have 2 chldren who they are educating with a lot of love since 6 year-old Melsi and 18 month-old Luciana are her greatest treasure.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of Casacoto.  The support of her husband Yuber is vital for her since with the profits which they obtain in selling their fruit wholesale in the north of the country, they can feed and educate their children and this offers them a stable economic situation.  Margot works tending her land where she has been growing potatoes and peas for the last 5 years.  After each harvest she sells her produce in the town's central market.  With the profits which she makes she is able to provide her children with a better life.  

She  is also saving to set up a large-scale fruit business where she can supply salespeople from all over Peru.  Margot is sure that, with the experience her husband has, she will achieve her goal.

This is her first loan from MFP and she is sure that she made a good decision.  She is grateful to the members of her community bank for having offered her this opportunity to get ahead.  She will use her loan to buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer and will invest in paying the salary of the laborers who will help her.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and contract laborers to help her with the sowing of her crops

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda R. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Belinda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling Filipino viands like "afritada", "caldereta", "halang-halang na manok" & "pancit bihon" in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bayanie

texts.en:
Bayanie M. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old and is single. To make a living, Bayanie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating transportation services. Bayanie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bayanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bayanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bayanie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Bayanie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda S. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, isabela. She is 46 years old. Imelda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every four months. In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He's been working in agriculture for seven years. In 2008, he bought his own land and started to produce vegetables to sell in his town and neighboring villages. He works with his brothers to bring in the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some pesticides and seeds so he can increase his productivity and make his work faster.

loans.use: To purchase some pesticide and grains

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane Sangaré est un homme marié de 41 ans et père de 5 enfants, qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même à Bougouni dans le quartier Dialanicoro.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
Depuis plus de 10 ans il mène l’activité d’achat et la vente des appareils électroniques qu’il appris auprès de son ami. Monsieur Ousmane à une réelle maîtrise de son activité.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de l’institution, il décide alors d’adhérer au programme crédit.
Il compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des appareils électroniques. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’agrandir son entreprise. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république) du Mali.                                                                                                                                                                       La vente se fait à Bougouni et une partie dans les villages environnants aux marchés hebdomadaires. Il a une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage construire une maison pour son avenir et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousame Sangare is a married man who is 41 years old and the father of 5 children. He lives with his wife and children in their own home located in Bougouni, in the Dialanicoro quarter. 

Not having had the opportunity to attend school, from a very young age he started with revenue generating activities. 

For the past 10 years he has had his business buying and selling electronics, a business he learned from a friend. Ousame is a true master of the business. 

Following an introduction to Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) by another client of the organization, he decided to join the credit program.

He plans on using his loan to purchase electronics. This will allow him to increase his business. He makes his purchases in Bamako (capital city of the Republic of Mali). He carries out his sales in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages at the weekly markets.

He has a diverse and varied clientele. 

He expects to earn a monthly income of 32 000 FCFA. 

With this loan he hopes to build a house for the sake of his future and that of his children.

loans.use: To purchase electronics.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: general store and ambulant vending (vegetable) businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and ambulant vending (vegetable) businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15000. Myrna is borrowing PHP 12000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos independientes de 20 y 22 años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres los cuales son agricultores. Viven en una zona urbana y transitable en Guadalupe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres anos, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros en el exterior del mercado central de Guadalupe. Este negocio le genera buena rentabilidad como cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada.

Desea utilizar su crédito para la compra de ropa para la temporada escolar. Aunque sea unos meses antes del comienzo de la escuela, Ana desea obtener su mercadería ahora mientras que los precios aun no hayan subido. Espera lograr una mejor ganancia y calidad de vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 41, is single and the mother of two independent children, aged 20 and 22. She lives in the house of her parents who are farmers. They live in a built-up area in Guadalupe, which can be reached after more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

For three years Ana has been selling clothes for women and men outside of the central market in Guadalupe. Her business generates a good income from a stable and loyal clientele.

She wants to use her loan to buy clothes ahead of the school period. Although school will start only in a few months, Ana wants to get her merchandise now before the prices rise. She hopes to achieve a higher income and a better quality of life. She thought that it was appropriate to apply for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale during the school term

loans.name: Nancy Alilian

texts.es:
Nancy Alilian R. B. tiene 49 años, es casada vive con el esposo  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Nancy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta ver la televisión y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Nancy Alilian R. B. is 49 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Nancy is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Nancy faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can continue growing crops.

Nancy enjoys watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Shahlan's Group

texts.en:
Shahlan is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Marzipura and she lives there with her family. She is an active 36-year-old lady. She not only provides comfort to her family by completing her household responsibilities but also supports them financially from her sewing and embroidery works. She offers her services to her neighboring clients and earns income for the family. Her family respects her and loves her a lot for her kind and helping nature towards them. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her business. Through the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as clothes, beads and colored thread in bulk quantity that will help her offer better services to her clients, which will definitely affect her monthly profits. Shahlan is hopeful that this investment will bring more profits to her and will improve her business conditions. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahlan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel, posee una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 18 y 21 años D. edad. Ella administra un tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, también venD. verduras, cría cerdos y ganado, tiene una gran experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ganado y el cultivo D. maíz, con este préstamo piensa a parte D. comprar ganado, también adquirir abono y fertilizantes para iniciar la siembra.
Su objetivo es tener éxito en sus ocupaciones, comercializar a un buen precio el ganado y los cerdos, para obtener ganancias D. las cuales dispone para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María lives in El Transito department of San Miguel. She owns a store and lives with her husband and two children ages 18 and 21. She manages a store that sells staple products in addition to vegetables, breeding pigs and cattle. She has a lot of experience with this.
She is requesting a loan to buy cattle and cultivate corn. With this loan she plans on using part of it to buy cattle. She will also purchase manure and fertilizers to start the planting.
Her goal is to be successful with her businesses, to sell the cattle and pigs for a good price and to obtain income that will cover her household necessities.

loans.use: to buy cattle, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has been running a charcoA. trading business since 2009.  His work consists of buying his products from dealers and selling them to customers. He is new in this type of business but he’s sure that he will be able to reach his intended goA. in a short period.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. products needed in order to reinforce his business operation and strengthen it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, aged 43, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is a hairdresser, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phally and her husband have had these businesses. Phally is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more hairdressing equipment to improve her current business. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 35-year-old married man with one child from A. Bayader, Jordan. Raed owns an auto parts store. He is requesting a loan of 1500JD to purchase more parts and expand his business. Raed's goA. is to open a second store.

loans.use: to purchase more auto parts and expand his shop.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 41 and is a married woman with two children. Her eldest child is 21. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Janette has a hog-raising business. She has a backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Janette also helps her husband at their rice farm when she can.

This loan will be used to purchase feed for pigs and also for her children's tuition fees. In the future, she hopes to pay all her debts and let her kids finish school.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Félix  Pedro

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, Félix Pedro  es una persona trabajadora laborando como promotor, honesta, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales. Es soltero y tiene ha su cargo una persona. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  el señor Félix Pedro para solicitar crédito que será utilizado en reparación  parcial de la vivienda de sus padres  en la compra de materiales  de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, hierro, estribo y pago de mano de obra, para darle a su familia un techo digno y agradece a ceprodel el apoyo que le a brindado.
texts.en:
Félix Pedro is from the city of Managua.  He is a hard working person employed as a Salesman.  He is honest, responsible and has good values and moral principles.  He’s single and has one dependent.

Félix Pedro came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan that will be used to partially repair his parents’ house.  It will be used to purchase building materials and supplies like: concrete blocks, cement, iron rods, brackets and to pay labor costs, to provide his family with a dignified home.  He thanks Ceprodel for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He started his career working in a mobile shop. Then, he opened his own store in 2008. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and purchase prepaid telephone cards to sell. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards. He reports that both his business sales and income will increase as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy more new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48 year-old married man with ten children.  He owns a house in Fort Portal, Uganda.   Joseph is a builder and also deals in quarrying stones.  The major challenge is during the rainy season when the roads to the quarry are impassable.  His desire is to solely own the quarry site.  

Joseph needs the loan to hire people to quarry stones.  His dream is to construct rental houses so as to financially sustain his family.

loans.use: To hire more people to quarry stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and goats, build a shaded pen area, and to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es:
La jugueria MEDILU es de propiedad de la Sra. Mercedes son 07 años que tiene su negocio  propio empezó como la mayoría informalmente y de forma ambulatoria  le parece increíble haber progresado tanto  tardo 12 años para tener su propio puesto de venta en el mercado Virgen del Carmen un lugar cerca de su lugar de residencia  fue su padre quien la ayudo económicamente con el fin de que pueda estar  junto a sus hijos y no descuidarlos, ella fue progresando poco a poco ahora esta agradecida debido que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a sus hijos que siguen estudios superiores especialmente a una de sus hijas, en su jugería ella vende toda clase de jugos, ensaladas de frutas y otros alimentos. Mas adelante quiere que su negocio se expanda y siga creciendo quiere poner  una fuente de soda en su propia casa, donde cuenta con un ambiente adecuado  para tener su negocio formal,  su crédito le servirá para la compra de  frutas al por mayor  , ella es secretaria del grupo “ LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE LA ENSENADA “

* La Sra MERCEDES es la 3ra parada.
texts.en:
The MEDILU juice shop is the property of Mercedes, who has owned it for 7 years now. Like most businesses, it began informally as a street-vending enterprise. It seems incredible to have progressed so much. Mercedes has waited 12 years to have her own sales post in the Virgen del Carmen Market, a location close to her place of residence. 

It was Mercedes' father who aided her economically so that she could be with her children and not leave them uncared for. She has been progressing little by little and now, and she is grateful that due to her hard work, she can help her children to continue their higher studies, especially one of her daughters.

At her juice stand Mercedes sells all kinds of juices, fruit salads, and other foods. Further along, she wants to expand her business and continue growing. She hopes to install a soda fountain in her own house, where she can count on an adequate ambience and launch a formal business.

Mercedes' loan will be used to buy fruit at wholesale. She is secretary of the communal bank group “Las Triunfadoras de la Ensenada.”

*In the photo Mercedes is the 3rd person seated.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Madeleine Del Carmen

texts.es: Madeleine  de 38 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 17 años. Allí se dedica a vender almuerzos,  aprovechando que muy cerca está ubicado un escenario deportivo muy visitado por jugadores, padres de familia de jóvenes y niños que practican microfútbol, quienes son sus principales clientes a quienes les vende comidas típicas de la región  en la modalidad de contado. Su meta es lograr ampliar su negocio pero su desafío es el insuficiente  capital de trabajo, ante su creciente clientela. Así mismo sueña con lograr que sus hijos alcancen estudios superiores que potencien su éxito futuro. Sus compras las realiza en pequeñas cantidades y adquiere las materias prima e insumos para la preparación de alimentos a mayor costo, y por consiguiente se incrementan los precios de sus productos. Esta es la razón por la cual Solicita su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen y de contado, arroz, aceite, granos y carnes.
texts.en:
Madeleine, 38, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her spouse and five children whose ages range from 2 to 17 years.  She sells lunches there taking advantage of the fact that she lives very close to a very popular sports venue that many sports enthusiasts, parents, youngsters and children who play microfútbol [a type of soccer played on a smaller field and that combines rules from water polo, basketball, handball and soccer] attend and who are her main customers.  She sells them traditional, regional meals for cash.  

Her goal is to expand the business but she’s challenged by her insufficient working capital in face of her growing clientele.  She also dreams with her children attaining higher education that will make a successful future possible.  She purchases small amounts so her raw materials and ingredients for her meal preparation cost more so the prices of her products rise too.  This is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan, the first financing she’ll get from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy and pay cash for larger amounts of rice, oil, grains and meats.

loans.use: to buy and pay cash for rice, oil, grains and meats.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Elena de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una panadería y vende cosméticos desde hace 9 años. Ella inicio el negocio con una arroba de harina en la actualidad ella realiza un quintal de harina tres veces a la semana.
Con el crédito Gloria comprar harina, levadura, azúcar…etc. con el firme propósito de salir adelante.
texts.en: Gloria Elena, 27, is a very hardworking, enterprising woman.  She has had a bakery and has sold cosmetics for the last 9 years.  She started the business with just one arroba [unit of weight] of flour and at present she consumes a quintal of flour three times a week.  Gloria will use the loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc. with the firm goal of getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old; he is married and has seven children. To earn a living, he does carpentry. He has been in the business for six years and has employed three people. He also does farming to boost his income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business well. Charles has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber, nails and velvet.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and velvet.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is applying for another loan to start a new dairy farming business. She will use this Kes 80,000 loan to invest in a dairy farm. In the future, Eutropia aspires to become a supplier for big hotels and have a large poultry and dairy farm in the future. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Eutropia has been able to improve her family's living standard. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to start a new dairy farming business.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is a widow and has three children. Bernalda is 71-years-old and resides at Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Bernalda owns and operates a tailoring business to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 6,500 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase a sewing machine  and equipment for tailoring. Bernalda has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Bernalda wants to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine  and equipment for tailoring.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María cuenta con 50 años de edad es casada tiene a cargos tres nietos lo cuales están estudiando linda está cursando 2º grado de prepa, cristina esta en 2º de secundaria y maría de los ángeles esta en 4º grado de primaria, su esposo se llama Leobardo se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende mariscos y zapatos por catalogo lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los mariscos para salir a vender y surtirá su pedidos pendientes a doña maría le gustaría que su negocio fluyera un poco mas ya que lo quiere incrementar aun mas.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, married, and is responsable for three grandchildren who are in school. Linda is in her second year of high school, Cristina is in the second year of middle school and María de los Ángeles is in the fourth grade. Her husband Leobardo devotes himself to rural activities. 

She devotes herself to business, selling seafood and shoes by catalog. She will invest her loan in the purchase of seafood for selling door-to-door and will fulfill her pending orders. Doña María would like business to flow more since she wants to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase seafood for selling door-to-door and fulfill her pending orders.

loans.name: Jany

texts.es: Jany, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su padre y madre, como también de sus dos hermanos de 28 y 22 años de edad,  respectivamente, su cuñada y sus dos sobrinos, habitando todos una casa de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Jany es la venta de carne de pollo, su actividad empieza de madrugada, se dirige al centro de acopio de los proveedores y criadores de pollos, donde compra su producto, para luego llevarlo a su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado informal de su ciudad. Ahi se dispone a preparar a los pollos para venderlos a sus clientes tal como les gusta, limpios y bien preparados. Éste fue un negocio familiar, que aprendió de su madre, lleva dedicándose por más de 10 años, ejerciéndola con el apoyo de un joven que la ayuda con la limpieza de los pollo y le paga por día trabajado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico para sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Este será el préstamo número 20 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero, que a lo largo de este tiempo ha venido recibiendo, desea seguir contando con dicho apoyo, por eso será puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en el arreglo de su puesto de venta, tanto el piso como la mesa, y su implementación como la compra de balanza y demás.
texts.en:
Jany, 34, is a hardworking and determined woman. She is single and lives with her parents, her siblings, aged 28 and 22 respectively, her sister-in-law and her two nephews in a house owned by her parents. Jany's job is selling chicken meat. She begins work early in the morning and goes to the suppliers' and chicken breeders' collection center where she buys her products. She then brings them to her stall which is located in her city marketplace. There, she gets the chickens ready to sell them to her customers the way they like them - clean and well-prepared.

This was a family business which she learned from her mother. She has been doing this job for more than 10 years, with the help of a young man whom she pays for each day worked, for his help cleaning the chickens. What she likes about her job is having an income for her personal expenses and being able to help her parents with the household expenses. 

This will be the 20th loan with the institution MFP. She is grateful for the financial support that she has been receiving. She would like to continue to rely on this support and will therefore be punctual with her repayments. With the amount requested, she will invest in the renovation of her stall - of the floor and the counter - and the installation of a scales among other items.

loans.use: to set up her stall by laying the floor and buying a counter and a scales

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 40, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operations, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters).

Victo has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Victo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Victo has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Victo include on-and-off electricity and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked salon and also educate her children up to university.

She also generates additional income through poultry farming. Victo lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding her family

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Miryan's Group

texts.es:
Miryan's Group es un grupo de tres mujeres decididas a triunfar en la vida, en este grupo la presidenta es Miryan ya que es una mujer alegre, entusiasta y responsable, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en Ibarra Provincia de Imbabura.

Miryan trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de pollos ya que es su única fuente de ingreso económico tienen que sacrificar muchas cosas para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, es por eso que deciden realizar un crédito en Fodemi, el mismo que van a utilizar en la compra de pollos y balanceado para su alimentación proceso que ayudará a los pollos a crecer saludables y gordos para que sean competentes en el mercado y así Miryan podrá obtener ingresos económicos que le servirá para sustentar sus gastos familiares.

El sueño de Miryan es tener un galpón grande de pollos para poder distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Miryan's Group is a group of three women who are determined to succeed in life. The president of the group is Miryan as she is a happy, enthusiastic and responsible woman. She is 28 years old, she's married and she has 2 children. She lives with her family in Ibarra in the province of Imbabura.

Miryan works with her husband, breeding chickens. Since this is their only source of income they have to sacrifice a lot to be able to cover the necessities in their home. Therefore they decided to take out a loan with Fodemi which they are going to use to buy chickens and balanced feed for the feeding process. This will help the chickens to grow up fat and healthy so that they are competitive in the market and thus, Miryan will be have an income that will help her to support her family.

Miryan's dream is to have a large chicken shed to enable her to distribute on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy chickens and balanced feed.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 50 años de edad, es un hombre alegre, dinámico y emprendedor. Esta separado pero vive en  compañía de su hija de 27 años en su casa de ella. El trabajo que realiza Arturo, es dar el servicio de trasporte en su mototaxi, dedicándose a ésta actividad  desde hace 01 año, tiempo en el cual  le ha permitido hacerse muy conocido por la calidad. Con las ganancias, le ha permitido comprarse otra mototaxi, lo cual  alquila con una tarifa de 20 soles diarios. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es  independiente, le da un ingreso económico,  con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar y ayudar en los gastos de la casa a su hija. Comenta que escogió ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio ya que no completo sus estudios superiores y tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando y con esfuerzo lograr abrir un restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina. Este sería su préstamo número 07 con la institución MFP, con el grupo con quien trabaja se siente muy cómodo, pues los conoce muy bien por el tiempo que viene trabajando, considera que son personas responsables con sus pagos, lo que le anima a seguir en el grupo. Con el dinero solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo adicionará a su capital propio pues tiene la idea de comprar otro mototaxi y además de llantas nuevas para sus mototaxis.
texts.en:
Arturo, 50, is a cheerful, dynamic, enterprising man. He’s separated but lives in the company of his 27-year-old daughter in her house.  Arturo works providing transportation services in his mototaxi, an activity he’s been doing for a year and during which he’s become much known because of the quality.  With profits he’s been able to buy another mototaxi which he leases out for a daily fee of 20 soles.  

What he likes about his work is that it’s independent and it provides him with income that he can use to support his household expenses and help support his daughter’s household.  He comments that he chose this activity because he needed an occupation since he never completed higher education and he very much wants to continue progressing and with effort manage to open a restaurant because he likes to cook.

This will be MFP loan #7.  He feels very comfortable in the group he works with because he considers them to be people who are responsible with their payments which encourages him to stay with the group.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to add to capital of his own to buy another mototaxi as well as new tires for his mototaxis.

loans.use: to buy another mototaxi and to buy tires.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan  tiene como actividad  principal la elaboración de derivados lácteos, diario compra 25 litros de leche y de su propio ganado lechero produce 10 litros de leche, su laboratorio es en su casa propia, ubicado en plena avenida camino a Copacabana,   viven con su esposa que se encarga en la venta de yogurts, el momento de la visita se encontraba con su esposa en su laboratorio lavando sus baldes,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de una lechera de raza mejorada para tener mas cantidad de leche y de esta manera mejorar sus  ingresos, ambos trabajan muy fuerte por el bienestar de su familia, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan's main activity is making dairy products. He buys 25 liters of milk every day and his own dairy cattle produce 10 liters of milk. His laboratory is in his own house, located right in the Camino a Copacabana avenue. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of selling yogurt. At the time of his visit, he was with his wife in the laboratory washing his pails. This activity is their main source of income. At this time, they are asking for a loan to buy a purebred dairy cow in order to have more milk and thus increase their income. They both work very hard for their family's wellbeing. He is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 25-year-old married male from Madaba in Jordan. He has one child.

He requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for food products to resell in his grocery store. In the future he wants to expand his project and buy a home.

Since Bilal is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for food products to resell

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de es la venta de productos de primera necesidad  como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, pan, detergente, jaboncillos, refrescos, gaseosas y entre otros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

La socia se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 26 years old, married, and has two children from her wonderful relationship.  She was born in the city of Cusco and she lives in the the same city in which she was born.  Her business is selling necessities, such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, bread, detergent, soap, soft drinks, and carbonated drinks, among others.  She has been in this business for several years now and it is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She currently needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar. 

She is happy with the loan, promises to make her payments on time, and is thankful for the help she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado es un Cantón que se encuentra al Noroccidente de Pichincha -  Ecuador; que día con día va creciendo, en este Cantón existe mucho comercio, aquí vive y trabaja Luis es un hombre de 43 años, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 son de una anterior relación, en la actualidad mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre con la Señora Leydi ella tiene 22 años no trabaja se encarga de una pequeña tienda que tienen en  casa y del cuidado de los 3 hijos que tienen juntos.
Don Luis tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz al cual le dedica gran parte de su tiempo aprendió de este negocio desde muy niño junto a sus hermanos mayores ya que ellos se dedican a esta actividad él trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias por lo que no tiene mucho tiempo libre, le gusta mucho hacer deporte y cuando le queda algo de tiempo después del trabajo hace deporte y también les dedica tiempo a su familia.
En esta actividad de mecánica para él no se le hace muy complicada ya que la viene haciendo muchos años y sabe mucho sobre la misma, lo que más se le dificulta es cuando tienen que cambiar los paquetes de un carro grande ya que es peligroso se puede soltar la gata y recibir un fuerte golpe del mismo
Don Luis tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar como comprarse un terreno y hacer su casa propia para ahí poner su taller mecánico, este préstamo que está solicitando a Kiva le ayudará a Don Luis a mejorar sus ingresos económicos ya que lo invertirá en el pequeño negocio que es la tienda a la cual quieren surtir de víveres y productos de primera necesidad para sus clientes, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por la gran ayuda que le darán a él y toda su familia, lo que les permitirá tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a Canton located in the northwesten part of  Pichincha, Ecuador.  It grows a bit each day.  In this Canton there is a lot of commerce.  Luis lives and works here.  He is 43 years old and has 5 children, 2 of whom are from a prior relationship. He is currently in a solid relationship with his common-law wife with Leydi.  She is 22 years old and does not work.  She has a small store in their house, and she cares for the 3 children they have together. 

Luis has an auto repair shop where he spends a great deal of his time.  He learned how to do this work very young along with his older brothers, as they were mechanics.  He works around 10 hours per day, so he does not have much free time.  He really enjoys working out and when he has a bit of time after work, he exercises and spends time with his family.  His work as a mechanic is not very hard for him because he has been doing it for many years and knows a lot about it.  What is most difficult for him is when he has to change the tires on a large car.  It is dangerous because the jack can slip and the car could slam into him. 

Luis has many dreams he would like to realize like buying land and building his own home where he could put his auto repair shop.  This loan that he is requesting from Kiva will have Luis improve his income.  He will invest it in the small store he has which stocks basic necessities for their customers.  He is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the great help they provide to him and his family, which will allow them to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items to stock his store.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se llama este grupo, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando y luchando por ir mejorando sus vidas.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir trabajando y luchando. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y es de esa forma que obtiene los ingresos que necesita para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Maria pide de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas de prendas, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Renacer ("Reborn"), and they are in their third loan cycle.  They are doing their part to end poverty; three of their group are currently living below the poverty line and are continuing to work and fight to improve their lives.

The featured borrower in this group is Maria.  During the last survey, she was included within the first level of the poverty scale, meaning that she needs to continue fighting and working.  She makes a living selling various clothing items.  In doing this, she is able to earn the income she needs to support her family.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy various articles of clothing.  This will help her to refine her business plan, which will ultimately allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is 20 years old and from Baggao, Cagayan. She is studying for a BS degree in Education at the Cagayan State University. She wants to finish her studies to help her parents and give them a better way of living. Her parents’ source of income is farming and a sari sari store. With 5 children, her parents struggle to support her studies. That’s why, to continue her schooling, she seeks financial assistance of P15,000 from the KIVA lenders. She hopes that lenders will approve her loan, for this will be a big help to her parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old, she has two children of 11 and 13 years which are studying middle school and for them, she works hard every day. Beatriz`s husband works as an employee and his salary is not enough to cover the family expense, especially the education of their children, for this reason Beatriz decided to start her own business of selling fresh chicken 3 years ago. Through the time Beatriz began to have more clients and they started to request for another type of products like meat and vegetables. With their small incomes, she invested in increasing her business capacity, but she had some problems. She had to decide between her family expenses like her kids education or to invest in her business.

** Beatriz requires a loan of $375Dlls to purchase products like meat, chicken and greenness to increase her sales, because in these Christmas season she hopes a bigger increment of her demand. Beatriz and her children thank your support.

** ** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

** Beatriz tiene 34 años, con dos niños de 11 y 13 años los cuales se encuentran estudiando la secundaria y por los que trabaja duro todos los días. El esposo de Beatriz trabaja como empleado de una refaccionaría y su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia, especialmente la educación de sus hijos, por lo que Beatriz se lleno de valor e inicio su propio negocio vendiendo pollo fresco; hace ya 3 años. A través del tiempo Beatriz comenzó a tener más clientes y empezaron a pedirle otro tipo de productos como carne y verduras. Con sus pocos ingresos invirtió en aumentar su capacidad, pero se enfrento con algunos problemas. Tuvo que decidir entre los gastos del hogar como la educación de sus pequeños o invertir en el negocio.

** Beatriz requiere de un préstamo de $375Dlls para comprar más producto como la carne, pollo y verdura para aumentar sus ventas, ya que en estas épocas navideñas espera un mayor incremento de su demanda. Beatriz y sus hijos agradecen tu ayuda.

**

loans.use: purchase products like meat, chicken and greenness

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The initial deposit for a milk van

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is married with four children. She lives on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, in the place called Lumo. After finishing  primary education, she was married to a carpenter. Her parents could not afford her further education costs. After being married, Selina could not stand being a housewife alone. She started a cloth selling shop with the aim of generating income for the family, as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover all family requirements, especially school fees for their children. It is now the fourth year since she started this business. She has experienced minimal improvements for all that period, due to competition she faces from nearby opened shops selling clothes. Selina has discovered unique competencies, usage of which can outperform her competitors. First is to have enough stock of frequently purchased clothes and second is to order new fashionable clothes that competitors could not order. These strategies need additional funding. She is in need of USD 750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virgina, 49 years old, is one of the many enterprising women in Paraguay. She works selling homemade sweets (jellies) she makes from the fruits of the season. She has been doing this work for more than 27 years. Her business is located in a very busy area which brings her lots of sales. She spends the weekends preparing large quantities of her jellies in order to sell them during the following week.

Virginia is a very dynamic, active and creative woman. She continually looks to diversify the products she sells and has had great results, thanks to the variety of fruit available in Paraguay: strawberries, oranges, pomelos, mandarines, mangos, etc.

These days Doña Virginia is eager to continue expanding her business and wishes to obtain a loan in order to enlarge her stall and increase the variety of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Virginia de 49 años, es una de las tantas mujeres luchadoras de nuestro país. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces caseros (mermeladas) hechos a base de frutas de estación, y lo hace ya desde más de 27 años. Su negocio está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia por lo que el movimiento de sus venta es muy alto. Ella dedica los fines de semana para elaborar en gran cantidad sus dulces para venderlos posteriormente en la semana.

Virginia, es una señora muy dinámica, activa y creativa, ya que en todo momento busca diversificar sus productos que vende y según manifestó esto le resulta debido a que en nuestro país existe mucha diversidad de frutas, tales como la frutillas, naranjas, pomelos, mandarinas (una variedad de fruta cítrica muy dulce), mangos, ananá, etc.

Hoy día, Doña Virginia, está deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio, y desea obtener un préstamo para así poder ampliar su puesto de ventas y aumentar la variedad de sus productos.

loans.use: Contruction and enlargement of the stall where she sells her products

loans.name: Tufue

texts.en:
Tufue started with a taro business, and then switched to raising pigs because she believed that raising pigs is much cheaper than looking after a taro plantation. Tufue is a very religious lady who is very committed to her church activities and looking after her children. She’s a fifty-three-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is also unemployed but is looking after their family cocoa plantation and helping Tufue with her business.

With her years in business, she feels that it needs improvement. She is now requesting a loan to build a proper shelter for her pigs. She’s now got 6 female pigs who will be giving birth soon, and she is very concerned about protecting her piglets. Tufue’s regular customers are people at church, her friends, and relatives. To keep her business growing, she believes that giving a good price to her customers will make them come and buy from her again.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a proper shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Eya K. was born in Tchékpo. Married and the mother of four children, she began selling rice and cooked beans in Akoin (Alinka) after about four years of high school. Her husband, a soldier, is unable to meet the needs of the household because of his low salary. With no means of buying supplies of rice and beans, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan of $200. She would then be able to increase her sales and help her husband, all for the well-being of the family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame K. Eya est née à Tchékpo. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle a commencé la vente du riz et du haricot cuit à Akoin, (Alinka). Après ses études secondaires, environ 4 ans. Son mari soldat, n’arrive pas à satisfaire le foyer à cause de son maigre salaire. Faute de moyens pour faire un stockage du riz et haricot, elle sollicite un crédit de $200. Cette réalisation lui procurera une augmentation de ses revenus et aider son mari pour le bien-être de la famille.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and beans

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru:
Mipsharif Saloevich A. has been selling clothes on the market for 17 years. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is not employed and the clothes business is the primary source of income for the Asrarov family. At first he was purchasing clothes in credit from the wholesalers and selling them at the market. However, due to the competition on the market Mr. A. was forced to find an alternative lending source... In the beginning of 2005 he found out about the credit program "Microintrest". Mr. A. received a loan and with that money was able to purchase goods from wholesalers without credit, which resulted in lower prices. After receiving more loans he was able to import the goods himself, bypassing the wholesaler altogether. Currently Misharif A. regularly travels to Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) himself to import the clothes he will sell at the market. He also sells clothes in credit to the small merchants from kishlaks (mountain villages) which is profitable for both parties. A part of the income he uses to support his family, but majority he has dedicated to expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Асроров Миршариф Салоевич в течение 17 лет торгует на вещевом рынке. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена не работает, не имеет постоянного дохода. Торговля на рынке основной доход семьи.
