They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for business

loans.name: Young

texts.en: Young S. is a 41-year-old married woman, who lives in the Siem Reap Province. She owns a small store in Phnoum Krom village, which is full of people, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit of approximately US$4 a day to help her family meet their daily expenses with more stability. Her husband works as a motor taxi driver in his community. This couple has one kid, who is attending school. Presently, her husband’s motorcycle is breaking down very often while he is providing transportation services. Young S. will use her loan to help her husband buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: C7575 Coparimiga Group

texts.en:
Theresie, 36 years old, is married and has 7 children between 4 and 15 years old. She also cares for 3 relatives. Theresie and her husband are both farmers but he breeds many varieties of animals.  Theresie is the president of a group called “Coparimiga” whose members are all farmers working within the agricultural business. Theresie has had 13 successful years in this business and employs 80 people to help her.

Theresie has requested a loan to pay her farmers' salaries, buy fertilizer and employ new staff. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits and will use this money to buy land to farm.

loans.use: to pay her farmers' salaries, buy fertilizer and employ new staff

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman with seven children, two of whom graduated from school, while five still attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For over twenty years, she has operated a poultry business of laying chickens and broilers. In addition she does farming, growing grains and vegetables for sale, which contributes to her other source of income. Nora faces a major challenge of availability of markets for her produce. Her customers are the local neighbors and passerby. She hopes to become the leading supplier of broilers and layers in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to eradicate poverty and improve her social status in the society.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fund the operations of hamburger & siopao business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 33 years old. She is a married, and has 2 children aged 5 and 11. In 2006, Marian established her plastic slippers business. She began her business with the view of getting enough money to help her husband support their family. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.Marian requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 3, and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ana and her husband have three children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Ana runs a successful “miscellaneous” store, mostly selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, Ana plans to purchase clothing, shoes, perfume, accessories and jewelry to sell for a small profit to her friends and neighbors.

This is Ana’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve the home life of her family. With the profits, she hopes to rebuild her home and reinvest in her business. 

Ana hopes to continue her dream as a businesswoman; she wants to have a very improved, big store. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Mujeres Luchadoras group!

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Nooretet

texts.en: Nooretet is 34 years old and married with five children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the past eight years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member where she lives. She has applied for the her third loan which she intends to use to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and, also, to buy a few cows for fattening. Nooretet dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: La señora Azucena es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo donde se encuentran los santuarios de la mariposa monarca, ella cuenta con 72 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Gerardo y tuvieron 11 hijos ya todos casados pero que le ayudan con los gastos de su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora porque pese a su edad ella sigue constante en su trabajo ella dice “mi trabajo me anima a seguir adelante abecés ya no veo muy bien pero yo le hecho ganas para hacer mas bordados artesanales para venderlos y la gente se sienta orgullosa de mi y yo misma sentirme bien y no estar atenida al dinero que mis hijos me dan”, comenta que con el préstamo ella comprara hilos, marquice, ganchos, agujas etc. Ella hace carpetas, servilletas, almohadones, manteles y más. Ofrece sus costuras en su población y cuando es temporada de turistas en los meses de noviembre a febrero sube al santuario a vender sus costuras artesanales. La meta que tiene doña Azucena es poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para ya no salir ya que por su edad se le dificulta trasladarse rápidamente de un lugar a otro. Ella esta agradecida por este préstamo que le están otorgando ya que así ella tiene una fuente de empleo con la cual puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Azucena is originally from Ocampo, where the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuaries are found. She is 72 years old, married to Gerardo, and they have 11 children who are all married but who help them with the costs of their home. She is a very hardworking woman who in spite of her age continues to work. She says "my work motivates me to move ahead. Sometimes I don't see well, but I'm determined to make more artisan embroidery to sell and people are proud of me and I feel good about myself when I'm not dependent on the money my kids give me". She comments that with the loan she will by thread, frames, hooks, needles, etc. She makes cloths, napkins, pillow covers, tablecloths and more. She offers her products to the local people and when it is tourist season, from November to February, she goes up to the sanctuary to sell her artisan embroidery. Azucena's goal is to put a grocery store in her home so that she doesn't have to leave, since because of her age she has trouble getting from one place to another quickly. She is thankful for the loan that has been given to her since she will have a source of employment which will enable her to help her husband with the costs of the home.

loans.use: to make artisan embroidery

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married to Raphael, who is a businessman in Ndarachi village in Thika town. 

She has a motorcycle transport business that she has employed someone to run since she is employed. She has four children and has been in the transport business for a period of six years with an income of 19,600 KES a month.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd., and she wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land with some other group members as they decided to pool the resources together so that they can buy the land. Once they have bought the land they will subdivide it amongst themselves so that each members can do as they please with their specific portion. 

She hopes to own rental houses and give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land as a group.

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus” which means “God’s Plan” in English. It is composed of 5 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Rebecca is 34 years old and the mother of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 9. Three of them attend school. Rebecca operates a general store. She has been active in her business since 1990.  She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in 2010, and has received five loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Rebecca’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $80 per week. She intends to use the next loan to increase her inventory by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar and milk to resell at a profit to increase income. As there is high demand, her ambition is to open a larger store in her area.

loans.use: to increase stock by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Née en 1976 au Bénin, Jacqueline est mariée à Isaac un conducteur Auto. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Jacqueline assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Jacqueline a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jacqueline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, conserves, condiments de sauce, haricot, riz, etc.). Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Jacqueline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Jacqueline avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jacqueline was born in Benin in 1976 and is married to Issac, a car driver. They have five children, who all attend school and are in their care. Jacqueline lives with her husband and her children. The parents share the various household expenses. Jacqueline attended school until secondary level.

In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Jacqueline sells various products like soap, canned food, sauce condiments, beans, rice, etc. In order to boost her activity level and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan. Jacqueline has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy various articles like soap and canned food.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, 38 years old, is married and living in the village of Ambalatungan Santiago. Patricia has three children and they are generally school-age. Patricia’s spouse works as a farmer.

Patricia has been in the business of hog raising for two years. She is grateful for the big improvement of her business because through that she is able to sustain the school fees of her children. According to her, she is earning about PHP 3,000 when she sells one of her raised animals.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed needed by her hogs. Also, she is planning to use some of the amount for the maintenance of their rice farming activity.

In the future, Patricia hopes that she can borrow bigger capital for her to purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 45 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Juan de 24 y Flor de 17 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque era muy joven, Yolanda no dejó que las necesidades de dinero que tenía la venzan, es así que logro juntar un poco de dinero y poner su propio negocio de venta de comida. Ahora tiene muchos clientes, ya que sus deliciosos tamales y Juanes que prepara  son muy solicitados y consumidos por sus comensales, quienes también aprovechan en tomar algo helado que les ayude a sobre llevar el intenso calor de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ella se esmera mucho en complacerlos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el ardiente sol todos los días. Para un futro cercano, espera poder comprar una carrito de comida, donde pueda trasladar sus cosas con mayor facilidad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder continuar con su trabajo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children, 24 year-old Juan and 17 year-old Flor, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Although she was very young, Yolanda didn't let her financial problems beat her.  She managed to put together a small amount of money and set up her own business selling meals.  Now she has a lot of customers and the delicious tamales and 'juanes' (a traditional chicken-based dish) that she prepares are very much in demand with her customers who also enjoy a little frozen something to help them beat the intense heat of the city of Pucallpa.

What Yolanda most enjoys about her work is serving her customers.  She takes great pains to keep them happy.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to remain under the burning sun every day.  In the near future, she hopes to be able to buy a food cart so she can move her things more easily.

This is Yolanda's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive support from each and every one of you so that she can continue in her work.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more ingredients for preparing her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her meals

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a freelance sweet and candies distributor since 2007. He sells his products to multiple mini-markets located in different areas and villages. With his business income, he is able to help his family pay the high costs of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional sweets and candies in order to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is willing to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional sweets and candies

loans.name: Nance

texts.en:
Nance is 25 years old and she lives in the airport community. She is married and has children between the ages of 2 and 6. They are living with her and going to school.

For the past five years she has been selling rice, cooking oil, charcoal and plastic bags. She likes her business because it provides for her needs and her husband also sells along with her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business. Her plan is to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 37-year-old married woman with 2 children, one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Dung's husband earns a living as a truck driver. 

Dung earns an income to support her family by selling basic goods such as rice cake, instant noodles, snack foods, shampoos, soaps and soft drinks, from the front of her house. Dung would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of these items directly from wholesalers so that she can sell her products at more competitive prices. She believes that this will help her attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

Dung hopes that through this loan she will earn a higher income and be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16,13 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico en el cual realizan diversos trabajos como construcción de carrocerías para todo tipo de carros, pero  nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ellos mas trabajan  con carrocerías y pintura de autobuses,  para realizar estos trabajos ellos tiene que contratar hasta dos o tres operarios a los cuales los pagan un sueldo. Su esposo lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pinturas, hierro, sueldas y otros productos necesarios para realizar sus trabajos. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a su esposo en su trabajo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que no les falte trabajo.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, the Desarollo Femenino ["Women's Development"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. This region is known for its rich gastronomy and its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants are farmers and general merchants.

Here we meet Señora Mercedes. She is 43, married, and has three children from this relationship. They are 16, 13 and 8. The oldest two are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is an industrial mechanic.

Our friend is taking out a loan to help her husband, who has a mechanic's shop where he does various work such as bodywork for all types of cars, but our friend tells us that the majority of their work is bodywork and paint jobs for buses. Do do this work, they have to contract up to two or three skilled workers, whom they pay a salary. Mercedes' husband has done this work for over 20 years.

This loan is for buying paints, grills, welding and other products necessary to do their work. She has been a member of the community bank for 9 years, and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to help her husband in his work.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and for them to not lack for work.

loans.use: to purchase paints, grills, welding, etc.

loans.name: Jiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
JIGUITOUGOU sont constitué de six femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne  4 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents. 
Madame SIRA, qui fait le commerce de  condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe de femmes  JIGUITOUGOU, est la deuxième debout une boite de concentrée de tomate en main.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 cartons de cube Maggi, 25 kg de sel gemme, 100 kg d’oignons, 2 paniers de choux frais, 5 paniers de tomates fraiches, 10 boites de concentrées de tomate  et 2 colis autres petits condiments(fièfiè, poivre, feuille de baobab) au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
 Elle effectue sa vente au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant en détail et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: JIGUITOUGOU is composed of six married women who are on average 35 years old, have 4 children, and live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third largest administrative region of Mali). They are on their fourth loan from microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, after having paid back the previous loans in a timely manner. Mrs SIRA, who sells condiments, is pictured second from right with a canned good of tomatoes in her hand. She plans to use her loan to purchase 3 cartons of Maggi bouillon cubes, 25 kilos of salt, 100 kilos of onions, 2 baskets of fresh cabbage, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 10 boxes of tomato concentrate and 2 boxes of other condiments (peppers, boabab leaves). These items are generally purchased at the large market in the city of Sikasso and the surrounding villages, and sold in Sikasso markets as well as through family connections to a largely female clientele by cash or credit. She hopes to achieve monthly revenues of 40,000 FCFA (approximately 83 USD), a portion of which will be used to pay back the interest on her loan and the other portion will be deposited into her savings account.

loans.use: purchase food products

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 33 años, convive con Maritza de 22 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza en el distrito de Pichari. Él se destaca por ser un hombre muy entusiasta y emprendedor, ya que desde muy joven estuvo interesado por los trabajos del campo. El ver que sus vecinos obtenían buenas ganancias cultivando cacao y café, él también decidió emprender éste trabajo. Es así que aprovecho el terreno que su padre le cedió, y desde entonces cosecha café y cacao, y eso le ha ayudado a obtener ganancias y con ello derivarlo para los gastos del hogar. Él comenta, que en un inicio fue muy duro, pero gracias a la ayuda de su esposa y de algunos peones que contrato logró a tiempo terminar su faena en el campo. Ahora ha decidido ampliar la siembra de café y cacao. Se siente feliz con la labor que realiza, porque gracias a ello podrá al fin contruir su vivienda, asimismo dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, podrá comprar madera para empezar con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Alfredos is 33 years old and lives with Maritza who is 22 years old and with whom he has 2 children.  Together they live in their own house, located in the community of Nueva Forteleza (New Strength) in the district of Pichari.  He is known for being a very enthusiastic and enterprising man, since from his youth he has been interested in working in the fields.  Seeing that his neighbors were earning good profits cultivating cacao and coffee, he also decided to undertake this work.  That is how he took advantage of the land that his father granted him, and since then he has harvested coffee and cacao and that has helped him to earn profits and use them for household expenses.  He comments that in the beginning it was very difficult, but thanks to the help of his wife and some laborers he contracted, he succeeded in finishing his tasks in the field on time.  Now, he has decided to expand the sowing of coffee and cacao.  He feels content with the work he does, because thanks to that, he will finally be able to to construct his home, as well as give a good education to his children.  This will be his first loan with MFP, for which he promises to be punctual with his payments.  With the 1,000 soles that he is requesting, he will be able to purchase wood in order to start with the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school and one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a vegetable grocery business for the past five years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a bigger vegetable grocery in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase a grocery stand and to buy small packets of Omo detergent for sale. She decided to join Yehu to acquire working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery stand and small packets of Omo detergent to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 49 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children. For the past six years, he has worked hard at managing his retail shop, where he sells food and supplies people use in their homes. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more food to sell. His goals are to increase his profits and improve his family's quality of life. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but run businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married to Charles and together they have two children, aged six and three.  Elizabeth owns a retail shop and has been in the business for the past year.  She earns a monthly income of KES 24,000 from the business.

This is her first loan term in KADET.  She will use the loan to buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour for the business.  She will use the anticipated profit to support her family and reinvest in the business.  Her dream is to have a stable cash flow to meet her family needs.

loans.use: to buy stock, like sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta D. mariscos, este negocio nació hace tres años, lo aprendió en su familia y hoy en día le ayuda para generar ingresos para el hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mariscos, entre ellos pescado fresco, langostas, camarones, filete, entre otras clases D. mariscos que son del consumo D. los clientes. Esta compra le ayudara a mantener productos frescos, atender la demanda D. los clientes y estar siempre dedicada a mejorar y crecer en el comercio.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and two children; she sells seafood.  The business was born three years ago.  She learned it in her family and today it helps her earn household income.

She’s asking for a loan to buy seafood like fresh food, lobster, shrimp and fillet, among other types of seafood that customers consume.  This purchase will help her have fresh products to meet customer demand and always to be focused on improving and growing in business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, lobster, shrimp and fillets.

loans.name: Nivaldo

texts.es: Nivaldo con su credikiva anterior compró insumos para comidas rápidas, gaseosas, refrescos y otras bebidas, con los que generó mayores uitilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará bebidas y refrescos especialmente, asi como materiles para preparar sus deliciosas comidas. Está inversión planea ser muy exitosa porque es la época futbolera de Colombia y su negocio está justamente muy cerca al estadio metropolitano de Barranquilla donde juega el equipo amado de la costa Caribe y es allí donde se llevarán a cabo las eliminatorias del mundial del 2014 en Brazil. Su mensaje a los financiadores es que se siente muy agradecido con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espera seguir contando con el apoyo económico´para continuar progresando él y su familia.
texts.en: Nivaldo used his previous Kiva loan to purchase ingredients for fast foods, along with soft drinks and other refreshments, with which he generated increased profits. Currently, he is applying for his second Kiva loan, with which he will purchase soft drinks and other refreshments, especially, along with ingredients to prepare his delicious foods. This investment should be very successful, since it is soccer (football) season in Colombia and his business is located right next to the Barranquilla metropolitan stadium, where the local team is beloved along the Caribbean coast, and where qualifying rounds of the 2014 World Cup in Brazil will be played. His message to his financial backers is that he feels very grateful towards Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], and he hopes to continue counting on their economic support so that he and his family can continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and other refreshments, especially, along with ingredients to prepare his delicious foods.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a 45 year old married woman with eleven children, six of whom attend school while the rest are grown up. Her husband is a mechanic who contributes to the basic provisions the family needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Biasha has operated as a food vendor for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, ya que quiere comprar más mercadería para las pupusas, ya que este negocio le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia, por medio de los préstamos adquiere los materiales necesarios como aceite, maíz, chicharrón, chocolate, refrescos naturales, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Ella está contenta porque los préstamos anteriores le han permitido crecer y mejorar la clientela, cambiando su condición y permitiéndole con las ventas cancelar las cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Ana has decided to take out a new loan to invest in her business. She would like to buy more merchandise for her pupusa business as it has helped her to provide for her family. Through her loans Ana acquires the materials she needs such as oil, corn, chicharrón (pork), chocolate and natural drinks, to meet her customer demand. She is happy because her previous loans have allowed her to expand and improve her customer base. She has improved her condition and, through her sales, she has managed to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, chicharrón, chocolate and natural drinks

loans.name: Carmen Lidia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 42 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.
Desde hace unos meses que Carmen necesita un equipo de computo, ya que se le dificulta sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Es por eso que Carmen está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para la compra de un equipo de computo y asi facilitarles a sus hijos y a ella el hacer sus trabajos, para que continúen con sus estudios y puedan llegar a ser grandes profesionales.
Carmen es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 and lives with her family in the community of San Carlos, in the Costa Rican province of Alajuela.  She lives in an area that occupies the first place nationally in the production of coffee and sugar cane.  The area also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers and vegetables.  The Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located in this province.

For several months Carmen has needed new computer equipment to facilitate her children's upbringing.  For this reason, Carmen is requesting a loan of $1200 (597000 CRC) to purchase computer equipment that her children can use to do their schoolwork.  This will allow them to continue their studies and become professionals.  

Carmen is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of El Encanto de Pital and it is her first loan through one of the 150 branches of Kiva partner EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a computer and furniture.

loans.name: Jhoanna Gricelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoanna es socia del banco comunal Los Angeles y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora Jhoanna tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
 
Doña Jhoanna se dedica a la venta de confitería, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años, ella es quien fabrica los productos como maní dulce, cocadas, manjar de leche y otros dulces, esta actividad la aprendió en cursos y trabaja de lunes a sábados.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de cocos, maní, leche, azúcar, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a member of the Los Angeles communal bank and lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important city in the country and, since December of 1999, is a Cultural Heritage Site. The people are friendly, kind and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Jhoanna is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage and has conceived four children who are now 19, 13, 11 and 5 years old. Her first son is married and lives on his own. Her second son studies in the city secondary school and her last two children in one of the city’s primary schools. Her husband is a merchant. They do not own their own home and live renting.

Jhoanna sells confectionaries, which she has done for 3 years. She makes products like sugared peanuts, cocadas (coconut candies), caramel pudding and other sweets. She learned this business through courses and she works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is her third loan with the communal bank, and she will invest the loan in buying coconuts, peanuts, milk, sugar etc. for her business.

Her goal is to construct her own home.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, peanuts, milk, sugar etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Patria, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

Antonia pertenece al banco comunal “Mercaditos de Patria” de la ciudad de Patria. Ya son dos años que trabaja con la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Patria de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Desde la ciudad del Cusco a nuestro destino hay una distancia de 200 Km. (aproximado nueve horas de viaje) hasta llegar a la localidad de Patria. Durante el viaje cruzaremos parte de la cordillera andina Peruana, observaremos hermosos valles interandinos, comunidades indígenas andinas quechuas y camino a la Reserva de Biosfera del Parque Nacional del Manu. 

En esta oportunidad Antonia requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Antonia es comprar una casa y abrir una tienda de abarrotes.  

Antonia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Antonia is 28, has two children, and lives in the city of Patria. She does agricultural work and raises cattle. Antonia belongs to the "Mercaditos de Patria" communal bank in Patria. She has been working with Asociación Arariwa for two years now, and it's going very well. The meetings for members of the communal bank are held once a month in Patria, which is in Paucartambo Province in the department of Cusco. 

From Cusco to get to Patria it is a distance of 200 km (approximately nine hours of travel). During the trip the traveler crosses part of the foothills of the Peruvian Andes, seeing along the way beautiful mountain valleys, indigenous Andean Quechua communities, and the road to the Biosphere Reserve in Manu National Park. 

At this time Antonia needs a loan to purchase seeds, manure and other items. Her dream is to buy a house and open a grocery store. Antonia appreciates and values the loan and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and other items.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school located in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 11,500,000 leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Fifty-six-year-old Tamba is a native of Wordu, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has two children who are attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Tamba has been a school teacher for 36 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children. He will use the rest to buy house building materials, such as cement, for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children and to buy house building materials, such as cement, for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 25 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kagwe village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Nancy works as a peasant farmer for a living. Her community of Kagwe village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Nancy is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Nancy represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Nancy and four other promoters in her community, namely Joshua, Siprina, Eunice and Lodphine, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Nancy wants to be a promoter because she  believes that the chlorine will destroy germs in water, therefore making it safe to use. She hopes that this will make the community healthier, thus allowing community members to attend work and school.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Nancy’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Elizabeth. Elizabeth is a hardworking farmer from the Matunda location, which is situated in the North Rift area of Kenya. She is married and has been for 18 years, and she has four children. 

Ten years ago, she started farming as a means to support her husband to provide for their family. Currently, her 2.5 acre farm has two dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry, 15 trees and a well. Elizabeth's main income source is milk. However, she faces serious challenges transporting her produce to the market. Her solution to her biggest challenge is a Kiva loan to purchase a basic motorcycle.

With your loan investment, the motorcycle will provide a cheap and convenient means of transport for Elizabeth's produce. The motorcycle will also open other income generation opportunities for Elizabeth's family such as the ferrying of goods and passengers at a small fee.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the transportation of milk to the market

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is a divorcee aged 45 who looks after 2 children, her child and a nephew aged 13 and 4 respectively. She resides in Chitungwiza where she has a home based business since 2005.

The applicant specialises in selling potatoes at a good profit margin of 50%. She solely relies on this business for the upkeep of the family and school fees requirements of her child.

The applicant intends to use the loan in the purchase of her business stocks.

loans.use: Buying and selling of potatoes in exchange for kitchen ware and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Halima is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Halima would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Halima will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Halima now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and her family members, and would like to use this additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell the maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Enabulele

texts.en: Mrs. D. Enabulele, a 42 years old caterer in one of the ancient streets in Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her environment. She planned to improve her business with food ingredients for preparing food for sale to the public.

loans.use:
To buy food ingredients for preparing food 
for sale to the public

loans.name: Aditodokoin

texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Afagnagan, Aditodokoin A. was widowed at a young age and now has six children to care for, plus two grandsons, after her oldest daughter left for Lomé to look for work. Selling sodabi (a local drink made with palm) has made her a well-known woman in her community.

Despite being illiterate, she runs her business well, and is presently requesting a $550 loan to buy drums of sodabi, which she plans to resell. With the income from these sales, she will increase her saving capability and improve the living conditions of her large family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Afagnagan, Madame A. Aditodokoin est devenue très tôt veuve avec six (06) orphelins à sa charge et deux petits fils laissés par sa fille aînée partie à Lomé pour chercher du travail. La vente de sodabi (boisson locale à base de palmier) fait d’elle une femme bien connue dans sa localité. Malgré son statut d’analphabète, elle possède une expérience en matière de gestion des activités.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter des bidons de sodabi pour revendre. Avec les revenus de sa vente, elle pourra augmenter sa capacité d’épargner et améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de toute sa grande famille.

loans.use: Purchase of drums of sodabi

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix Barbarosa is a had worker, and thanks to his Faith he started this business 10 years ago selling religious articles. He is an active man who strives every day to obtain the resources his family needs. When he started he had very little merchandise, but his business has grown and in order to increase sales he now goes to nearby small towns to offer his products, and that has produced good results. Important dates for the Church are coming and he knows that during this time his sales will increase, so that he requests a loan of $1,200 dollars to be used for the purchase of merchandise to supply the demands of his clients, offer good service and continue to grow his business. He pledges to repay the loan withing 3 to 6 months. This will be a fundamental part of the growth of his business. Felix will sincerely appreciate whatever help you can offer him.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felix B. es muy trabajador y gracias a su gran fe inició desde hace 10 años su propio negocio con la venta de artículos religiosos, él es un hombre muy activo que se esfuerza día a día para obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén de su familia, cuando empezó tenía muy poca mercancía, pero su negocio ha estado creciendo y para incrementar sus ventas sale a los poblados cercanos a ofrecer sus productos, y le ha dado resultados.

Se aproximan fechas importantes para la iglesia, y el sabe que en este tiempo se incrementan sus ventas, así que solicita un préstamo por $1,200 dólares que utilizará en la comprar de mercancía para poder surtir la demanda de sus clientes, ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Forma parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Feliz agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
"I hope to expand my business with a loan of US$ 625," says Mrs. Faith O. who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Faith is married with two children. She sells provisions, drinks and has phone cards available for people in her community.

Faith has been in this business since 1982 and has been a LAPO client for 4 years. She is 40 years old and she learnt the business from her mother.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and recharge phone cards

loans.name: Batoura

texts.fr:
Batoura B. was born on August 25, 1970, in Baguida (Golfe Prefecture). He is married and the father of one. After finishing middle school, he learned the trade of upholstery and mattress-making. But he is encountering problems getting his business going, so he is requesting a loan of $600. This amount is for acquiring quality tools, so that he can do better work. He is counting on your support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Batoura B. est né le 25 Août 1970 à Baguida dans la préfecture de Golfe, s’est marié et est père d’un enfant. Après ces études secondaires il a appris un métier en tapisserie et en matelasserie mais il rencontre des difficultés dans l’exécution de son travail et sollicite à cet effet un montant de $600.Ce montant qui va servir à acheter les outils de qualité pour mieux exercer son métier. Il compte sur votre soutient.

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Tolani

texts.en: Tolani T. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells bread and has been in this business since the year 2004. She is in need of a loan of $375 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Sandha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sandha S., 28, lives in Thecho in Lalitpur district, Nepal. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is in pre-school.

Her husband's name is Gan S.. He makes various products made of clay such as pots, jugs, plates, etc. Mrs. S. sells these goods in her shop. Now she is asking for her second loan, this time a loan of US$ 250, to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The woman’s business group, “The Hope of the East,” is located in the town of Ciudad del Este and are a band of neighbors who have come together to support each of their individual businesses. These women own businesses selling ropes and groceries like tobacco, garlic, and refreshments. Together they are working to increase profits and support their families.

These women are asking for a loan together to help increase their business profits. With the money they will purchase various groceries and ropes for their individual businesses.

loans.use: To buy rope, tobacco, garlic, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edy Noemi

texts.es:
Edy is from the city of Jauja, and after having married, moved to the city of Huancayo with her dear husband. She has set up a small handmade stove to cook pigs and sell them at her city's central plaza. The important collaboration of her partner has helped this small business be possible, and little by little, individual orders have increased. Today she also offers her services to the general public. Her hopes of bettering her small oven's facilities have led her to ask for a loan to better her service and satisfactorily meet her client's orders.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Edy, procede de la ciudad de Jauja, y luego de haber contraído matrimonio con su querido esposo se mudó en su compañía a la ciudad de Huancayo, en ella instaló un pequeño horno artesanal para dedicarse a hornear cerditos para ofertarlos en la plaza central de su ciudad.La importante colaboración de su compañero ha posibilitado la consolidación de esta pequeña ocupación y poco a poco las solicitudes particulares se han ido incrementando, ahora también ofrece sus servicios de preparación al público en general.Su deseo de mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeño horno la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su servicio y atender satisfactoriamente las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Repair and maintain Edy's small, handmade stove

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Exaltación zone of the Villa Exaltación region where Pro-Mujer is located, you will find the "Siempre Alegres" or Always Happy association. This name is right on the mark since the group was unanimously happy upon meeting each other. They also say they are always happy because Pro-Mujer offers them a huge help with the services they grant to their members.

With the help of the service consultant, Sonia Aguayo Zeballos, they have been able to make a very well organized group. The group includes several small businesses, such as stores. Others are street vendors that sell artisan chocolates and crafts. The majority of them sell clothing they bring from the Desaguedero where prices are better. Therefore, they need to invest more capital to make trips to Desaguedero or other places where wholesale goods are sold. In this manner, the merchandise acquired will result in greater profits to be reinvested in expanding their businesses.

Moreover, they need to increase their incomes to support their families. Doña Lupe's husband has passed away, and she needs to take care of her family. She and her four children are trying to improve their economic situation despite the difficult times they are going through.

This is the association’s 3rd cycle, and they hope to keep counting on these or larger loans so that they, too, can grow.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EN LA ZONA DE VILLA EXALTACION FUNCINA EN CENTRO FOCAL DEL MISMO NOMBRE QUE PRETENECE A PRO-MUJER SE ENCUENTRA LA ASOCIACION DENOMINADA "SIEMPRE ALEGRES" DENOMINACION MUY ACERTADA YA QUE EL GRUPO MOSTRO UNA ALEGRIA GENERAL AL CONOCERLOS. ALEGAN ADEMAS ESTAR SIEMPRE ALEGRES PORQUE PRO-MUJER LES BRINDA UNA GRAN AYUDA CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS QUE BRINDA A SUS SOCIOS Y CON LA AYUDA DE SU ASOSORA DE SERVICIOS SONIA AGUAYO ZEBALLOS LOGRAN FORMAR UN GRUPO MUY BIEN ORGANIZADO EL GRUO TIENE DISINTO NEGOCOS PEQUEÑOS COMO SE TIENDAS, OTROS VENDEN DE MANERA AMBULANTE CHOCOATES ARTESANALES, ARTESANIAS PERO LA MAYORIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA QUE LA TRAEN DESDE LA LOCALIDAD DEL DESAGUADERO DONDE LA ENCUENTRAN A UN PRECIO MENOR, ESTO IMPLICA QUE DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR, DE ESTA FORMA LA MERCADERIA ADQUIRIDA LES PROPORCIONARIA MEJORES INGRESOS QUE IRIAN DESTINADOS POR LO GENERAL AL CRECIMIENTO DE SUS NEGOCIOS. ADEMAS TAMBIEN LOGRAR MAYORES GANANCIAS PARA CONTRIBUIR CON LA MANUTENCION DE SUS FAMILIAS TAL ES EL CASO DE DOÑA LUPE QUE TUBO LA MALA SUERTE DE QUEDAR VIUDA Y TENER QUE TOMAR LAS RIENDAS DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA JUNTO A SUS 4 HIJOS EN INTENTAN TENER UNA MEJOR SITUACION ECONOMICA PESE A LA DIFICIL SITUACION QUE ESTAN ATRAVESANDO. LA ASOCIACION YA ESTA EN SU TERCER CICLO CON LA ESPERANZA DE QUE ESTOS CREDITOS SE MANTENGAN Y SOBRE TODO CRESCAN PARA ASI TAMBIEN ELLOS PODER CRECER

loans.use:
They need to invest more capital to make trips to the Desaguedero or other places where they can purchase products wholesale.

DEMANDAN INVERTIR MAYOR CAPITAL PARA REALIZAR VIAJES AL DESAGUEDERO U OTROS LUGARES DONDE PUEDAN ADQUIRIR PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR,

loans.name: Pili's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Pili is 27 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 1 years old. Pili sells fish. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 2am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Nuruh, who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaovi A. was born December 20th, 1984 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. She does business selling purses and bathroom tissue in Lomé’s main market. She began her business activities in 2007. To improve sales, she sometimes sells on credit to loyal customers and collects the money every eight days after the purchase. The first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy 50 purses and some bathroom tissue.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayaovi est née le 20 décembre 1984 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de vente de sacs et de papiers hygiéniques au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2007. Pour mieux vendre, elle vend parfois à ces clients fidèles à crédit et collecte l’argent chaque 8 jours qui suit la vente. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 50 sacs de sortie et quelques papiers hygiéniques.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 purses

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Berries is 56 years old and has two children, one of whom is a minor who is not currently going to school because he is not compelled to attend. The other child is studying in a public school and his wife does not live with him. 

Berries provides photography services and he also runs a confectionary from his house.

He has been working with Leon 2000 since 2001 and has had a credit of C$ 3000 Cordobas.  Up to date he has managed 11 past credits with the last one amounting to C$ 10000 Cordobas to secure working capital. His living conditions are good and he lives in his own house. His greatest dream is to have his own photography studio.


Translated from Spanish by Erika LIndig, Kiva Volunteer.






El Señor B. tiene 56 años de edad, tiene dos hijos uno de ellos menor de edad, que actualmente no esta estudiando ya que el niño no quiere, y el otro que si esta estudiando en un colegio publico, su esposa no vive con él, 
El señor B. se dedica a la actividad de servicios fotograficos, además se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de oro actividad que lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación.
El señor trabaja con fundación leon 2000 desde el año 2001, iniciando con un credito de C$ 3000 córdobas, en la actualidad a manejado 11 creditos siendo el ultimo por la suma de C$ 10,000 córdobas para capital de trabajo, sus condicones de vida son regulares, vive en casa propia. Su mayor deseo es llegar a tener su propio estudio de revelado fotografico.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has owned a small clothing business in Arusha since 2002.  She is 23 years old, married, and has two children ages 5 and one and a half.  She works daily from 9:00am to 6:00pm for a monthly profit of approximately $130.  She is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothing at bulk rates to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale in her business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna is 32 years old. She lives in the Lomas del Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She came to live in this neighborhood when she was young and it is here that she met her husband. They had two children, now ages 2 and 14. Her husband works and supports the family. Reyna has a "fritanga", which is a small food stand where she sells traditional Nicaraguan fried foods. She also sells tortillas. She has been in this business for 9 years and so far she has been able to get ahead with her family. She sells her food in the afternoon and the tortillas in the morning. It's hard work but it's profitable.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase beams and zinc sheets to make repairs to her home. The roof is in bad shape and she cannot continue to risk her family's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, desde joven vino a vivir a este barrio donde conoció a su esposo y procreó dos hijos de 2 y 14 años de edad, él trabaja y apoya a su familia. El negocio de doña Reyna es venta de fritanga y de tortillas y tiene nueve años de estar en las ventas que hasta ahora le ha permitido sobresalir con su familia, la fritanga la vende todos los días por la tarde y las tortillas desde la mañana, es un poco duro por que se agita mucho pero es rentable. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de perlines y zinc de su casa, ya que el que está lo tiene en mal estado y no puede seguir arriesgando a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase beams and zinc sheets to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrián tiene 39 años. Él tiene un taller en su casa donde se dedica a fabricar instrumentos musicales de viento, como flautas y zampoñas, desde hace más de 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposa y de un empleado.

Antes, Adrián, tenía una tienda donde vendía sus instrumentos musicales,  pero por  falta de dinero tuvo que cerrarla. Ahora sólo trabaja a pedido. 
Adrián cuenta que le gustaría continuar con su taller. El necesita un crédito que le permita seguir comprando materiales para continuar su producción.
texts.en:
Adrián is 39 years old. For more than 10 years, he has a workshop in his house where he makes wind instruments, like flutes and zampoñas (traditional Andean flutes). He has one employee, and his wife also helps him out with this business. Before, Adrián had a store where he sold musical instruments, but because of a lack of income, he had to close the store. Adrián tells us that he would like to keep his workshop running. He needs this loan to buy more materials, so that he can continue to make wind instruments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make wind instruments

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda inicio el negocio cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo ella puso una pequeña mercería, pero debido a que a veces le faltaba dinero para surtir se vio en la necesidad de cerrarla temporalmente, e inició la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, ofreciendo a sus vecinos y posteriormente a familiares que la visitaban hasta hacerme de clientes que con frecuencia le hacen pedidos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar productos y tenerlos a la venta y no descuidar a los clientes y con el apoyo de kiva surtir un pedido mas grande y empezara ahorrar.
texts.en:
Imelda started her small hardware store business when her husband was out of work. However, because she sometimes lacked money to stock her store, she saw the need to close it temporarily. She then began selling beauty products by catalog, offering them to neighbors and later to visiting family members, until she acquired customers who would frequently place orders.

Imelda needs a loan of US $225, which she will pay back in three months, in order to buy products to put up for sale and so as to not neglect her customers. With the support of Kiva, she can supply larger orders and start saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Akinyara

texts.en: Akinyara sells drinks and provisions in her shop. Akinyara has been in this business for a long time. Akinyara is 46 years old and married with 3 children. Akinyara lives in Igbelerin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO Microfinance client. Akinyara needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a responsible mother of three: Angelo, 6 years old, a day care student; Maria Elyssa, 3 years old; and Princess, 1 month old. Jenifer's husband Bernard earns an income by driving a passenger tricycle, which is the common means of transportation in their village at Sta. Filomena, San Mariano, Isabela.

Jenifer, 30 years old, manages a simple village store in their barangay. She raised the initial capital of $200 (10,000 PHP) to start the store by saving income from her poultry business. The income from the store is not enough to support their daily needs and to generate savings. So Jenifer requests a loan of $125 (6,000 PHP) which she plans to use to purchase additional commodities to sell to her customers.

Someday, Jenifer hopes to send all her children to school so they can earn a degree and not be left behind by their peers. Praying accompanied by patience and hard work will give them the best results, she said.

loans.use: Purchase additional commodities to sell in the general store

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Benigna tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y el menor D. sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 3 años tiene una tienda, la cual tuvo que abrir por la necesidad D. generarse ingresos propios para ayudar a sostener la economía D. su hogar, decisión por la que está muy satisfecha, ya que comenzó con poca mercadería y la ido aumentando poco a poco, también desea aumentar su capital vendiendo comida, dando pensión a algunos clientes que tiene. Su gran anhelo es incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio, Benigna trabaja para distraerse y colaborar con los gastos, generalmente atienD. su bodega por las tardes. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal a la que actualmente pertenece porque vieron en ella cualidades óptimas para un trabajo en equipo. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería como gaseosas al por mayor con un costo D. 200 soles, 500 soles comprará abarrotes no perecibles, y el resto será su capital para la preparación D. sus platos D. comida para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Benigna is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and their youngest child in their own home. For the past 3 years she's had a shop, which she had to open due to the need to generate her own income to help support her household economy. She is very satisfied with the decision, as she began with little merchandise and has steadily increased. She also wants to increase her capital by selling food. Her great ambition is to increase the stock of her business. Benigna works to keep herself occupied and assist with household costs, and usually works at her shop in the afternoon. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP, and was invited to be part of a community bank that she currently belongs to because the bank saw great team member qualities in her. Benigna will purchase merchandise with the money that she requests, such as soft drinks at the wholesale price of 200 soles. 500 soles will be spent on non-perishable groceries, and the rest will be used as capital for the preparation of meals for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena K. is 49 years old. She is widowed and has six children, three of whom are boys and three of whom are girls. One of the children has completed the senior high school. The others are in the primary and the junior high school. She lives with the family in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. It is entirely a farming and commercial town. Abena works to support her husband. She trades in bananas. Most of the women in the community trade in bananas and other fruits. She buys plantains from farmers in the nearby villages and sells in her community. She sells to retailers in her community in the local market. Most of her customers are food vendors. Abena has been in business for six years. It is Abena’s dream to save enough money to support her husband and take care of the family. She wants a loan to procure plantains in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure plantains for resale.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Табарова Гулнора Файзалиевна, 1979 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2000 году. Она шьет национальные и европейские платья. У нее много постоянных клиентов. Гульнора шьет платья, юбки, брюки  из разных материалов и разных фасонов.
В сезон свадебных мероприятий увеличивается спрос на шитье разнообразных национальных платьев. В такие моменты Гульноре необходимы дополнительные средства, для приобретения материалов и фурнитуры. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони и погасить его в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulnora Faizalievna T. was born in 1979 and started her business in 2000. She makes Tajik and European dresses, skirts and pants from different types of fabric and following different fashions, and she has many regular clients. Since demand for her services goes up in the wedding season, Gulnora needs extra cash for buying fabric and accessories. Gulnora is applying for a loan of 2000 somoni, which she plans to repay within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric and accessories

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Ya S. is sixty-one years old, married, and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham. She sells rice and food to earn a living and is able to make $40 in revenue per day. Her husband is a village chief and makes less than one dollar per day. This couple has five children, two of whom are moto-taxi drivers and three who are in school. Ya S. is asking for a loan to purchase gas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase gas to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with three children and supports his family by selling dried fish at the market.  John joined GHAPE in 2009 and this is his first time taking out a loan.  This loan will allow John to purchase additional fish to sell.  Because of his convenient location, he has a good customer base.  He believes his business will continue to do well.

John has faced many of life's challenges, including sickness, poverty, hunger, and thievery.  However, with the profits of this loan, he will expand his business, further his children's education, and buy needed household items for his family.  Although he is a new member, John already appreciates GHAPE for encouraging its clients to save and for its community focus.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchasing more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone K. Asang is a 60-year-old nurse who runs the Kirenget Nehemah Clinic in Molo, about 24 kms outside of Nakuru. There, he provides curative care, family planning, PAK services and a dental clinic. This will be his fifth year in private practice. He used to work for the government Ministry of Health.

On average, Johnstone sees 80-90 clients a month, depending on what services are needed. All of his clients are farmers and he says most struggle to pay even the lowest bills. He says another challenge is gaining the trust of his patients, who often are more used to traditional medicine. He is asking for 50,000 KES to purchase some instruments.

Johnstone's favorite parts of the practice are the curative and dental elements.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Pheng T. currently drives a motorcycle taxi to earn a living. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and their two lovely children in the province of Siem Reap. In addition, his wife sells a few groceries from home. Pheng T. can only generate a little profit each day because his motor is not wide-size and he can only pick up a few passengers. In order to increase his daily income, Pheng T. has decided to ask for a Kiva loan to purchase a trailer motor (tuk tuk) which he can use to transport more passengers than before. He purposes to use the rest of his loan to increase his wife’s business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer motor

loans.name: Gulguu

texts.en:
Gulguu C. is 49, married, and the mother of three. Her two youngest daughters are university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter has just graduated from university and came back home.

Besides running a small family cafe, Gulguu, together with her eldest daughter, started running a copy center in a small rental place. She says that "My eldest one just graduated from the university. Now my two youngest ones are university students. It is hard to pay all our profit for their tuition for many years. I and my husband have been working hard for the last ten years. Although we invested all our profit in our children's future, I hope that one day our living conditions will be improving."

With this loan she will buy a new copier machine and raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy a Canon copier machine and raw materials

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is 46 years old and still single. She owns and manages a general store in her village. One of her dreams is to improve and develop her store into a bigger one in order to generate more income for her family's needs.

Anacleta is now requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP12,000 as additional capital. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of merchandise to meet her customers' demands. She is happy that through her business, she has been able to assist her parents financially.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the needed materials and equipment for tailoring.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita A. is from the village of Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Paulita owns and operates a business raising vegetables, primarily planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Paulita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Paulita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Reina Beatriz

texts.es: Reina Beatriz Z. D. M. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos. Reina posee 4 años D. trabajar en su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos perecederos, cabe mencionar que dicho negocio esta ubicado en su lugar D. habitación. Reina solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que desea aumentar el número D. productos D. su tienda y D. esta manara brindar una mayor gama D. productos, y así poder posicionarse como la mejor tienda del lugar y que todos los vecinos la prefieran.
texts.en:
Reina Beatriz Z. D. M. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and two children. Reina has had her own business for 4 years. She sells perishable goods in her general store, which is located in her house. Reina is seeking this loan in order to improve sales because she wants to increase her goods and offer a greater spectrum of products. Thus, hers can become the best store in the area that all the customers prefer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Amani  borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 38 year old woman, she  is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 14 and 12 years  old.

Rose has owned a fruits business for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rose`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania, she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rose hopes to save more money, pay school fess and  expand her business

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg T. lives with her husband and three grown-up children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her eldest son is 28-year-old and drives a private cab in the city. Her 25-year-old daughter stays home and takes care of the family. Her youngest son is 24-year-old and a student at a local university called “Guur."

Uranchimeg sells sunglasses and windows insulation materials at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor black market in Ulaanbaatar. She says that by selling these products, sunglasses and insulation materials, she hedges the seasonal income fluctuation in her business. Sunglasses sell well during the warm season, whereas the windows insulation materials are sold during cold seasons.

Her eldest son helps with her business and brings products for her business. Since the start in 1999, she has been doing well in the business and her capital has increased from 300,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT. She says she aims to make enough profit to pay for her youngest son's tuition. She requests a loan to purchase more windows insulation as the cold season approaches in Mongolia.

loans.use: Purchase  insulation materials.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia J. D. F. resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután vive con su esposo y sus hijos viven con su madre, para Rosa es muy difícil separarse D. sus hijos y verlo únicamente los fin D. semanas ya que por su trabajo y por motivos económicos ha decido que el mejor lugar para que sus hijos puedan ser cuidados en casa D. su madre, es por eso que Rosa trabaja muy duro para mejorar su situación económica y poder traer D. nuevo sus hijos a su hogar, para esto también necesita D. un crédito que le permita aumentar su inventario en ropa interior para mejorar sus ventas D. esta manera tambien sus ingresos mejoraran.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia J. D. F. lives in the Usulután department with her husband. Her children live with her mother. It is very difficult for Rosa to be separated from her children and only see them on the week ends. Because of her work and for economic reasons she has decided that the best place for her children to be taken care of is in her mother’s house. That is why Rosa works so hard to improve her economic situation to be able to bring her children home again. To do this she also needs a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory of underwear. This will improve her sales and her income will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with clothes

loans.name: Marily

texts.en:
