Marily B., 35 years old, is requesting for a loan to start a business selling fish. Despite her poverty, she has not stopped thinking of ways to achieve her dreams for her family, especially for her children. Instead giving in to her fears about life being poor, she has decided to play her productive role as a woman to be able to send all of her four children to college until graduation. Her children are now  whose age ranges from six to 12 years old.
For all of her years as a member of ASHI, she wishes to get more after repaying the others, so she can sustain the growth of her business and make more profits. By then, she hopes to purchase a lot where they can build a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy a larg volume of  fish to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor V. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 55 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Victor owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Victor has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Victor joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victor is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karen Noemy

texts.es:
Karen Noemy H. Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 19 años, está  en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 8 meses. El crédito lo quiere para al compra de abono para asistir una plantación de café. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron. Doña Karen trabaja también en una soda, estudia y se dedica a la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Karen Noemy H. Rodríguez, 19, is married by common law and has one son, who is her biggest priority. Her son is 8-months-old. She would like this credit to buy fertilizer to assist with her coffee crop. She wants to give her crop adequate maintenance so she will have a bigger production and therefore more income. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the ease with which they gave it to her. Doña Karen also works at a soda (a small restaurant), goes to school, and practices agriculture. In the future, she hopes to offer her son and all of her family a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Pure Joy Group

texts.en: Bernice is twenty-three years old. She is single but has one child who has yet to start school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Bernice is a fish seller. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Pure Joy. The members of the group are mainly traders. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand businesses.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma T. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Norma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Norma runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2008, Norma joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Las 11 integrantes del grupo Luz y Vida pertenecen al Centro Focal Los Andes, elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante el precente ciclo organizadas por sus líderes, presidenta, tesorera y Secretaría de Actas, llevan adelante su reunión. Ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de acceder al préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de maní, ropa, carne, comida, elaboración de calzados, tejido a máquina de prendas de vestir y venta de lubricantes. Todas quieren mejorar sus negocios comprando mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
The 11 members of the group "Luz y Vida" (Light and Life) belong to the Los Andes regional office of ProMujer. They developed their internal working rules during the previous loan cycle. They are organized around their leaders: President, Treasurer and Secretary, who run their meetings. They formed the group in order to access a loan to invest in their businesses. All of them have diverse businesses such as: the sale of peanuts, clothing, meat and food, the production of shoes, the sewing of garments, and the sale of lubricants. All of them want to improve their businesses by buying merchandise or raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Ester Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Ester vive en un barrio de la capital que se llama 380. Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, su negocio es un cafetín que tiene en su casa de habitación vende hot dog, hamburguesa, repostería, frescos, gaseosas, jugos, café y alquila teléfono, pues gracias a Dios ha ido incrementando su negocio ahora con ayuda de sus dos hijos que están trabajando y que ha logrado hacer clientela. Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar dos puertas para la sala. Ahora desea comprar materiales de soldadura y poder poner el portón de metal en la entrada de su casa para reguardar la seguridad, ya que la delincuencia asecha en el barrio, lo cual es una necesidad el poder terminar esta obra. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder hacer aparte el local para el cafetín ya que desde la cocina de su casa despacha lo cual desea dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y espera lograrlo con los financiamiento que Afodenic otorgue
texts.en:
Mrs. Ester lives in a neighborhood called 380 in the capital city. She is 61 years old and the single mother of three children. Her business is an eatery setup in her house. She sells hot dogs, hamburgers, pastries, drinks, sodas, juices, coffee and also rents her phone. Thank God, her business has been growing with help form two of her children and they have many customers. With the previous loan, she was able to buy two doors for her living room. Now she wishes to buy welding materials to build a metal gate at the entrance of her house to improve her security; since crime threatens the neighborhood, completing this work is a necessity. Her short-term goals are to build a separate space for her eatery (since she now cooks in her home’s kitchen) and provide better service for her customers. She hopes to accomplish her goals with the loan granted by Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy welding materials to build a gate at the main entrance of her house

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann B. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old, single and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 21-year-old single woman living with her father and four siblings. Her father owns agricultural land and she used to accompany him for the past five years when he worked on it.

And in 2008, Samah took the opportunity to help her father with the cultivation after he became old. She cultivates vegetables and she distributes the harvest to the agricultural markets. She’s a very hardworking woman.

Today, Samah is requesting $1,200 to buy farming supplies like seeds and fertilizer in addition to some tents to use when packaging the produce.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer plus some tents

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica P. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Veronica owns and operates a business planting and harvesting sugar cane "tubo" for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Kumuduni

texts.en:
Kumuduni W. is a 43-year-old married woman living in Henegama, Akurassa, with her husband and two children aged 18 and 11.

Kumuduni has a grocery shop which she started ten years ago. In her business she works hard and is honest and careful. She cooperates well with others, and has a positive mood.

Kumuduni has asked for a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her grocery shop

loans.name: Fanny Elizabeth

texts.es: FANNY TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, ELLA TIENE UN PEQUEÑA BODEGA UBICADA EN SU DOMICILIO, TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE SE INICIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, APERTURO EL NEGOCIO CON RECURSOS PROPIOS VENDIENDO SOLO GASEOSAS, ELLA YA HA TENIDO EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS ENTIDADES Y  A LA FECHA NO CUENTA CON SALDOS, TIENE TRES HIJAS DE LAS CUALES SOLO DOS ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, FANNY SUEÑA CON DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJAS, POR LO QUE ELLA TRABAJA DIARIAMENTE ATENDIENDO SU BODEGA DE FORMA CALIDA Y AMABLE, ES POR ESO QUE SUS CLIENTE SE SIENTEN AGUSTO CON SU ATENCION, FANNY  SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, COMPRAR MERCADERIA Y AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO, ELLA TIENE CAPACIDAD Y VOLUNTAD DE PAGO ADEMAS DE CONTAR CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE.
texts.en:
Fanny, 43, lives in her parents’ house; she has a small general store in their home. She has been in this line of work for 5 years so she has a lot of experience in it. She opened the store using her own funds and used to sell just soft-drinks. She has had credit history with other financial institutions but currently has no outstanding debts. She has three daughters two of whom are still school aged. Fanny dreams with giving the best to her daughters and this is why she works so hard every day in her store tending to her customers with kindness and warmth; this is why her customers are so pleased with the attention they receive. Fanny is asking for funding to invest in her business buying stock items to enlarge her inventory. She has both the capacity and the willingness to repay as well as good personal references from her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia H. is from the village of Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old, married and has 5 children, some adult, some school-aged. To make a living, Dionesia owns & operates a general store. The other source of income for the household comes primarily from the income of her husband as a farmer. 

Aurelia has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2008, Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Aurelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Emerenciana M. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan. She is 50 years old. Emerenciana is married and has three school-aged children. Emerenciana owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Emerenciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emerenciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital.

loans.name: Ericah

texts.en:
Ericah is 52 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 10-34 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. She has been farming for 30 years and has employed 2 people from the community. Her main product is milk which she sells to businessmen. Before venturing into farming, Ericah was operating a retail shop in Litein town.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough water for her dairy cows.

She recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.45,000 and has requested this new loan for Kes.80,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable her purchase a quality dairy cow and improve her dairy business. In future, she would like to improve her dairy farm and venture into the poultry business. She is requesting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac S. Ombori is a 20-year-old single man whose business is located at a busy area called Tassia in Kitengela. He has been making and selling mandazi (doughnuts) to the local people for three years and has two employees. Isaac says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he contends with is the rainy season since he does his business in the open air. However, he works very hard to maintain the health of his enterprise.

Isaac will use his loan of Kes 5,000 to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, spices and charcoal to make more doughnuts to expand his business, and he hopes to buy a plot and build his own home in future. He describes himself as very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, spices, and charcoal for his business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Jane L. is from Barangay I, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years of age and is married to Leandro, a staff member of MOELCI II (Misamis Occidental II Electric Cooperative, Inc.), Ozamiz City. She is blessed with one child who is still an infant. Mary Jane is presently engaged in operating a fast food and grocery store business and is also receiving support from her husband. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for three years already and earns approximately 10,000 Php a month. Just this year, 2010, Mary Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under its regular loan program, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 Php as her first loan to be used as additional capital for her fast food and grocery store business. Mary Jane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs; in savings for future use and for her child’s education; and for loan repayments, insurances and possible business expansion. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fast food and grocery store business

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhter lives in a small city called Borewala in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children but none of them were able to get an education due to the poor financial conditions of the family. She is a housewife and stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family. She is very supportive of her husband and family.

Naseem’s husband is a vegetable vendor. She helps her husband by cleaning the vegetables and arranging them on his four-wheeled cart for him to sell. Her eldest son also runs his own vegetable shop in the market.

Naseem has applied for her third loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan her husband will buy seasonal vegetables in larger quantities for his vegetable-selling business.

Naseem is hopeful that, with the help of increased profits, she will be able to provide better living facilities to her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: 03.11.22.dien Bien Group

texts.en:
L. T. Hop (111) is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hop is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 22.Dien Bien (03.11.22.Dien Bien).

Hop is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Hop owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members.  Hop has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hop joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hop has successfully repaid her first loan, for 4,248,000 Vietnamese dong (VND), from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This first loan was used to expand the business.  She is now requesting her second loan, for 5,310,000 VND, which will again be used to expand the business.   Hop plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Ly (109) is a 68 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.
2.  N. T. Thao (110) is a 37 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.
3.  L. T. Lien (112) is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hop L. Hop (111) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hop là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 22.Dien Bien (03.11.22.Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hop thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hop kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hop đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hop đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.310.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Ly (109) là 68 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  N. T. Thao (110) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  L. T. Lien (112) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: expanding services business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia M. is from the village of Guibang. She is 61 years old and is married with four adult children. Eugenia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over forty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eugenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi B. sells second-hand clothing at Elmina. Esi has no educational background. She lives together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
El clienta Aura Lila P. T.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Zona No.2 contiguo al granero, Es casada  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como maestra de educación graduada como Lic. En magisterio tiene 21 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de ladrillo y sementó para su vivienda el cual tiene propuesto construir una nueva pieza.  
Esto le permitirá que la clienta pueda obtener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Lila lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality in the department of León. She is married and works for MINED Santa Rosa Del Peñón as a teacher of college education. She has worked as an educator at this institution for 21 years. 

She would like to improve her home by purchasing bricks and cement for the purpose of building a new room. This will allow her to obtain a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement for her house

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en: Munhjargal M. is 56 years old and lives in Hovd province of Mongolia. She lives alone in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in another's rented yard. Her grown daughter lives on her own. Munhjargal works as a watch woman in the local school and, during her free time, sells coal and milk to supplement  her earnings. She started in 2004 and has operated a successful retail business over the years. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her daughter's tuition fees. In the future, she plans to expand her business so that she can afford to buy a fence. She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase and stock more coal and milk at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more coal and milk

loans.name: Blas Antonio

texts.es: Blas Antonio S. tiene 54 años de edad, es agricultor y
texts.en: Blas Antonio S. is 54 years old, a farmer, and

loans.use: To purchase manure and farming materials

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn M. is a 39-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a weaving business. She lives in Matija 2, Barangay Mantija, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Abaca Weaving business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP2,800.  

Jesselyn is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for the business. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Jesselyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for business.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Kadiatou B. est née le 07 Mai 1966 à BanamB. (région de Koulikoro), elle est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle réside avec ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Kadiatou B., après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle décide finalement de s’initier l’activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans, auprès d’une voisine du quartier. Elle mène son activité  à Kaboïla II en face de l’antenne de Soro Yiriwaso Sikasso tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux années avec laquelle elle est à son troisième prêt et tous ses deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce troisième prêt  lui permettra d’améliorer ses prestations de services en achetant plus de viandes de brousses avec les chasseurs des localités environnantes de Sikasso, 45kg de poissons frais, 60kg de haricot, 25 poulets, 1 sac de pomme de terre, 20kg de haricot vert etc.
 Les recettes alimentaires sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. Son restaurant marche en merveille surtout avec la vente des viandes de brousse appréciées par la population. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. was born on 7th May 1966 in BanaB. (in the Koulikoro region). She is divorced and mother to four children who are in her care. She lives with her children in a large extended traditional family in Kaboïla II, in the centre of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). 

Mrs. B.  had many unsuccessful business ventures but finally decided to set up a restauration business over 15 years ago with a neighbor in the district. She carries out her business every day in Kaboïla II opposite Soro Yiriwaso's Sikasso branch and is in great demand from her customers for the quality of her products.

In order to satisfy ever growing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, around two years ago and she is now on her third loan from the institution; her two previous loans were repaid in full. This third loan will allow her to improved the quality of her service by buying more bush meat from hunters in the towns surrounding Sikasso, 45kg of fresh fish, 60kg of beans, 25 chickens, one sack of potatoes, 25kg of green beans etc..

She sells her meals for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women, young single people and above all, nightowls. Her restauration business is going wonderfully well, particularly the sale of bush meat which is appreciated by the working population. She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA, which will be used essentially to increase her business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Antonio Jr

texts.en:
Antonio Jr B. is from the town of Western Pob.Lopez  Jaena. He is 36 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio Jr owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. He is just starting this business.

In 2009, Antonio Jr joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be Antonio Jr’s second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve hisbusiness

loans.name: Tao

texts.en: Tao D., 24, is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. D. is married and resides with her husband and their child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is employed as a transporter of materials for his existing customers, earning an income of USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. D. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new car for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new car to improve her husband's business.

loans.name: Bejica

texts.es: Bejica, de 21 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Gelacio (28) y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El trabajo al que Bejica se dedica, es el cultivo de plátanos y café. Todos los días desde muy temprano, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, y ya lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos las enfermen. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad de esta manera espera mejorar sus cosechas y ganancias.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo, además en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con el resto.Bejica tiene planeado invertir  los mil  soles solicitados en la compra de  más insecticidas, ya que desea tener sus  campos libres de plagas, así espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Bejica is 21 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 28 year-old Gelacio, and her three young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Bejica grows bananas and coffee.  Very early every morning, she goes out to work amongst her crops since she knows that the money she will make from selling her harvest will depend a lot on the quality of her produce.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that her months of work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land since there is always the danger that the chemicals will make her ill.  In the future, she plans to grow a larger quantity of crops.  In this way, she hopes to improve her harvests and profits.

This is Bejica's second loan with MFP.  She says that the loan money will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive of her fellow bank members.  Bejica plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting in purchasing more insecticides since she would like to have her fields pest free.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine S. lives in the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is the proud mother of three children (two sons twenty three and twenty four and a twenty year old daughter).  

With her husband, Karine has been working on the family farm for over twenty two years.  She is fortunate to have a university degree in agriculture which helps her run the farm.  Karine is looking for a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer.  She will invest the loan in her livestock and vegetable growing business.  According to her business plan she expects the family income to increase by twenty five percent.  

Karine was born in Gharibjyan and hopes to continuing living there surrounded by her close friends and relatives.  Karine dreams to see her children happily married with children living near her.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani belongs to a big metropolis called Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan. She is 40 years old and has lived with her family in a 3 room brick house in the area of Yadgar for the past 26 years. She is married to S. M., who is a blacksmith and makes iron boxes on order. The iron boxes are used to keep clothes, quilts and blankets in houses. He has been doing this business for the past 5 years and has a good number of clients in his area who give him regular orders due to his ability to make quality boxes at cheap rates. 

Rani is a caring lady, who prefers to stay at home and manage the household chores. She has a very good nature and loves keeping flowers at home. She enjoys taking care of them. She is the mother of 2 sons. Her eldest son is a tailor by profession while the second one is studying in class 9. 

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron to make more iron boxes for selling. Rani is hopeful that the loan investment will help her husband to improve his business and also for her family to enjoy a better life. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

This is a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron boxes for selling.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey H. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years-old. Rey is unmarried and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Rey has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rey joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Rey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for maintenance.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban A. F., tiene la edad de 23 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad de un año de edad al igual que su señora esposa. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia del su cafetal para tenerlo en mejores condiciones de producción esta próxima cosecha que  viene.  El cuenta con el terreno y la experiencia para poder seguir adelante con su  cafetal, lo cual quiere es mejorarlo aun mas para mejores cosechas este año. Esteban pretende seguir creciendo como persona y como caficultor de la zona, al igual quiere brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y cumplir algunas metas que se propuso este año con su pequeña familia.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Esteban A. F., age 23, is married and has a one-year-old son, who is his biggest priority along with his wife. He wants to buy supplies for his coffee plantation to have it in good condition for the next harvest. He depends on his land and his experience to run his plantation, which he hopes to improve for a better harvest this year. 

Esteban wants to keep growing as a person and as a coffee grower; he also hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life. This is Esteban's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from a formal bank, but FUDECOSUR's loan application process is simple and offers lower interest rates.

loans.use: Hired help and purchase of supplies for coffee plantation.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria Elena J. G. es una mujer de 51 años de edad, que  vive en el barrio Loma Fresca de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su conyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 19 a 22 años;  con su  pequeño negocio ubicado en su vivienda  y la venta de mercancias mediante guias especializadas de productos, que  tambien tiene, Victoria  está muy satisfecaha y quiere hacerla crecer,    su esposo y su hijo la apoyan los fines de semana y tiene muchos clientes que cada dia crecen y le compran de contado o a un crédito que cancelan en menos de 20 dias. Su sueño es lograr convertirlo  en un autoservicio  locativamente bien condicionado, donde sus clientes encuentren lo que ellos necesitan y se sientan confortables. Su mayor desafio es la competencia,  pero la enfrentan con buenos precios y buen servicio,y con ello  logra que su margen de utilidad se encuentre en no menos de un 28% y esto hace que su negocio sea atractivo y despierte en ella el deseo de continuar construyendolo, además de que sus inventarios rotan cada 15 dias que es una muy buena señal. Con su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará ranchos, viveres, refrescos para surtir su punto de ventas  y comprar tambien  mercancias como cosméticos y accesorios, que tiene encargada entre sus clientes de Puerto Colombia, pueblo pintoresco, tradicional y muy cercano al mar.
texts.en:
Victoria Elena J. G. is a 51 year old woman who lives in the Loma Fresca neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla with her husband and three children who range in age from 19 to 22. She has a small business in her home where she sells merchandise through specialized product guides. Victoria is very satisfied with what she has accomplished and wants to grow. Her husband and son help her on the weekends since she has many customers and the number continues to grow each day. She sells her merchandise for cash or on a credit that must be paid off in less than 20 days. Her dream is to convert her business into a self-service store where her customers are equipped to find what they need and feel comfortable. The greatest challenge is competition, but Victoria is able to confront it by offering affordable prices and good service. As a result, she has been able to achieve a profit margin of at least 28%, thus making her business look attractive. This motivates her to wake up each day and want to continue building on what she has accomplished. Her product turnover period is 15 days, which is another very good sign.

This Kiva loan is also her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy food, provisions, and soft drinks to restock her retail outlet. In addition, she will purchase merchandise such as cosmetics and accessories that have been ordered by her customers in Puerto Colombia, a traditional picturesque town that is very close to the sea.

loans.use: To purchase food, provisions, soft drinks, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang V. is married and a mother. She and her husband are local farmers and they have three single children who are still in school. This couple currently generates an income of approximately $5 per day from their business. 

Vang V. is taking out her loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming, on which she will grow potatoes. In addition, she will rent her land to another farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing potatoes

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo ella tiene 35 años de edad, ellas se dedica a realizar prendas artesanales como servilletas, carpetas, almohadones, etc. doña Laura esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de hilos, marquice, estambres, agujas, aros y mas cosas para hacer sus costuras. Dice que su mama fue que le enseño hacer sus costuras y desde hace 10 años vende sus artesanías en los santuarios de la mariposa monarca y hay gente que le hacen pedidos para bodas y quince años. Doña Laura esta casada con el señor Martín el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 4 hijos Fabiola, Karina, Gabriela estudiantes de primaria y Alejandro de un año de edad. Doña laura esta agradecida por este prestamo porque asi podra comprar lo necesario para realizar sus prendas artesanales.
texts.en: Laura is 35 years old and comes from Ocampo. She makes her living by producing homemade embroidered gifts, such as napkins, table cloths and pillows. Laura has requested the loan to buy thread, frames, yarns, needles, rings and other sewing materials. She says it was her mother that taught her embroidery and she has been selling her homemade gifts at the [nearby] king butterfly sanctuaries for ten years. She also has customer requests for weddings and quinceañera parties (celebrations held when a girl turns 15 years old). Laura is married to Martín, who is a day labourer, and has four children: Fabiola, Karina, and Gabriela are at primary school, while Alejandro is one year old. Laura is very grateful for the loan, which will make it possible to buy all the necessary materials to make her embroidered gifts.

loans.use: To produce homemade gifts

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Rosemary has a small retail shop business, which she has run for less than one year.         
To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rosemary hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and the single mother of two children. 

She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.    

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of her friends, and this will be her first loan.

She plans to use the loan amount to open a retail shop. She will start by buying basic consumer goods like flour, rice and cooking fat in bulk for resale. 

In the future, Jane hopes that her retail shop will grow to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

loans.name: Kristy

texts.es: Kristy de 28 años vive al lado de sus padres en la propiedad que adquirieron desde hace varios años. Desde hace 3 años descubrió un nuevo mercado, desde entonces se dedica a preparar desayunos (compuestos de nutritivos ingredientes) que vende todos los días a los trabajadores. No es un trabajo fácil ya que debe madrugar todos los días  y con la ayuda de su prima prepara mates, café o avenas con leche. Acompañado de pan con queso, mantequilla; de acuerdo a las exigencias de sus comensales. Hasta el momento considera que su negocio es muy rentable, porque tiene clientes fijos que siempre le consumen y son muy exigentes con los alimentos que prepara. Con este negocio ha mejorado su economía y tiene un ingreso importante para su hogar, además de que tiene la opción de estudiar por las tardes logrando así concretar sus deseos de superación. Por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus planes. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene un buen historial de sus créditos  pues siempre fue puntual en sus pagos y motiva constantemente a su grupo del banco comunal a ser responsables financieramente. En esta ocasión  el dinero lo destinará  en la implementación de su negocio, en ingredientes no perecibles como avena, quinua, azúcar; así como también en envases descartables, bolsas y baldes que son necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Kristy, 28, lives with her parents in a house they acquired several years ago.  Three years ago she discovered a new market and since then has been preparing breakfasts (composed of nutritional ingredients) that she sells daily to laborers.  It isn’t an easy job because she has to rise at dawn every day and with help from her cousin prepare mates (herbal teas), coffee or oatmeal with milk which are served accompanied by bread with butter or cheese according to her customers’ wishes.  To date, she considers the business to be very profitable because she has regular customers that always consume and are quite exacting with their requests for the food she prepares.  The business has helped her improve her economy and she has an income that’s important for her home.  Besides, she’s able to attend classes in the afternoon thus attaining her wish for self improvement.  Because of all this she’s hoping to have support from all of you.

This is her 5th loan with MFP.  She has a good credit history; she was always punctual and is always encouraging her communal bank members to be financially responsible.

On this occasion she will use the money to stock her business with non-perishable items like oatmeal, quinoa, sugar as well as disposable packaging, bags and buckets that she needs for her business’ operation.

loans.use: to buy oatmeal, quinoa, sugar, disposable packaging and buckets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food restaurant.

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es: Mayra Azucena de 46 años. Ella se dedica a la venta ropa usada ambulante. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio y es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha logrado establecer buena clientela ya que ella siempre cuenta con variedad de prendas de vestir y sobre todo buenos precios, estas son las razones por las que muchas personas buscan sus productos y la prefieren. Trabaja duramente todo el día para lograr vender la mayoría de sus prendas y hasta el momento lo ha logrado. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros.
texts.en: Mayra Azucena, 46, is a street vendor of used clothes.  She’s been in this business for five years and it’s her main source of income.  He’s managed to establish a good base of regular customers because she always has good selection of clothing items and, above all, good prices.  These are the reasons why many people seek out her items and prefer her.  She works hard all day to sell most of her clothes and to date has accomplished this.  The loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits, among others.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits, among others.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Rita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel.  She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a resident of Kakata, is a freshman student at the university. He is married, and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three children, age 1, 7 and 12. two are currently in school.

For the past four years he has been selling imported jeans, blouses, slippers and t-shirts for men and women. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more jeans and t-shirts. He hopes to build a house for his children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 D. Diciembre es D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa, está integrado por 19 mujeres D. la misma ciudad. Todas ellas trabajan dentro D. un ambiente D. cooperación, respeto y solidaridad. El grupo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya.
Toda ellas se definen como mujeres jefas D. familia que tienen como objetivo primordial la obtención D. mayores ingresos para cada una D. la integrantes y el desarrollo integral D. cada una.
La señora Ángela se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, este es su medio D. ingresos económicos. Se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Trabaja todos los días, con mucho sacrificio para poder brindarle a su familia una vida decorosa y digna. Quiere ampliar, algún día su negocio con lo cual podrá almacenar más bebidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas como ser whiskys, cervezas, vinos, energizantes y demás bebidas para abastecer su local. Con esto podrá atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles más variedad. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “8 D. Diciembre” committee is from the city of Villa Elisa.  It has 19 women members from that city.  They all work together in a cooperative, respectful and mutually supportive atmosphere.  The group is in Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras Program’s ninth cycle.

They all define themselves as women heads of household whose main objective is to earn higher income for each of the members and for each of their integral development.

Ángela sells beverages.  This is her source of livelihood.  She considers herself to be a very hardworking, tenacious woman.  She works every day with much sacrifice to proviD. her family with a decent, decorous life.  She wants to expand her business someday to be able to store more beverages.

She requests the loan to buy beverages like whiskey, beer, wine, energy drinks and other beverages o stock her store.  With this, she’ll be able to attract more customers and offer more variety.  The loan makes her hopeful because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy whiskey, beer, wine, energy drinks and other stock items.

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es: Juan de 35 años está casado con Judith  tienen 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ellos; el trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes además de tener su negocio familiar establecido desde hace 3 años en las mañanas el negocio lo atiende su esposa y en las tardes y fines de semana el  en el cual los productos que el vende son plumas, libretas, lápices, resistol, papel de regalo y mas. Juan necesita surtir su negocio para este regreso a clases y solicita el apoyo para compra de mercancía y poder surtir las listas escolares de sus clientes.
texts.en: Juan, age 35, is married to Judith. They have 3 children who depend on them. Juan works 10 hours a day in a maquiladora, Monday to Friday. On top of this he has a family business established it three years ago. His wife attends to the store in the mornings, afternoons and on weekends. They sell pens, books, pencils, glue, lined paper and more. Juan needs to stock his business for the back-to-school season, so he is requesting support for the purchase of merchandise so that he can stock up for his customers' back-to-school lists.

loans.use: to buy paper, books, pencils, backpacks, etc.

loans.name: Aurora E Jesus

texts.es: Aurora de 51 años de edad está muy satisfecha con su negocio en el cual vende gran variedad de mercancías, especialmente artículos de belleza y prendas de vestir a la medida de cada cliente. Con su negocio ha logrado sacar a su familia especialmente a su hijo de 18 años de edad. Ella se inició en la vida comercial con una amiga de quien aprendió mucho y posteriormente empezó a vender cosméticos en el barrio y gradualmente fue adicionando otras líneas de artículos, con su vinculación a empresas que manejan sus ventas mediante gestores que utilizan guías especializadas. El credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará cosméticos, perfumes y calzados, teniendo en cuenta los pedidos que de estos artículos han hecho sus clientes. Su meta es incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lograr generar oportunidades de ingresos a su familia, convirtiéndolos en comerciantes de sus productos. Mientras Aurora trabaja con mucho esfuerzo, obtiene en su negocio una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 29%, una rotación de cunetas por cobrar de 30 días y una rotación de inventarios del 15 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos su éxito en la inversión y en su potencial crecimiento
texts.en:
Aurora, 51, is very satisfied with her business where she sells a great variety of merchandise, especially beauty supplies and clothes, to meet each customer’s needs.  She has raised her family, especially her 18-year-old son, with this business.  She started out in commerce with a friend from which she learned a lot and later on started to sell cosmetics in the neighborhood and gradually added other product lines associating herself with firms that sell their products via catalogue.

The Kiva loan is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy cosmetics, perfume and footwear keeping in mind pending orders from her customers.  Her goal is to increase working capital to generate income opportunities for her family turning them into product merchants.  While Aurora works very hard, she attains a profit margin over sales of 29%, an accounts receivable turnover rate of 30 days and an inventory turnover rate of 15 days, financial indicators from which we can predict a successful investment and potential growth.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume and footwear.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Rhonda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Rhonda has a retail shop that sells spices, vegetables & food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables to sell.

Rhonda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhonda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school and the other three are grown-up. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Asha has operated a tailoring shop for the past fifteen years, and her potential clients are her neighboring community members. Seasonality is a major challenge as demand is high during the holidays. She dreams of establishing a dress-making college in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase clothing material for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get working capital.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a father of 2 aged 7 and 1. He is a resident and a farmer in Litein South Rift Kenya. He has been in farming for 3 years producing and selling tea, maize and  milk to the local market. His family fully relies on family for their upkeep.

Moses has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will help him expand his dairy business and provide for his family basic needs. He is focusing on building a modern dairy unit for his animals.

His challenge however remains insufficient dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tunuk's Group

texts.en:
Tunuk is the leader of this group. She is 51 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. All her sons are adults; they live and work in Bishkek. At the moment Tunuk lives with her grandchildren. From time to time the sons transfer money to their mom for buying agricultural seeds and farm animals for breeding. Tunuk breeds poultry. This year, with the profit gained from selling the harvest, she purchased chickens and enlarged a shed. With the money she receives from the loan, she wants to purchase more chickens for breeding. In the near future, she plans to increase the number of cattle because in her opinion it is an effective way of investing money.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a lideo presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Mamba Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her early 30s and single with two children who are still going to school. She has several businesses. She has been running charcoal, fruit and vegetable businesses and recently started selling kanga. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the charcoal business, start selling kanga and take care of her children.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more charcoal, kanga, fruits and vegetables.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mamba," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, kanga, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 42 años, es madre de 4 hijos, es feriante, vende ropa, quesos, huevos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 9 años, durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando con Finca notó que su negocio creció, esta contenta porque aprendió a ahorrar su dinero y se siente segura porque su dinero esta bien guardado, con las ganancias que le da su negocio paga los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y cereales para poder llevar a las ferias, su meta es poder hacer que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the communal bank Generosidad [Generosity].  She is 42 years old and is a mother of four.  She is a market vendor and sells clothing, cheeses and eggs.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 9 years.  Since she has been working with Finca she says that her business has grown.  She is happy because she learned how to save money and feels secure because her money is well-guarded.  With the money she earns from her business she pays her children's education expenses.  

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy clothing and grains to take to the markets.  Her goals is to enable her children to become professionals.

loans.use: purchase clothing and grains.

loans.name: Amilani

texts.en:
Amilani is married, 39 years of age, and has six children.

Amilani works in her business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Amilani needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Amilani joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Amilani's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.  He owns a grocery store, which has been in operation for the past four months. He began this business with money he received from his parents.

Abraham joined Milango to access credit and obtain the capital required to improve his business. He is applying for a loan of 30,000 KES to construct a new site for his business. 

Abraham’s main challenge is high fuel costs that increase the cost of most produce.  He will use the extra income obtained from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to construct a new site for his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Efua smokes fish for sale at Enyinase. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been smoking fish for 10 years. She supports her partner to educate, feed, and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to smoke for resale

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Ma, Mel Rose is 16 years old and is 1st of 5 children in the family. Her mother Emelia who is the member of Project Dungganon supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.


Ma, Mel Rose is studying Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Ma, Mel Rose is borrowing 4620 to pay for tuition fees of the 2nd semester of school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Ma, Mel Rose plans to be gainfully employed and help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIDOSSESSI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Julienne est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne est mariée à un agent de transit du nom de Vincent. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Julienne vend depuis quinze ans du charbon de bois. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Julienne ensemble avec les membres du  groupe BIDOSSESSI, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Joy Amen Nedozi

texts.en: A 35 years old, Mrs. Joy N. specializes on sales of shoes and bags since 2000. A business or trade she learnt for        2 years. She plans to improve her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sales

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz rents washing machines. Beatriz began her business by financing a debt to purchase two washing machines from a large commerical store. In the beginning she just offered laundry services from her home. Now she continues to provide this service but also rents out the machines from her home. She will use the loan to purchase another machine. She is sure that with this new tool her business will grow and she will be able to continue to invest in it. Beatriz is a mother of four children, married and 38 years old. She is sure that the loan will help her to improve her family's quality of life and her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Beatriz se dedica alquilar lavadoras. Beatriz empezó su negocio endeudándose en una casa comercial para adquirir dos lavadoras. Al principio ella solo daba servicio de lavado en su domicilio. Ahora ella continua dando este servicio y alquilando lavadoras desde su domicilio. Ella usara el préstamo para la compra de otra maquina. Ella tiene fe que con la introducción de estas nuevas herramientas de trabajo su negocio se incrementara y seguirá haciendo inversiones. Beatriz es madre de cuatro hijos, casado tiene 38 años Ella tiene la seguridad que el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: To purchase another washing machine

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
María del Carmen lives with her common-law spouse and has 4 children ages 22, 16, 12 and 9. She has been running her business for over a year and a half, and her husband works as a city employee. Initially she sold used clothing and tacos in the mornings. Later on, due to the location of her home she decided to put up a snack bar, in which she currently works. This allows her to help her husband cover the family’s expenses.

María del Carmen is seeking a loan of $475 to purchase hot-dog-making equipment and basic supplies for her business. She is offering to repay this loan within 4 to 8 months. She hopes for your collaboration, as it is a relatively new business and she sees a lot of potential in it. She therefore would like to invest in a machine and be able to move her business ahead. She very much appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Carmen vive actualmente en unión libre con su pareja y tienen 4 hijos de 22, 16, 12 y 9 años respectivamente, ella lleva con su negocio más de año y medio y su esposo trabaja como empleado municipal. Inicialmente ella vendía ropa usada y tacos por las mañanas, luego por la ubicación de su domicilio optó por poner un puestito de snack y es a lo que se dedica actualmente y con esto ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.

María del Carmen esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para poder comprar equipo para elaborar hot dog y materia prima para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un período de 4 a 8 meses. Espera tu colaboración ya que es un negocio relativamente nuevo y ella le ve mucho futuro por ello desea invertir en su maquina y así poder salir adelante con su negocio, te agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire supplies

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a public transportation driver. He works as a Trufi driver between La Paz and El Alto. (Trufi is an acronym in Spanish for Set Route Taxi). This job is the source of income that he uses to support his son. Edgar lives on Marcelo Q. Santa Cruz avenue, in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz.
