The loan that he is requesting will be used to maintain his car, which is the tool that he uses for his job. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation that was conducted qualifies him for this loan. With this, Edgar will be able to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Edgar es transportista de servicio publico; trabaja de Trufi inter – ciudad La Paz - el Alto (Trufi es un taxi que tiene una ruta fija). Esta es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su hijo. Edgar vive la Av. Marcelo Q. Santa Cruz de la Zona de Pasankeri que esta ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado servirá para el mantenimiento de su movilidad que es su herramienta de trabajo. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo. De esa forma Edgar podrá seguir trabando.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Fuh Victor

texts.en: Born in 1950, Fuh Victor A. is married and has five children. He is unemployed. Although he attributes his unemployment to his low education, he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive. His parents died before he was a teenager. Victor says life has never been the same again. His desire to give his children (love and education)  what  death deprived him of, is his sources of motivation. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small to his kids. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is the reason he joined GHAPE. With previous loans he succeeded in providing his community with food and manure. Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy four piglets, animal feed, and pay rent for the premises. This investment will increase the food supply in the community. He is planning on using the profits generated in sponsoring his minor children in school. He plans to pay the loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Alifredina

texts.en:
Alifredina is a 52-year-old energetic and dynamic mother of six. She has been in business for the past 25 years. She has run a restaurant for a long time, as well as a kiosk and a charcoal store. The profits from her businesses have helped the pay school fees for all of her children.

Alifredina requests a loan of $950 to purchase supplies for her restaurant and other businesses.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel A. is a fridge repairer and also sells used fridges for the home (second-hand fridges) imported into the country from Europe. He is 35 years of age and married with three children ages 12 years, 5 years, and 6 months. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk and soaps. Gabriel is a hardworking man. To help with the family finances, he also sells fridge motors. His shop is located at Moree Junction, on the Yamoransa – Accra highway. Gabriel has suppliers who always supply him with fridges and the fridge motors, and he is a well-known fridge repairer. He also repairs air conditioners.

He is asking for a loan of US $800 to enable him to renovate his shop, buy more fridges and fridge motors from his suppliers, and to buy air conditioner gas.

loans.use: To renovate his shop, buy more fridges and fridge motors from his suppliers, and buy air conditioner gas.

loans.name: Zarkhanum

texts.en: Zarkhanum 48-year-old woman who sells women's clothing in the local Sabirabad bazaar. She has seven years of experience in  this field and does it very well. In fact, her inventory sells quicker then it can be replaced by new consignments. She is married and has three children. Her business is the only financial source for her family. Zarkhanum is going to expand her business and increase the number of goods for sale. For this purpose she needs 1200 USD for a 18 month repayment period.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase number of goods

loans.name: Elah

texts.en: Elah, 26, is the mother of 2 children and she has a pretty large vegetable garden. She is able to pick the vegetables from her garden 3 times a day and sells them at the market or in shops nearby, earning about $5 a day. Her husband, D., has no fixed job. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her gardening business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
"A few months ago I began construction on a concrete fence in front of my house. I have some material left and would like to urgently finish the job because my house is very unsafe and I need to protect my family. I'm asking for $800 to finish the construction of a concrete fence in front of my house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses empece la construcción de una barda enfrente de mi vivienda de hecho todavia tengo algo de material, me urge terminar esa construcción ya que como pueden darse cuenta mi casa es muy insegura y necesito darle protección a mi familia” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de una barda en mi vivienda

loans.use: To build a concrete fence.

loans.name: Thi Van's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Vân, 36 years old, married with two school age children, is a village cadre. The family farm and weave bamboo baskets and other bamboo products like fences, trays. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng, that would be paid back in 25 weeks, T. buy bamboo and T. invest in their business. She hopes that the loan would help the family’s economy. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Phương, 40 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for noodle production.
  • Tô Thị Hiệp, 42 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thanh, 61 years old, applies for a loan T. buy young cows.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thu, 50 years old, applies for a loan T. buy fruits for her fruit stand.
  • C. Thị Bé, 43 years old, applies for a loan T. feed for poultry.
  • C. Thị Ninh, 51 years old, applies for a loan T. replenish her clothing shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân, 36 tuổi, là cán bộ phụ nữ địa phương. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang đi học. Ngòai làm ruộng, gia đình chị còn đan lát các dụng cụ bằng nứa, tre, đặc biệt là các loại giàn, phên để phục vụ các hộ sản xuất mỳ, vỏ đa nem, miến trong thôn. Chị tham gia chương trình với mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần để mua tre, nứa đan lát. Chị mong rằng món vay này sẽ giúp chị tiết kiệm hơn, thúc đẩy kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển hơn. Trong nhóm chị còn có các thành viên khác: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 40 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị Tô Thị Hiệp, 42 tuổi vay 2006000 đồng để mua lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh, 61 tuổi, vay 1534000 đồng để thêm tiền mua bò. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thu, 50 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua hoa quả bán. Chị C. Thị Bé, 43 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám nuôi gà thịt. Chị C. Thị Ninh, 51 tuổi, vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn buôn bán quần áo.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama is 43 years old and isa married woman with 2 children, ages 22 and 19. Mwanamtama owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $105 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marlene is 37 years old and lives the neighborhood "The Springtime." She is married and has three children, ages 2, 10, and 14 years old. Her husband works as automotive electrician and helps provide for the family's expenses. Mrs. Marlene's main occupation is running a small grocery store that she has had for four years and began with her own money. This loan is to strengthen her business by buying a variety of products for her to offer to her customers. In the future, she hopes to convert her grocery to more of a general store, hoping to improve her family's quality of life and provide for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Marlene tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio la primavera, es casada y tienen tres hijos de 2,10 y 14 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como electricista automotriz y ayuda para el gasto de la familia. El negocio de doña Marlene es una pulpería que tiene cuatro años de tenerla, ella comenzó con fondos propios, el préstamo lo quiere para fortalecer el negocio con productos diversos para ofrecer a sus clientes. A futuro es convertir la pulpería en una miscelanea, tratar de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y velar por la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Strengthen her business by increasing sales through offering a wide variety of products

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị T., 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She and her husband have had a hard time finding the means to raise their children with an education. By joining the fund, her family has been able to invest into the business of raising ducks and pigs. Currently, her family has 200 egg-laying ducks that create a steady average daily income of 100,000 VND. Her family also raises pigs in addition to the ducks. The family's animal rearing business has improved their financial situation significantly.

All of her children have complete educations. Two of the children have finished: one has established their own family and one has stable work that provides the family with 2,000,000 VND every month. Four of her children are still attending school.

For this round of loans, the family hopes to raise 6,000,000 VND to continue to put towards their animal rearing business. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T. 52 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006 đông con nên chị cùng chồng vất vả để kiếm tiền đầu tư cho các con ăn học, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 200 con vịt đẻ cho thu nhập đều đặn bình quân 100.000đ/ngày, ngoài việc chăn nuôi vịt gia đình chị còn nuôi thêm lợn. Từ những dự án chăn nuôi vit, lợn kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá lên rất nhiều. Các con chị đều được đi học đầy đủ, 2 con đã ra trường, 1 đã xây dựng gia đình ra ở riêng, 1 có công việc ổn định giúp gia đình thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng, 4 con chị vẫn đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To continue their animal rearing business of raising ducks and raising pigs.

loans.name: Snježana

texts.en: Snježana is a woman living in the town of Doboj.  She is married with one young child, and she and her husband run a small convenience store. She is requesting her first loan with Žene za Žene in the amount of 600 KM to invest in her store, specifically to stock up on inventory.  Snježana wants to increase the variety of products she sells at her shop, and believes that this investment will be the best way to increase her income and in turn improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Sr. Ismael F. C. lives in the La Ramada area of tropical Santa Cruz de la Sierra, in eastern Bolivia. He lives with his partner and two children, who are 12 and 15 years old. Don Ismael runs a video rental and copy shop in the Villa Primero de Mayo neighborhood. Most of his business comes from binding and copying, since it's hard to make money renting videos when bootleg DVDs are widely available for less than $1. He charges 30 Bolivian cents (about 4 U.S. cents) per copy, and also sells drinks and sweets. Don Ismael plans to use this loan to purchase more photocopy materials and snacks for his store.

This is Don Ismael's fourth loan with AgroCapital; his credit history is excellent. Previously, he had loans with both AgroCapital and the San Martin Cooperative, and he repaid both punctually and in full. Currently, he only has a loan with AgroCapital.

Since Don Ismael was not at his copy shop when his loan officer visited, this photo is of the outside of his store instead.

loans.use: Purchase photocopy materials and snacks

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza A. is 26 years old and lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Gulnoza sells manufactured flowers and creams, shampoo, and soap. She has a good assortment and repeat customers.

Gulnoza is applying to Kiva to ask for financial support in the form of a business development loan of $550. With this loan, she will acquire more products to sell and broaden her assortment of products.

loans.use: To purchase a larger assortment of products to sell

loans.name: Ifigenia

texts.es: Ifigenia tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo pequeño D. 4 años. Proviene D. una familia artesana, especializada en realizar todo tipo D. artículos en base D. tejidos D. fino acabado, cuando formó su propia familia, esta actividad fue una buena alternativa D. desarrollo, que durante muchos años fue el sustento económico y tuvo etapas D. mucho apogeo. En la actualidad, trabaja en su propio taller, dedicándose casi todo el día a realizar esas bellas y coloridas mantas, a pesar D. la baja demanda actual D. estas artesanías, sigue trabajando en ello, porque todavía existen personas que consumen lo que ella elabora, por lo cual seguirá trabajando en el mundo D. los tejidos en telar.  Ifigenia realiza todos estos esfuerzos por sus hijos y porque disfruta D. lo que hace. Solicita este préstamo con que podrá comprar más lana, que es la materia prima para sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Ifigenia is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and her small 4-year-old son. She came from an artisan family, specializing in making all types of articles woven with a fine finish. When she began her own family, this activity was a good thing to do; for many years it was their economic support, and there were times of much success. At the moment, she works in her own factory, dedicating nearly all day making these pretty and colorful blankets. Because of the demand for these products, she continues working on them as there are still people who buy what she makes, so she continues working in the world of things woven from threads. Ifigenia exerts these efforts for her children and because she enjoys what she does. She is asking for a loan with which she would be able to buy more wool, which is the basic material for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool in order to keep making her woven crafts.

loans.name: Mutiate

texts.en: Mutiate sells drinks in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. Mutiate is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. Mutiate lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 ($600) to purchase soft drinks to sell in her shop. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah O. is a 46-year-old mother of four children who are all in school. She is very hard working and resourceful. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Hannah obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages and sells it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase savings to pay for her children’s educational fees. She is a member of the group called Liberty Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel D. L. C. S. quiere colocar protecciones y un barandal en su casa el cual quiere tenerL. diferente a las demás como también cuidar del bienestar D. su familia para que no le pueda pasar algo. El solicita L. cantidad D. $4,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Gabriel D. L. C. S. wants to make his house more secure by installing security bars and a balustraD.. This will differentiate it from the other houses in the neighborhood, as well as look after the wellbeing of his family. He is seeking a loan of $4,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To place security bars in his home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy S. is a forty eight year old married woman with seven children – one boy and six girls. One of her children is learning a trade; three are currently in school while the rest are out of school and living independently. She lives together with her children and husband in Koforidua, a small community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a business and farming community in the region. Mercy’s husband is farmer. She works to support her husband to help provide for the family.

Mercy sells vegetable cooking oil and uncooked rice in cups. She sells in a shed in the local market square. Mercy procures bags of rice and cartons of cooking oil from big grocery shops in the nearby cities, especially Kumasi, the regional capital. Mercy has managed this business for as long as twenty years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to make more profit so she can help her children in school.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en: H. Zarif is 34 years old. He is married and has a son. For 4 years Zarif has farmed his land together with the help of his wife. He is planning to sow potatoes on his land. He is requesting this loan to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer to strengthen the soil. Zarif is asking for a loan of $ 600 USD with a term of 10 months. You could become an important part in Zarif family's life, he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed, mineral fertilizer and to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for a group of four people, all residents of Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Mrs. P. has been selected to be the leader by the members. She is a 30-year-old widow who has given birth to two children, both now teenagers attending school.

Since early 2007, P. has run a store in front of her house selling snack foods for the neighborhood, earning approximately $4 per day. P. proposes to earn additional income by selling a few groceries; thus, she is looking for a loan to buy grocery inventory to sell.

The other three borrowers are: C., a snack-food seller who asks for a loan for repairing her husband's bicycle; T., a widowed trader who sells fish paste and is applying for a loan to increase her business capital; and P., a widow who sells fish paste in the local market and needs the loan to buy more fish paste in bulk to resell.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory for sell

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is twenty-eight years old and lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Hicham has been working in sanitary installation for seven years. He requested a loan of $700 from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a car for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Hicham is highly regarded for his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Hicham decided to start this business because he had previous experience. In the future, he plans to extend the scope of his business.

loans.use: To buy a car for his work.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary N. is one of the executive members of the Luwayo group in Lugazi. She has been in the group for 5 years and has a retail shop business with 7 years experience. She is a single mother with a family of six children and 1 dependent, of which 2 are still in secondary school.  Before she started the shop, she was a farmer that sold bananas (matooke), and waragi (local brew) from which she got her start up capital to open up a retail shop. As a result, she has been able to construct a house of her own and some of her children have completed school. She has been able to achieve this because she is patient, persistent and has an pleasant character to others and her customers. She needs a loan to help with restocking her shop with more goods.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, bread, etc. for her shop's expansion.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Hải Nguyễn Thị (1319020513) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hải owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, raising pigs to sell is the main source of income for the business. Hải has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Hải joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hải has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Hải is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hải plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
"My husband and I have done our best to start a sari-sari (a general store). At first we didn't know how to run a store but later on, we learned the business and tried to make it grow. Before, we sold fish. Because our income was not enough to take care of our needs, we pushed to have a store and sell various types of goods to our neighbors," says Lolita S., a 47-year-old mother of five children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner pioneer in the Philippines. Lolita will use the loan to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

CEVI is reaching out to help people start and have a business to support their own families. CEVI provides financial services. It also offers trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (store)

loans.name: Abdul Qudis

texts.en:
Abdul Qudis is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 6 children. He has 10 years experience in the field of farming and he works hard on his land to earn money for the completion of his family member’s requirements because all of them benefit from the income he generates. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to expand his business in order to support his family members in a better way and to purchase seeds and the other required tools for his land.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is such an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and required materials for farming.

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en:
Anamer T. is 38 years old and is married to Patricio, her 33-year-old husband. The two are blessed with two children; they are Manna Mercy, 6, and Maria Gabrielle, 3. The T. family lives in a village surrounded by the sea and rice fields. These resources are the main sources of livelihood for people who live in the village, including Anamer and Patricio.

Patricio is a fisherman and a farmer while Anamer is a vendor of her husband's fish. Anamer bought a fishnet for her husband with aloan from ASHI. She started loaning in small amounts, increasing their size as her businesses grew. She was able to supplement the needs of her husband's rice farming business and expand their fishing business. 

Anamer and her husband were renting a hand tractor, but because of Anamer's loan with ASHI, she was able to buy a hand tractor. Now, they don't have to spend money to rent a tractor, and it costs the Tamboongs less to plow their land. However, the machine needs maintenance to work properly after several years of use. Anamer intends to use her newest  loan for the maintenance of their hand tractor and for an additional fishnet. 

While her children are still young, Anamer assiduously manages her family's businesses because she aspires to continue expanding their worth. Once her businesses become more stable, her children's future will be brighter and she will be able to fulfill her  vision of giving then a better education.

loans.use: The maintenance of a hand tractor and a new fishnet.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira O. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Elvira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Grater's Group

texts.en:
Grater S., age 37, is single with two children aged 18 and 16 years. She has a cosmetics shop which she started a year and a half ago. She works daily from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $50.

This will be Grater’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more cosmetics and has paid it back successfully. She hopes for a new loan to further increase her business.

Grater will share this loan with her loan group, Uwazi na Ukweli, which totals twenty members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Grater is in the middle in a blue blouse.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: María  Elena

texts.es: María  Elena A. D. C. D. 36 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella tiene una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, como pan, agua embotellada y así mismo golosinas y refrescos entre otros productos más. La tienda esta ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico, ya que se encuentra cerca D. una escuela y también se encuentra muy cerca D. la playa llamada El Zonte en el puerto D. La Libertad. María Elena solícita un préstamo ya que desea aumentar sus productos y D. esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y turistas que llegan al lugar. Así D. esta manera podrá obtener mayores ganancias lo cual beneficiará a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena A. D. C. is 36 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and two children. She has a store where she sells basic staple items, such as bread, bottled water and also sodas and refreshments among others. The store is located in a good location, near a school and close to a beach called El Zonte in the port of La Libertad. Maria Elena is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of products and thus be able to offer more variety to her customers and tourist that come to her place. In this way she can produce more income which will be beneficial to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for the store.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is still single and lives with his parents in the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao.  He helps his parents earn a living while saving something for his future by planting and producing crops.  

Aside from farming, he buys and sells vegetables.  He earns a monthly income of 1,500 Philippine pesos (or about $30 US), which he budgets to use as rolling capital while saving the remainder for his needs.  Harold hopes to increase his income but he needs additional capital.  Thus, he is requesting a loan of 5,00 pesos (or about $125) in order to buy more fruits and vegetables for trading.

loans.use: Additional capital for his crop-trading business.

loans.name: Agua

texts.en:
Agua S. is currently in the business of selling plastic plates at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase cups and spoons to sell.  Angua is 42 years old and is Married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase cups and spoons to sell in her shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 59 years-old and married with four adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erlinda joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is 31 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 10.

Jean Bosco has been in the business of secretariat services for five years. His business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and he works hard to service his clients in the community. This is reflected in the fact that his monthly profit before this loan was approximately 150,000 RWF per month (approximately US$270) and now his monthly profit has been highly increased.

Jean Bosco is requesting his 2nd loan to purchase new equipment and it is worth noting that he repaid his first loan on time and in full. His hope is that by building this business and making it bigger, he is securing a promising future for his young family. He thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo M. is from the village of Catarman. He is 47 years old. Manolo is separated from his spouse.

To make a living, Manolo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Manolo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month for these activities.

Manolo joined HSPFI to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Zulema Bertha

texts.es:
Zulema es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo en el sector Mocupe Nuevo, distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Está embarazaday su esposo es policía y actualmente trabaja en la selva del país.

Desde hace siete años tiene un pequeño kiosko a un costado de la carretera Panamericana, a la salida del sector en donde vive. Allí ofrece diversas frutas y bebidas a los transportistas que frecuentan la zona. Ella nos cuenta que este negocio es una ayuda importante a la economía de su familia y que la mantiene activa durante el día.

Su negocio se ha hecho conocido y siempre tiene clientes que solicitan su mercancía. Zulema desea comprar más fruta para ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar un negocio de venta de abarrotes para seguir sacando adelante a su hijo y al pequeño que viene en camino. Ella es una mujer alegre, bastante responsable y muy laboriosa.
texts.en:
Zulema, 35, lives with her son in the Mocute Nuevo sector, Lagunas district, which is 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She is pregnant and her husband, who is a policeman, is currently stationed in the jungle. For the past 7 years she has had a small kiosk along the Panamerican highway at the exit where she lives. There, she offers various fruits and beverages to the drivers who frequent the area. She tells us that this work is an important help to the family's economy and it keeps her busy during the day. Her business has become well-known and she always has customers who request her merchandise. Zulema wants to buy more fruit to enlarge her business but lacks the necessary capital to do so. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. Her greatest wish is to set up a grocery store to continue to provide for her son and for the child that she is expecting. Zulema is a cheerful, very responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the Western Region of Ghana.

Fati works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in cereals such as beans, maize, rice, etc., and supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush is a 45-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two children, a son and a daughter, both attend a local secondary school.

Tsend-Ayush operates a consumer goods trading business out of a shipping container at a local market. She sells a variety of household items to the residents of her neighborhood. She started her business in 2005 after managing a second-hand goods trading business for several years. She has since grown her business into a stable operation and has found success operating near her home.

For the future, Tsend-Ayush hopes to save enough money for her children's education. She is a very hardworking woman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She is focused on the future and says, “I want to provide my children with a happy life.”

Tsend-Ayush is requesting a 2,160,000 tugrug loan to purchase goods to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Amanda Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Amanda Concepción M. P. originaria del barrio Camilo Ortega al sur de Managua vende ropa y colchones. Ella mencionó mientras acariciaba a su pequeño hijo de seis años que todo sacrificio y trabajo es para que el tenga un mejor futuro, educación y que disfrute esa etapa de su vida. 

M. desea que su pequeño tenga lo que ella no pudo y que no pase hambre, frió y trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Amanda Concepción M. P. comes from the Camilo Ortega neighborhood south of Managua. She sells clothes and mattresses. As she carressed her small son of six years, she mentioned that every sacrifice and all her work is so that her son can have a better future, a better education and enjoy this phase of his life. M. hopes that her small one will have what she did not and never be hungry or cold or have to do hard labor as a child.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 4 hijos: Jesús (24), Joseph (18), César (15) y Lidia (13).
Cada día es nueva jornada vendiendo de manera ambulante diferentes productos, los cuales varía de acuerdo a la temporada. Por ejemplo, durante la época escolar vende accesorios del uniforme escolar, y durante el verano vende lentes de sol. 
De esa manera se gana la vida caminando por las calles, lo que le gusta es que obtiene buenas ganancias y lo que le desagrada caminar todo el día bajo el intenso sol, además como ambulante debe ofrecer sus artículos con miedo que los policías que prohíben el comercio ambulante le decomisen su mercadería; pero aún así le gusta su trabajo porque le permite sustentar sus gastos familiares.
Como es una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalarse en un puesto fijo en algún centro comercial donde pueda ofrecer sus diferentes productos con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el 6to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo, pues quiere seguir progresando para cumplir con todos sus sueños. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para seguir vendiendo y ahorrar el dinero para su futuro puesto.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 46, and she lives in her own house with her four children. Jesús is 24, Joseph is 18, César is 15, and Lidia is 13. Each day is a new journey selling different products, which vary according to the season, as a traveling salesperson. For example, during the school season she sells school uniform accessories. During the summer she sells sunglasses. This is the way she earns a living walking up and down the streets. What she likes is that she gets good earning. What she does not like is walking all day underneath the hot sun. Also, when she sells on the street she is fearful that the police that prohibit street selling will confiscate her merchandise. Even so, she likes her work because it allows her to pay the family expenses. As a very hard-working woman, in the future she plans to set herself up in a fixed stand in a commercial center where she can sell her different products with greater tranquility. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her payments because she does not want to cause problems for the members of the group. She wants to keep progressing in order to make all of her dreams come true. The money she is now requesting is to buy merchandise to keep selling and saving the money for a future stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoen M. is a 29 year old married woman who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Sot, is a taxi driver who can earn small revenue to support his family living.

The couple has three children, two of whom are students in the public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

Mrs. Savoen M. is requesting 2,000,000 KHR from AMK to add to her savings to buy a car for taxi transportation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family.

loans.use: To buy a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret A. is 54 years old and married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff, like candies, cookies, preserved food, soft drinks, juice, tea, and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. Today, Fikret is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing all the best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodtuss to sell

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
S., 29, has been earning a living as a pig breeder for at least ten years. By doing this, she has the ability to support all her family needs and especially is able to send her kids to school.

S. has a life partner in her husband who grows vegetables for a profit on a piece of land next to their house. This couple has a young child who depends on their income.

S. needs a loan to repair her old house and pigpen that have frequent problems.

loans.use: To repair her old house and pigpen

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: LA SRA. SANDRA SE DEDICA A VENDER DVD's. ELLA ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO PERO VIVE JUNTO A SUS DOS JOVENES HIJAS, UNA DE ELLAS ES UN POCO ENFERMA PERO GRACIAS AL APOYO DE SANDRA SE ESTA MEJORANDO. ELLAS VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE ALTO PAMPAHASI QUE ESTA A 20 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. SANDRA TIENE UNA TIENDA DONDE VENDE LOS DVD's Y TAMBIÉN VA A VENDER A LA FERIA 16 DE JULIO DE LA CUIDAD DE EL ALTO, QUE ES LA FERIA MÁS GRANDE ESTA CIUDAD. SANDRA ES UNA PERSONA ALEGRE Y TRABAJA MUY DURO PARA QUE SUS HIJAS RECIBAN UNA BUENA EDUCACIÓN YA QUE ESPERA QUE ELLAS PUEDAN LLEGAR A SER PROFESIONALES. SANDRA Y SUS HIJAS VIVEN EN ESTE MOMENTO EN UN PEQUEÑO DEPARTAMENTO Y ESPERAN PODER AHORRAR LO SUFICIENTE PARA PODER COMPRAR UNA CASA. ELLA SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR CAJAS DE DVD'S EN BLANCO. ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sandra sells DVDs. She is separated from her husband but lives with her two young daughters. One of them is a bit ill but, thanks to Sandra’s care, she is recovering. They live in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood which is 20 minutes from downtown. Sandra has a store where she sells the DVDs and she also goes to the 16 de Julio market in El Alto, which is the largest in the city, to sell. Sandra is a cheerful woman who works hard so that her daughters can have a good education, hoping that they will become professionals. Sandra and her daughters live in a small apartment and hope to save enough to buy their own home. She is asking for funding to buy cases of blank DVDs. They are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 cases of blank DVDs

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta el señor Julio Cesar V. G., ha dedicado su vida al desarrollo de productos agropecuarios como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo, también realiza la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, con dichos rubros asegura la mantención de su familia constituida por su esposa y tres hijos quienes también colaboran con la actividades diarias, además de estas obligaciones también se dedica a realizar  trabajos de corte y aserrado de madera para la construcción de viviendas y también madera para uso industrial, solicita este financiamiento para la compra de una moto cierra ya que la que actualmente tiene esta bastante deteriorada y de esta manera asegurar un mejor trabajo, lo que le traerá consigo un mejor ingreso para su familia y la realización de  actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta el señor Julio Cesar V. G., ha dedicado su vida al desarrollo de productos agropecuarios como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo, también realiza la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, con dichos rubros asegura la mantención de su familia constituida por su esposa y tres hijos quienes también colaboran con la actividades diarias, además de estas obligaciones también se dedica a realizar trabajos de corte y aserrado de madera para la construcción de viviendas y también madera para uso industrial, solicita este financiamiento para la compra de una moto cierra ya que la que actualmente tiene esta bastante deteriorada y de esta manera asegurar un mejor trabajo, lo que le traerá consigo un mejor ingreso para su familia y la realización de actividades agropecuarias.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra una moto cierra.

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en:
Marmie V. is from the town of Rosales, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Marmie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marmie owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Marmie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marmie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marmie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marmie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.fr: D. M. Evelyne est née le 07 Janvier 1952 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Mariée à YANGO Henry, Evelyne est mère D. trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cependant, aucun des enfants n'est à sa charge. Evelyne vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Evelyne s'est installée au quartier Allomey à  Allada, dans le département D. l'Atlantique. Depuis cinq ans environs, Evelyne vend des glaces et des sucettes à Allada. D. façon secondaire, Evelyne vend également des bijoux. Evelyne achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Evelyne est une ancienne cliente D. ALIDé, qui avait obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Evelyne désire élever le niveau D. son activité et surtout renforcer son activité D. vente D. bijoux pour mieux répondre à la demanD. nombreuse D. sa clientèle. C'est donc pour agrandir son activité D. vente D. bijoux et se faire plus D. revenus, que Evelyne sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Evelyne D. M. was born on January 7, 1952 in Parakou, in the North of Benin. She is married to Henry Yango and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. However, none of the children are dependent on her. Evelyne lives by herself and supports herself independently. About a dozen years ago, she moved to the Allomey district in Allada, in the Atlantic Prefecture of Benin. She has been selling ice cream and soft drinks in Allada for about five years. As a secondary business activity, she also sells jewelry. She purchases her goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Evelyne has already been a client of ALIDé in the past: she had obtained three loans, all of which were duly repaid. Evelyne would like to expand her business and, first of all, to build up her jewelry in order to better respond to customer demand. In order to expand her jewelry sales and increase her income, Evelyne is seeking a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing plastic bags, sugar and other ingredients for making soft drinks; also purchasing jewelry for resale

loans.name: Pott

texts.fr: Pott G. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIENABA KHABANE depuis le jour de création le 23 novembre 2006. Elle fait du petit commerce, elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile où elle vend divers produits tels du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait, du thé etc. L'objet de son crédit est de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Pott G. is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the THIENABA KHABANE «Banc Villageois» loan group since its creation 23 November 2006. She runs a small retail business, operating a store in her home where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, tea, etc. The purpose of her loan is to bolster her stock level so she can generate more income and help her husband take care of family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar D. is 48 years old and lives with his wife in a ger- a traditional housing tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is a student in Darhan, one of the biggest cities in Mongolia, while his wife helps Otgonbayar with his business. To make a living, Otgonbayar sews lightweight leather coats and clothes that are suitable for the spring and fall weather here in Mongolia. He started his business in 2000 as a mobile business. Today, he does all of the designing and selling of his clothes. His working capital recently reached 1,200,000 MNT including the equipment he uses for his business. He would like to expand his product line and broaden his customer base. He would also like to eventually own a workspace which is more comfortable than the one he has currently. Otgonbayar is a hard working person who is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and a sewing machine which can be used to help make high quality leather products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Ampil Teouk village, Kandal province. Mrs. Sophat S., 60 years old, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.  

Mrs. Sophat S. is a congee seller (rice porridge) and she is also a coffee seller who is able to earn a small income to support her child. Mrs. Sophat S. is now requesting for a loan to add her savings to fix her house. Mrs. Sophat S. is a widow with a child who is a laborer.

loans.use: To fix her house.

loans.name: Elsa Torrefiel's Group

texts.en:
Elsa T. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occdiental. She is 43 years old. Elsa is the group leader of a three-member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsa is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a retail clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Elsa has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,900 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a resident of Borewala, a city which is located in south Punjab, Pakistan. She is a middle-aged woman who embroiders clothes for her nearby clients to earn an income. She is famous in her area for her quality work and gets a good amount of orders every month. The income she earns helps her to pay for the education expenses of her daughter. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her daughter is in 8th grade, while her son is 5 years of age and has not yet started going to school.

Her husband runs a grocery shop in a market, where he sells regularly used groceries, specifically rice, spices, and cooking oil. His shop is located in a place where he faces crowds of people every day. To fulfill the needs of the people and increase his customer base, he has to maintain his stock of groceries. But, currently, he doesn’t have enough stock, and due to this he is going to lose his customers day by day, which is not good for his business. Therefore, Yasmeen has decided to acquire a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. The loan will help her husband buy the required groceries for his shop and overcome the business problems as well. She is very hopeful that her husband will once again bring his business to the top by increasing his profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of two children, she started her own home business in 2007. She works as a private teacher specializing in learning languages. She has been involved in this occupation for 18 years and has been working in a language center in her town, but she has decided to work independently. She has taken advantage of a first loan and is very thankful for the results. Today, she is requesting to borrow a bigger amount of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a small language center. She is planning to expand her business by employing different teachers, and she really needs this amount to realize her project.
(Her picture has been taken with her students.)

loans.use: To prepare a small language center.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Née en 1979 à Gapé–Afomekponawoé, Mme Mama A. est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est un cultivatrice très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans l’agriculture avec ses propres moyens financiers. Ambitieuse et très déterminée, elle sollicite un financement en vue d’étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles pour de meilleurs rendements et des revenus agricoles conséquents. Sa bonne réputation et bonne foi méritent d’être récompensées.
texts.en: Née en 1979 à Gapé–Afomekponawoé, Mme Mama A. est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est un cultivatrice très dynamique qui s’est lancée très tôt dans l’agriculture avec ses propres moyens financiers. Ambitieuse et très déterminée, elle sollicite un financement en vue d’étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles pour de meilleurs rendements et des revenus agricoles conséquents. Sa bonne réputation et bonne foi méritent d’être récompensées.

loans.use: étendre ses surfaces cultivables et acheter des intrants agricoles

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: El Sr. Rigoberto es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña Ingeniero Agrónomo en la Alcaldía de dicho municipio donde tiene 9 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de comprar una ventana para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en: Rigoberto, a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, is currently employed by the town hall of his city as Agricultural Engineer, and he has been working in this capacity for 9 years. This is the first loan he is requesting to Ceprodel, and he will use it to make a small improvement to his house by buying a window.

loans.use: To buy a window.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga T. N. is 46 years old with two children who are attending college. Nga has been a successful farmer for many years and her main activity focuses on growing rice and raising pigs. 

Nga has been a SEDA credit client since 2004 and has effectively used loans to expand her business. She is currently requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to build a chicken coop for 200 chickens which she intends to raise.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop for 200 chickens

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the South region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is not currently in school.  Faridah has a business of outside catering, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child.  In the future, Faridah hopes to own a boutique.  Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced and has one adult son. She sells women's clothing at a big department store in Berdyansk town. Her average net income is 4,000 Grivnas per month.

Lubov started this business 12 years ago. At that time, her husband had left her and she had to raise her son by herself. Lubov is a very disciplined person and pleasant to talk to. She believes that these two qualities have helped her to develop her business and to become successful.

Lubov would like to get a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of clothing that she sells. The additional income would be used for the family needs as well as for further business development.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory.

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
Ibragim is married with three children. He lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and runs a store selling carpets of different kinds and tastes. His business is very prospective and flourishing. Ibragim has an individual approach to each of his customers which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 6 years. Currently he needs a loan of $3000 USD to expand the range of his products. Ibragim is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. Ibragim’s business is developed and settled. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Zephanous

texts.en: Zephanous is a forty-five year old married man with seven children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for twenty years amidst the challenge of price fluctuations. His vision is to educate his children and build another house.  Zephanous intends to use his loan to buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace owns a business that sells meat. She is 24 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 8 years old. Her children attend school. Her husband works together in the same business. Marie Grace has been selling meat for four years.  Her loan will be used to buy more meats to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to own more than one butcher shop in the years to come.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Cynder

texts.es: Cynder, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar (41), quien trabaja como chofer de un auto y sus cuatro  pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.En la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad del distrito de Pichanaki), Cynder tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y esta en muy buena  ubicación, pues por la zona transita cantidad de personas. Desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana abre su tienda y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock, esta actividad la realiza hasta las 10 de la noche que es la hora cuando cierra su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comercializar  y es muy buena realizando esta labor, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, ya lleva cuatro  años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar sus actividades. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.Es  el noveno préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y promete que será muy  puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada.Cynder tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cynder is a very loving and hard-working, 34 year-old mother.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Cesar (41), who works as a car driver, and her four young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Cynder own a grocery store in her community of Yurinaki (in Pichanaki district).  She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable and in a good location as a large number of people pass through the area.  She opens her store at 5.30am and gets ready to sell the products that she has in stock.  She works until 10.00pm when she closes her store.

What Cynder most likes about her work is selling and she is very good at this job since her customers always leave her store very happy.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work being the fact that she has to stay in her store all day without being able to go out and do what she needs to do.  In the future, she hopes to improve her store and help it grow so that she can better serve her customers.

This is Cynder's ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual in making her repayments since she does not want to cause trouble for the other members of her community bank where she is a very well-liked and respected member.  Cynder plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles she is requesting in purchasing more products so that she can better run her grocery store.  In this way, she hopes to improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a cosmetic business from home for the past two years; neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of high transport cost in her business. She hopes to establish her own cosmetics shop in the future to sell her products.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of cosmetics for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
45-year-old Charito is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 children. She is engaged in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than 20 years already. She also runs a stall where she sells vegetables and dried fish. Charito works hard to improve her business and earn more for her family.

Charito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charito has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Charito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province.  She is 36 years old.  Marilou is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as detergents, milk in the box, oil, coffee and soy sauce  in the local community.  Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marilou is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and canned goods.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like junk foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en: Venantie, who was born in 1976, has four children ranging in age from 6 to 13. Venantie sells foodstuffs and is requesting a loan to purchase more. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena tiene 52 años, vive junto a su hijo que está a su cargo. Desde hace 20 años tiene instalado en el mercado su puesto de venta de frutas. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de frutas frescas los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista en Managua. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio de Martha siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad pero sobretodo la calidad de fruta que vende. El préstamo es para adquirir productos como plátanos, cebollas, tomates, sandias, papayas, maní entre otros. Martha es muy trabajadora y entregada a su familia, Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena is 52 years old and lives together with her son who is in her care.  For 20 years, Martha has run a fruit stall in the market.  Every day she offers her customers a variety of fresh fruit which she acquires in the wholesale market in Managua.  This business is a great help to her family.  

Martha's business always has customers who prefer to shop there because of the good customer service that she offers and her kindness but, above all, because of the quality of the fruit that she sells.  This loan will be used to acquire products such as bananas, onions, tomatoes, watermelons, papayas, peanuts, etc.  Martha is a very hard-working woman who is devoted to her family.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, watermelons, papayas, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria T. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Asteria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Asteria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Asteria has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Asteria joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asteria is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Asteria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, esta casada con Fernando, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad de Santa Clara. La actividad, económica que desempeña, Margarita, es la agricultura, hace 10 años que se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembre papa y arveja, en gran cantidad, que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, pero en campañas agrícolas, viaja constantemente a la capital para comercializar su producción, ahí obtiene mayores ganancias. Ella menciona que le gusta, trabajar en la agricultura, y aunque existan perdidas, ella afirma que,  “todo depende de la atención que le brinda a los terrenos”. Además tiene 7 vacas que cuida con mucha dedicación ya que le proporcionan leche, con lo que realiza queso; que vende en grandes cantidades a los comerciantes minoristas que llevan el queso en las ferias que se realizan los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de Tarma. Por ello más adelante quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas donde puede obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP donde se siente contenta de formar parte de uno de los bancos comunales, más sólidos de su localidad. Margarita, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus sembríos de arveja; asimismo sembrará papa de la variedad “única”, para lo que necesita comprar semilla.
texts.en:
Margarita, age 40, is a hard-working, responsible woman who is married to Fernando, age 42.  They have four children whom they care for and educate in their own home located in Santa Clara.  Margarita has been in agriculture for 10 years and takes care of her cropland where she grows potatoes and peas in large quantities.  After harvest she sells her produce in the central market in the city of "Tarma", but during the farming season she travels constantly to the capital to sell her products since she makes a better profit.

She claims she enjoys farming and, although sometimes crops suffer loss, she claims "it all depends on how much you care for the land".  She also has 7 cows that produce milk which she uses to make cheese.  She sells large quanitites to retail merchants that take the cheese to the Thursday and Sunday markets in Tarma.

In the future she would like to buy more farmland to increase her earnings.  She belongs to the communal bank "Trabajemos unidos" and this is her ninth loan through MFP.  She enjoys being a member of one of the most reputable banks in her town.  Margarita plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer that she will use on her pea seedlings.  She also will plant "única" variety potatoes for which she must buy seed.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer and pea seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from the village of South Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and snack foods. This loan will be Lydia's fifth loan from HSPFI.
