She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and snack foods

loans.name: Yaniris

texts.es: Yaniris tiene 26 años y vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de un año de edad en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde tiene un negocio a través de cual vende mercancía, que compra de contado y por encargo y  la ofrece a crédito. Desde muy joven Yaniris soñó con ser independiente y con manejar su propio dinero, por eso vendía ropa puerta a puerta,  mediante guías especializadas de productos y poco a poco incursionó en cosméticos, luego en accesorios y así logró ganar una clientela que en la actualidad forman parte de su registro de compradores fieles, en su casa exhibe a través de una vitrina bien surtida mercancía pues también vende de contado, pero su desafío es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para responderle oportunamente a la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  comprará ropa y perfume especialmente para caballeros, porque se acerca el día del padre y con esta conmemoración de todas las familias, Yaniris teniendo mercancía en exhibición logrará aumentar sus ingreso, porque sus clientes necesitan encontrar  regalos para su progenitor en el negocio de ella.    Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén de variedades bien surtido con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos,  mientras atiende personalmente  la educación y la crianza de su hijo y apoya la gestión de su cónyuge en el hogar.
texts.en:
Yaniris is 26 years old and lives with her husband and one year old son in the city of Cartagena.  There, she has a business through which she sells merchandise that she buys in cash or by advanced order and then offers on credit.  From a young age, Yaniris dreamt of being independent and managing her own money.  For this reason, she sold clothing door-to-door by means of specialized products.  Little by little, she added cosmetics and, later, accessories, managing to attract customers that currently make up part of her loyal client base.

She displays her well-stocked merchandise in a display case at her house, as she also sells in cash.  Her challenge is having little working capital to respond to the demands of her customers in a timely manner.  This is why she is requesting her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothing and scents particularly for men because Father’s Day is near.  Because of this family commemoration, Yaniris having merchandise to exhibit will allow her to augment her income since customers will need to find gifts for their fathers at her business.

Her future goal is to have a store that is well stocked with a variety of goods in order to increase her income, while attending to the education and rearing of her son and helping her husband with the management of their household.

loans.use: buy men's clothing and colognes.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 52-year-old widow who makes a living by running a general store where she sells soap, shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce and other items. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She earns about PHP 2,500 from her work. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her store to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bottles of cooking oils, vinegars, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria es una mujer muy sabia, que conoce perfectamente que estrategias poner en marcha en cada momento de su vida, especialmente en lo que se refiere a su negocio como es la venta de cerdos con el paso del tiempo es que gradualmente fue atrayendo más clientes, generando la necesidad de aumentar la inversión, con los que ha logrado diversificar sus y mejorar su servicio. Aunque la competencia es su máximo desafío y siempre la obliga a recurrir a estrategias para permitirle sostener sus clientes. Con él préstamo comprará cerdos.  Su sueño de continuar siendo exitosa.
texts.en: Rosa Maria is a very wise woman who knows perfectly well which strategies to put into place at each moment in her life, especially as regards her business selling pigs.  Over time, she gradually gained more and more customers which, in turn, created a need to increase her investment.  As a result, she has managed to diversify her business and improve her service.  Her main business challenge is the competition which always forces her to implement strategies in order to maintain her customers.  She will use this loan to buy pigs.  Her dream is to continue being successful.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул жительница района Джиликул. Ей 56 лет. Она вдова, имеет 7 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она имеет 14 га земли, где сеет пшеницу, выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области она уже три года. До этого Бозоргул работала в ферме, дояркой. На сегодняшний день она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Bozorgul lives in the Jilikul Region. She is 56 years old. She is a widow, with seven children. She has finished secondary school. She has 14 hectares [about 35 acres] of land, where she sows wheat, grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. She has been in this line of work for three years. In the past she used to milk cows at a farm. She is taking out the present loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 41ans mère de quatre enfants dont l'âge varient de 5 à 17ans dont trois sont scolarisés.elle débute son activité en 2000 avec un capital de 100.000f et s'approvisionne à Cotonou en gros pour revendre auprès des demi grossiste et en détail. ses ventes journalière sont de 10000 à 40000.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des articles de cassettes audio, des CD et des DVD.

elle aimerait devenir grossiste et ouvrir une grande maison de vente de CD et DVD afin de mieux subvenir aux besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman is a 41-year-old married mother of four children whose ages range from 5 to 17. Three of her children attend school. She began her business in 2000 with 100,000 Fr. worth of capital, and gets her supplies in bulk in Cotonou from public wholesalers and retailers in order to re-sell them. Her daily sales range from 10,000 to 40,000 Fr.

With this loan, she is going to buy audio cassettes, CDs, and DVDs.

She would like to become a wholesaler and open a large store selling CDs and DVDs in order to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: La señora Jeannette se dedica a la venta de ropa y su esposo trabaja en un laboratorio farmacéutico; es así como  obtienen los ingresos para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de chamarras, deportivos, poleras para caballero, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer mayor variedad. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia con su madre  ubicada en la zona de  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de los financiadotes en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Jeannette sells clothing and her husband works at a pharmaceutical lab. Their jobs are how they obtain income to support their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy jackets, sportswear, and men’s t-shirts so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers and offer greater variety. Jeannette is married and has two children. She lives in her own home along with her mother in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva lenders for funding.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sportswear, and men’s t-shirts.

loans.name: Kenjahon's Group

texts.en:
Kenjahon is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 4000 soms. Together with her husband she has raised three sons; all the sons work in construction. In order to earn additional money, Kenjahon breeds cattle and then resells them after fattening. In this way she earns an additional 5000 soms for the family budget. 

This profit made it possible for her to repair their house, and she also saved money and celebrated her son’s wedding. With money received from the loan Kenjahon wants to buy feed for cattle. In the future with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she wishes to purchase a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, vive con su hija D. 22 años D. edad y un nieto D. un año, Luz se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, las elabora todos los días D. la semana y las venD. en el mercado municipal, D. estas ventas dependen los ingresos del hogar.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, esta inversión le ayudara para comprar maíz al por mayor, recibiendo un mejor precio y almacenando para más tiempo dicho producto.
El propósito D. Luz es crecer, instalando a su hija en otro punto D. venta, para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz lives with her twenty-two-year-old daughter and one-year-old grandson. She earns her living selling tortillas, which she makes every day of the week and sells at the town market, bringing in the income her household depends on.

Luz needs a loan at this time to buy corn. The investment will help her buy wholesale, so she can get a better price and storage to keep the product for a longer period of time.

Luz's intention is to grow, setting her daughter up at another location to bring in bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy corn for the tortillas she sells.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Mercy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mercy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: C 1681 Turwanyubunebwe Group

texts.en:
Marguerite, 42 years old, is married and has seven children between 2 and 16 years old. She is the leader of this group called “TURWANYUBUNEBWE” in the local language. Marguerite has operated a business selling Irish potatoes for twenty years.

Marguerite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying fertilizer to grow the potatoes to sell. With any profits from the loan, Marguerite and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow potatoes  for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group. She is 39 and she is divorced. She brings up two sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at university and the sons go to school. Venera works in a microfinance company; in 2003 she purchased a house with a garden.  Since that time she has been cultivating agricultural products. Selling some part of the harvest she earns additional 3000 soms to meet the family needs. With the profits gained from the trade she started building a shop. Venera applies for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase building materials to finish a construction of the shop. In the future she plans to finish the construction and lease it out to diversify her sources of income and for making additional money to family budget.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for her shop

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza continua en el comercio, con su pulperia y alquiler de cuartos pues es el medio de apoyar a su familia, su esposo trabajando de albañil, y de sus cinco hijos, solo dos estan a su cargo, siendo los otros tres independiente.
Con su credito anterior logro la mejora a un cuarto, lo que es de gran beneficio al poder dar un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos. Y que es atraves de los prestamo que ha venido avanzando mas rapido con sus proyectos. Que a pesar que todo esta ah altos costos, se ha equilibrado para salir adelante en la pulperia.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento comprara un freezer, para comprar mas productos de bebida y productos lacteos, lo que vendera mas y podra mantener al cliente sastifecho.
texts.en:
Esperanza continues in commerce with her grocery store and renting rooms since this is how she helps support her family; her husband works as a bricklayer.  Only two of her five children are still in her care, the other three are independent.

She used her previous loan to do improvements to one of the rooms which was of great benefit because she can provide better service to her tenants.  Through the loans she’s been advancing faster with her projects.  Despite costs of everything being higher she has managed to balance out and continue forward with the grocery store.

With this new loan she will buy a freezer to be able to buy more beverages and dairy products which will lead to increased sales and customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende pantalones,blusas,polos y camisas,tambien la socia se esta dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y venta de tienda de abarrotes. La socia desea el crédito para compara ropa como pantalones,chompas,blusas y camisas y tambien para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member is Carmen. She is 65 years old and single. The member sells clothing, such as pants, blouses, polo shirts and shirts. She also runs a grocery store that sells rice, sugar, milk and cookies. The member wishes to expand her clothing sales business and her grocery store. She wants the loan in order to purchase clothing such as pants, sweaters, blouses and shirts, and also to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies by wholesale. The member is glad to get the loan and promises to make the repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, sweaters, blouses and shirts, and also to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies by wholesale.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo dreams of having a happy family and becoming successful. He is now 31, married, and has four children. He is raising his family in a village and they make their living through farming. They cultivate their farm, planting vegetables and root crops for sale. Reynaldo also has a hog-raising business to generate additional income. His aim is to increase his income, satisfy his family's needs and provide for his children's education.

Due to financial constraints, Reynaldo is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy feed and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He says that this loan will be a real help to him in his efforts to improve his business. He hopes that his business will grow and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hog-raising business.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Gezabeth

texts.es: La señora Gezabeth de 32 es soltera y madre de 2 hijos vive en una casa de Interes social desde hace 6 años trabaja en una maquiladora 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes y como distribuidora de vales para compra de calzado de una zapateria reconocida de la localidad, para Gezabeth lo mas importante son sus hijos y  se preocupa por darles un lugar digno donde vivir ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casa el año pasado coloco protecciones y ahora requiere el apoyo para pintar su casa p0or dentro y por fuera y para colocar vidrios de las ventanas que se quebraron con el tiempo, es temporada de invierno y con los cristales rotos la casa siempre esta fría y la casa se moja con las lluvias y sus muebles se llenan de humedad y aparte no siente un hogar calido si no húmedo y esto puede hacer que sus hijos contraigan alguna enfermedad.
texts.en:
Ms. Gezabeth, 32, is single and the mother of two children. She lives in public housing and for the past six years has worked in a factory, ten hours a day from Monday to Friday, as well as working as a distributor of coupons for buying shoes at a well-known shoe store in the area. 

For Gezabeth the most important thing is her children, and every day she concerns herself with providing a worthy place for them to live. She has been making improvements to her home. Last year she installed protective features and now she needs help in order to paint her home both inside and out, and for replacing window glass that got broken over time. It is winter and with the broken glass the home is always cold and becomes damp with the rain. Her furniture gets all full of moisture and besides, it does not feel like a warm home but rather a damp one, and this could make her children contract an illness.

loans.use: to purchase paint and replace window glass in her home.

loans.name: Patrona

texts.en:
Patrona is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and married with four grown-up children. Patrona owns and operates a specialized retail business to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for 9 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2009, Patrona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joayhu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Aty Joayhu, se conformo en julio del 2010, gracias a la Sra. Nancy quien convenció a algunas compañeras que ya habian formado parte de otro grupo, a formar un nuevo grupo, luego contactaron con la asesora para la conformación del Comité. En estos momentos se encuentran en el  5° ciclo de programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Nancy nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ya que siempre varia las prendas que vende de acuerdo a la estación del clima. por medio de las ventas ella obtiene los medios para ayudar a su familia y darle un estilo de vida decoroso, sin privaciones. Su deseo es poder seguir en su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Es por ello que pide el crédito, para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que quiere surtirse y tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty Joayhu women's communal bank was formed in July 2010 thanks to Nancy, who convinced some friends who were already part of another group to form a new one.  Later they got in touch with the advisor to form the bank.  Currently they are in the fifth cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs.

Nancy tells us that she works selling a variety of clothing, because she always varies the clothes she sells according to the season.  Through the sales she obtains the means to help her family and give them a decent lifestyle without deprivation.  Her desire is to be able to continue with her business and in this way be able to continue helping her family.  This is why she is requesting the loan to buy summer clothes, because she wants to stock up and have a good variety to offer her customers.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 32 year old woman form Al Hashimi, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to buy household products such as dishes, cups, picture frames and kitchen trays. She is planning on opening a shop to sell these products. Iman hopes that this will help improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to pay for house hold products which she will sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
JOSE , WORKS AS A TAXI DRIVER, 12 HOURS A DAY. HE
LIVES IN A COMMON LAW MARRIAGE AND HAS THREE CHILDREN. HE NEEDS AN EYE
SURGERY IN ORDER TO RENEW HIS DRIVER'S LICENSE WHICH IS ABOUT TO EXPIRE,
WITHOUT HIS LICENSE HE WON'T BE ABLE TO DRIVE AGAIN.

loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYE SURGERY

loans.name: Mahulawoe Group

texts.fr: MAHULAWOE est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Lucienne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Lucienne est mariée à un transporteur nommé Olivier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lucienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Lucienne vend des boissons et du gari(farine de manioc) à son domicile depuis treize ans. Lucienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Lucienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHULAWOE un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons et du gari.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 45 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 6 and 20 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is a shoemaker looking for investment capital for his business. He started working in this activity about 6 years ago when he was hired by a Chilean man. Eventually his boss returned to Chile and left Hilario with all the machines and clients. Since then Hilarios has been working diligently to make the business a success, but he has been restrained because he does not have the capital the previous owner had.

He is now seeking a loan in order to buy his raw materials such as leather and soles. He is looking to significantly increase his production for the upcoming holiday season. Hilario works with his brother and two other employees at his business. He lives in his home with his mother and has four children who live with his ex-wife.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy leather and raw materials necessary for his shoe making operation

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi A. is a good and honest producer of the local liquor «sodabi» in his area. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of seven. His wife brings in no money, and so all family expenses fall upon his shoulders. In mastering his business, he has become a good manager. He has had to handle two consecutive loans, both of which he repaid without any problems. Presently, things are busy, and he needs sufficient funds to buy oil palms, from which sodabi is distilled. He is requesting financial support in the amount of $1,200 to buy several palm trees. His goal is to augment his production and furnish more of the drink to remote areas. This loan, once released, would really benefit him, since it will have a very positive impact on his production. And this will improve the socio-economic situation for him and his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Brave producteur de boisson locale « sodabi » dans sa localité, Monsieur A. Kossi est âgé de 55 ans, marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Sa femme n’a aucune activité de revenu ce qui fait que toutes les charges reposent sur Monsieur A.. Maîtrisant bien son activité, il en fait une bonne gestion. Il a eu à gérer deux fois de suite des crédits qu’il a remboursés sans difficulté. En cette période d’intenses activités, Mr A. a besoin suffisamment de fonds pour acheter des palmiers à huile. Il sollicite un appui financier de $1200 pour acheter beaucoup de palmiers à huile en vue d’augmenter sa production et fournir plus de boisson dans les zones reculées. Ce crédit ainsi débloqué lui serait très bénéfique puisqu’il aura un impact très positif sur son rendement ce qui améliorera sa situation socio-économique et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy several oil palms to increase his production of a local drink

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil A. Rza lives in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is married with three children. Adil began breeding cows in 1996. He previously borrowed $700 from Agroinvest to purchase a calf, and extended his business.
Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Pilar lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and two children on Buenos Aires Avenue in the hills of La Paz. She is 27 years old and principally dedicates herself to clothing sales, though sometimes she also sells stew as per the special requests of her customers. The capital with which she works, she actually does not obtain in order to supply her business because that is what she saves; she came to IMPRO to ask for a credit to buy and augment her merchandise. She doesn't have historical antecedents, save for her activity and her desire to improve her income; IMPRO suggests that she is qualified to accede the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Pilar vive en la casa de los suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la av. Buenos aires de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa principalmente, aunque algunas veces vende también ollas según sus clientes le hagan pedidos especiales. El capital con el que trabaja actualmente no le alcanza para surtir su negocio por lo que ahora ella vino a Impro a solicitar un crédito para compra y aumento de su mercadería. No tiene antecedente histórico pero por su actividad y su deseo de mejorar sus ingresos IMPRO sugiere que ella esta calificada para acceder al crédito.

loans.use:
Working capital  
Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: "My business has experienced tremendous expansion during the past 9 years , that is, since the moment I started borrowing from LAPO," says Mrs. Eunice I., 50, a widow and mother of 6 children. Eunice sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past 14 years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy more foodstuffs for sale in her little shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Genadiy

texts.en:
Genadiy is a doctor who had a desire to be self-employed and decided to open his own office rather that work in an old, Soviet-style medical clinic. He has been on his own now for three years and is working hard to expand his practice. Genadiy’s goal is to be able hire and train assistants to work with him and expand his small office into a private medical clinic. This expansion would allow his wife, Zinaida, who is also a doctor, to be able to work together with him.

Genadiy has requested a loan of $500 to give him extra capital so that he can complete some remodeling in his office and purchase new equipment. Genadiy’s medical practice has benefited in the past from the financial support of Nadiya Ukraine. Initially he was reluctant to take his first loan, but he needed money for his business. After experiencing first-hand the benefits of micro-lending, Genadiy has not only become a repeat customer, but he has also brought along other business owners to obtain necessary financing.

loans.use: To complete office remodeling and purchase equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and a copy machine.

loans.name: Azimio A Group

texts.en: Rehema, age 45, is divorced with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 14. Her business is selling pancakes and used clothing. She began this business in 1993. She works from 5am to noon daily and makes a monthly profit of around $90. She and her fellow subgroup member (also selling clothing)request a loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
The committee, “United Women,” is a group of eighteen women from the town of Cerrito in the city of Capiata. The town suffers from many problems including a lack of schools and many people are plagued with health problems. The women are happy with their work in the group and their goal is of course to better their own lives, along with the lives of their families.

The loan that they are asking for will be used to purchase food, clothing and cosmetics. With an increase in goods, the women can expand their profits and businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy a variety of food, clothing, and cosmetics for the womens' independent businesses.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
The strength and the unshakable fortitude of Sonia have allowed her and her family to remain united and enjoy their wellbeing. For a long time she has been dedicated to agriculture and cattle farming, and for a bit, the manufacturing of bricks and it is with this activity that she has been able to satisfy many desires in a short time. However, her yearnings and desires have not been satisfied completely due to the necessity of capital and precisely for this motive she turns to you in search of help to inject a bit of capital into her livelihood so that she will be secure and will continue in happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La fuerza y la inquebrantable fortaleza de Sonia ha permitido durante muchos que su querida familia se mantenga unida u gocen de bienestar.Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace poco a la fabricación de ladrillos y es con esta actividad que ha podido albergar en poco tiempo muchas satisfacciones y desea continuar su travesía implementando mejor su espacio de trabajo, sin embargo las ansias y deseos nop han sido cubiertos debido a la falta de capital y precisamente por este motivo recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de inyectarle un poco de capital a esta su ocupación que está segura dentro de poco le seguirá dando inmensas alegrías.

loans.use: Increase of Capital to increase the production of bricks.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Darti

texts.id:
Darti lives alone with her husband. Their two children are married and they live in another town. Darti and her husband lives in a permanently built house which is simple but clean. Darti wants to stay working as she does not want to be dependent to their children's support. Therefore she farms pig. At the moment she has 5 pigs which are kept at a hut build from cement.

She can earn profit of IDR 2 million every 6 months (around USD 220/ 6 months). She uses this money to finance their daily life. In the future she wants to have more pigs so she can have more income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Darti hanya tinggal berdua dengan suami. Dua orang anak mereka sudah menikah dan tinggal di kota. Rumah tempat tinggal Darti permanen dan sangat bersih. Walaupun dalam hidupnya tidak lagi menanggung anak –anak mereka tetapi Darti tetap bersemanggat untuk bekerja. Darti tidak mau hanya mengharap dan bergantung pada anak –anak dan juga menantunya. Untuk itu Darti memelihara 5 ekor babi, agar bisa mendapat penghasilan yang lumayan. Setiap harinya Darti disibukkan dengan usaha babinya. Dengan kandang terbuat dari beton, Darti setiap paginya mengurus ternak mereka. Pada sore harinya Darti mencari dedaunan untuk babi peliharaannya. Keuntungan yang didapat sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- per 6 bulan. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Suaminya sangat mendukung usaha ini, bahkan untuk kedepannya Darti ingin lebih banyak memelihara babi dan bisa menambah jumlah kandang lagi.

loans.use: To buy good quality pig feed (Membeli pakan babi berkwalitas)

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 26 years old and is a single woman. Jalia has been a clothes seller since 2003. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for business.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es:
On the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr.s Elba M. works very hard in order to cover all the basic needs for her two little kids who live with her on their one room house.

She is a lady who’s dream is to finish remodeling her house, because when she started, her lack of financial resources forced her to stop. Very wisely she is looking for help with Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to buy the materials for construction to finish the house. Currently she has two loans already paid on time as per agreements established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Elba M. trabaja arduamente con el propósito de suplir las necesidades de vivienda de sus dos pequeños hijos en sus casas de habitación.

Es una dama cuyos sueños son finalizar la remodelación de su casa ya que al haber iniciado con la reconstrucción se vio en la obligación de detener la obra por la ausencia del recurso económico. A pesar de esta situación, muy sabiamente ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual obtener los materiales de construcción para continuar con su labor. Hoy en día ella posee un total de dos créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: To buy materials for Construction / Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah K. is a thirty-seven-year-old mother of three and a resident of Chanika in the Dar es Salaam region. She runs a charcoal store in the area, a challenging business she has been doing for the past six years. From the profits, she has been able to send her three children to school and care for her family. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Sichana's Hakinalawama Group

texts.en:
Sichana is 27 years old. She is a married woman with two children, aged 9 and 4. She becA. a poultry owner and soap seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Sichana now hopes for a loan to buy more poultry and poultry feed for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal and firewood sales, fish sales, oil sales and tailoring.

loans.use: To more poultry and poultry food for her business.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng K. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Svay Chuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a widow with six children, two of whom are vegetable farmers while the others are attending school. Mrs. Sreng K. owns a small store on the street where she sells food for passengers. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to reach her customer demand. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients in order to reach her customer demand.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo K. is the happy mother of one child. For two years she has been selling foodstuffs such as sweets, macaroni, preserved foods, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many others in a grocery store which is situated in the market of Djabbar Rasulov.

Shahlo’s wish is to increase her business, offering a variety of types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved child, who is only 5 years old, who is the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts.

With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. By supporting her, you can be an important link in the growth of this business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs in order to expand her inventory

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng L. S. was born in 1981 and lives in Kor Village in Kandal Province. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. She owns a plot of land on which she could cultivate rice. However, she cannot currently do so because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support her field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Preab Yan, is a grocer in the local village.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Esse

texts.en: Esse N. is 36 years old and a married mother of 3 children (her youngest daughter is pictured in this photo.) Esse lives and works in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for her family, Esse runs a hair salon in Wome.  Like many hairdressers in Togo, she specializes in ‘tresses,’ a popular African hairstyle of braids made with synthetic hair.  With her loan Esse would like to buy more hair products and tresses to satisfy her customers.  Esse also hopes to buy a new mirror.  With these purchases she hopes to increase her sales to be able to raise her quality of life and contribute to the expenses of children.

loans.use: Buy more hair products and tresses to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Pomaah

texts.en: Pomaah A. is married and has eight children, three of whom are still in school. She lives with her family in Obuasi, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 62 years old.  For the past four yeas, she has sold ladies and children’s clothing such as skirts, underwear, and slippers. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business. She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality clothing so she can upgrade her inventory, and then she will be better able to provide for her three children who are still in school. She belongs to the community group called “Kristo Tease” (Jesus lives) Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
“I will never stop dreaming big for my children. Even if it means I have to double-time my work to earn bigger for my family. I really will do everything to make them able to attain the highest education I never achieved," says Adelfa D. C., a 38-year-old mother of five children from Lower Masagana, Lun Padidu, Malapatan, Sarangani Province. Her husband is a farmer and helps her manage their charcoal business. Since all of their five children are young students, they need to work hard to be able to pay the school fees and other needs.

Their charcoal business started in 2003. With only PHP 10,000 starting capital, Adelfa began managing the business and making it flourish. Her profit is what she uses to feed all of their children. She is so lucky to have so many friends. Her people skills increase her sales as she markets her products. 

She still wants to avail a loan from CEVI. She needs additional capital to buy charcoal and sell them later on. Adelfa also wants to find another line of business. This would be to augment and better contribute to the family income.

As a client, Adelfa is receiving credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To puchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna A. is a forty year old married woman with three children, two girls and a boy. One of the children is in junior high school and the other two are in elementary school. She lives with the family in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. It is entirely a farming and commercial town. Hanna works to support her husband who makes his living as a farmer. He cultivates cocoa and some foodstuffs. Hanna trades in banana. Most of the women in the community trade in banana and other fruits. She buys unripe banana from farmers in the nearby villages, stores them to ripen and then sells them to retailers in her community in the local market. She at times sells by the roadside with roasted groundnut. Hanna has had this business for three years. It has been her dream to save enough money to support her husband take care of the family. She wants a loan to procure banana in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav, married and with one adult son, sells women's and men’s shoes at one of the markets in Drogobych city. He has invested in his goods about 35,000 UAH but needs to increase the assortment all the time. Hard-working and quite entrepreneurial, Yaroslav started his business 10 years ago. He believes that selling good quality products brings repeat customers and helps his business grow.

Yaroslav would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase his spring collection of shoes. He needs to buy early enough to be able to offer the best selection possible for his customers.

loans.use: to increase his shoe inventory

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
D. Josephine est née vers 1979 à Ahoumbo dans la Commune de SAKETE, département de Plateau. D. Josephine est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Depuis 25ans, Josephine transforme le noix de palme en ses différents produits finis (huile rouge, boisson locale alcoolisée,appelée ici "sodabi" ,etc.)qu'elle commercialise. Josephine a besoin de moyens financiers pour développer son activité à la mesure de ses expériences.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
D. Josephine was born around 1979 in Ahoumbo, in SAKETE Commune, Plateau County. She is married and the mother of on child, who is in school. For 25 years, she has been processing palm nuts into her different finished products (red oil, a local alcoholic drink, called "sodabi" etc.) that she markets. She is in need of financial support to develop her business to the level of her experience. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase and re-sale of vegetables, cereals, and fabrics

loans.name: Maritina's Group

texts.en: L. Maritina is the leader of the Bakusekamajja loan group in Jinja. She is married with four children and 8 dependent children that she cares for. Maritina has a bar where she sells local brew like malwa and waragi. She also makes her own brews for sale. Maritina also sells dried fish from her home. By operating both businesses, she has been able to pay school fees for her children with ease, as well buy necessary household items. Having repaid her loan over 4 months, Maritina again needs another loan to be able to buy more materials for making malwa, more supplies of dry fish for her stall and more sodas and beers for her bar.

loans.use: Buying more malwa materials like yeast and bananas, dry fish for resale and more sodas and beers for the bar.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Vịnh Lê Thị (632981256) is a 58-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has five adult children. Vịnh owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing rice processing to local community members. Vịnh has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, Vịnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Vịnh is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 11th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sakina Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is the leader of this group. Her husband runs a construction supplies business. He has been in this business for the past three years. He takes order from building contractors and earns a profit. Sakina Baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies, like sand and cement, so that her husband can complete the orders of his customers.

Sarwari Baji is applying for a loan to repair her vehicle named Shahzore.

They are both very hardworking ladies. They also sew clothes to manage financial expenses. Their families are very happy with their efforts. They live in Yadgar, Pakistan --a historical place in the city of Lahore.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed between the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loan. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Reybeth

texts.en:
Reybeth B. is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, and is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Reybeth owns and operates a business in the food sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fish to the local community. Reybeth has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Reybeth joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Reybeth is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. Reybeth plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bahodoor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Баходур досрочно хочет погасить свой кредит, оставшийся последний месяц погашения и получить повторно кредит на расширение бизнеса купли и продажи скота.У него сейчас пять больших коров, которые в день дают по семь литров молока, и его жена продаёт в его посёлке,соседям.Он хочет на повторный кредит закупить  побольше корма для коров и ещё пару быков.
texts.en:
Bahodoor would like pay back his loan in advance; he has one month left of payments, and would like to get another loan to expand his business buying and selling cattle. He now has five big cows, which give seven liters of milk each day. His wife sells the milk in his village to their neighbors. He wants with his next loan to purchase more feed for his cows, as well as a couple of bulls.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Francisca Okunlola

texts.en: Francisca is 42 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks. Francisca lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Teang

texts.en: Fishing is the most important part of 29-year-old C.’s daily work. She and her husband have been living their life on a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years. This couple wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of river and then fish. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They will collect their money after their buyers finish selling the fish. Recently, this family can’t catch as many fish as before, because their boat is often broken. Therefore, C. is applying for a loan to repair the old boat and to buy new tools to replace some of their old tools that are ruined.

loans.use: To repair an old fishing boat and to buy new tools

loans.name: Matilde Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Matilde es originaria del Barrio Medrano Andino, nubicado en Ticuantepe, Municipio de Managua. Principal zona de comercio en ese municipio.

Matilde se dedica a tres tipos de negocios. Ella compra ropa al por mayor en el mercado principal de Managua y la vende a sus clientes en su municipio; Además compra Cerdos y los destaza y vende la carne de éstos; Y vende comida por la noche en su casa.

Dado la demanda que tiene de productos, sus 2 hijos mayores le ayudan a administrar el negocio, ya sea cundo vienen de trabajar o los fines de semana.

Este es su quinto ciclo de crédito y está muy satisfecha con su trabajo y pretende invertir su crédito en reforzar los tres negocios. Pero sobre todo el de destace de cerdo que le genera ganancias optimas.
texts.en:
Matilde is from the Medrano Andino neighborhood, which is located in Ticuantepe in the municipality of Managua. It is the main commercial region in this municipality. Matilde has three types of businesses. She buys clothes wholesale in the main market in Managua, and she sells them to her customers in her municipality. She also buys pigs, butchers them, and sells the meat. And, she sells food in the evening in her house. Given the demand for the products, her two older children help her run the business when they come from work or on the week ends. This is her fifth loan cycle. She is very satisfied with her work. She will invest the loan to strengthen her three businesses. Above all, the pork butchering generates optimal earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to butcher and to stock her clothing store

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a responsible wife to Marvin and a mother to their two children who are both in the elementary level.  They live in the rural community of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao.

Her husband works as a contractor in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya, while Aurora is engaged in selling medicines and groceries in their village.  She wanted her business to become productive and profitable, so she decided to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital.  She believes that this is a good opportunity for her business to grow.

loans.use: For Additional Capital

loans.name: Beneficta

texts.en:
Beneficta D.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Beneficta has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Beneficta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Beneficta's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia P., a 54-year-old farmer, strives to manage her rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. Her farm's income meets her family's basic needs and pays the tuition fees for her seven children.

In May 2008 Nelia joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) in the hope that her farm could be financed with low interest. She is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will use it to buy farm inputs and make her business grow.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. buy farm inputs

loans.name: Starch Factory B1 Middy Ojok Group

texts.en:
Middy O. is the president of her group. She is a forty-six year old married woman blessed with eleven children, five of whom are going to school. She has three other dependents as well. 

She is engaged in the charcoal business, which she has been doing for a period of five years. She will use the loan to purchase at least fifteen bags of charcoal; this may enable her to make reasonable profits.

With the loan, she believes, her children will be able to study because they will be going back to school. At least now they are eating food at least twice a day, whereas previously it was hard for her to manage feeding the family even a single meal. Middy is a hardworking business woman. She promises to work very hard and obtain some money so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: purchasing at least fifteen bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is 68 years old and is a very happy mother because she is able to achieve her dreams for her family, especially her children. Nenita lives in Prk Masinadyahon and is married to a pensioner, Victor C.. They have six children who are grown and have their own families, with a total of 19 grandchildren. In spite of her age, she continues her business because this is the bread and butter of her family.  

Her husband used to work as a carpenter in a milling company with an income that was not enough to compensate for household expenses. She engaged herself in different types of businesses like fish vending, farm work, selling of native delicacies from other barangays and would do laundry for their neighbor to help her husband with expenses. At the wee hours of the morning, Nenita would start her daily routine of taking care of her children while preparing for her businesses. In 1999, she became a member of NWTF-PD and her loan was used for her general store which was adjacent to her house. She also sold different viands to her husband's company. With this additional income for her family, she was able to send her children to school. Luckily, her business did well and she was able to earn PHP 9,000 that month, which was used for savings and to defray some family expenses.

Nenita continues to loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used as an additional capital for her general store.  She paid for this particular loan on time without any delay. Borrowing the same amount of PHP 15,000, she will be buying additional working inventory for her general store and the income from it will be used for family improvements and other investments.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional working inventory for general store

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 31 years old and married. He sells fruit and vegetables. He's been in business for two years and has two employees. He also earns some income as the caretaker for the Parklands SDA Church. He requested this loan for Kes. 40,000 to buy exotic fruits like apples and imported oranges.

Richard describes himself as mature and stable and says that since he became a member of Faulu his business has improved especially because he keeps records. In the future, he hopes to continue to grow his business and become a direct importer of exotic fruits.

loans.use: Buy exotic fruits

loans.name: Two Christian Business Partner Group

texts.en:
Mohammed D. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Two Christian business partner. He is 51 years old and is married with 4 children between 1 and 11 years old.  They range in school from kindergarten through 7th grade.

Mohammed is a high school graduate but was not able to attend university due to poverty.
He and his family live and work in the Telboma neighborhood of Voinjama, the capital city of Lofa in northern Liberia.

His runs a local pharmacy.  He buys goods wholesale and resells to residents of his community.
Mohammed has been running this business for 4 years, and hopes to improve his business from a small shop to a bigger pharmacy.
He is friendly with his community in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him.

Mohammed needs this loan to purchase additional medicine to increase his inventory as he has been facing financial challenges with his pharmacy.

He dreams of giving his children the best support through education.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine to increase inventory

loans.name: Eriyah

texts.en: Eriyah O. O. is thirty-two years old, single and has no children. His business is located at Ongata Rongai in Nairobi near a bus stop where there is a very good flow of customers. His business is well known by the name Exodus Carpentry. He makes furniture that he has been selling to the local people for the last three years. He has two employees who work closely with him and he hopes that he will create more jobs in the future. Eriyah has to manage insecurity to safeguard his business. He also needs a larger space to compete in a market that has many people doing the same business as his. He is using his loan to buy timber to grow his business, open an outlet at Kiserian and supply his products to the supermarkets. He is hardworking, God fearing and has big dreams for his future.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 48 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. Life she said is a bit challenge but she tries hard to overcome most of them.

Monica is currently into the sale of earrings and necklaces made with silver, copper, and gold brands and she sells them through hawking (going on foot) through the market. She also sells grocery products like skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc.

Monica obtains her stock of goods from Kumasi, from Accra, and sometimes from Cape Coast central market and retails to her customers. She requests the loan to buy earrings and grocery products to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings and necklace in bulk and grocery products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma J. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living running a general store. Elma’s husband helps her with the business. They have two children who are 12 and 16 years old. Both children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores. Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their quality of life. With the help of loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their income with her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Elma is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 22,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and it had a positive impact on both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for her 19th loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy more stock for her store. Elma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Subhiya

texts.en:
Subhiya has three sons and one daughter. Two of her sons work and support the family along with their father: one of them works in the Occupied Palestinian Territories (Israel) and the other works in the vegetables market of Jineen. The other two children are school students. Subhiya's husband, Jameel, appears in the photo.

Subhiya is a housewife. She applied for a loan from FATEN to buy needed items for the new house they moved to. The family's old house was small and now that her children are growing up she and her husband thought of moving to a bigger one.

Subhiya and her husband think of building their own house once their financial situation gets better.

loans.use: To purchase needed items for the house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more eggs, beans, salt and tomatoes.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie S. is 18 and single with no children.  She works in her 's business, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Connie has 1 year of experience in this business.  Connie needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Connie joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Connie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Connie S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena C. de 44 años casada, tiene 4 hijos que le ayudan a atender el negocio llamado Deposito Santo Domingo; ella cuenta que es una persona con muchas ideas de superacion, ella soño con tener una tienda y lo logro con la ayuda de Dios de su esposo que la apoya en todo momento. Se ha superado ya que es una mujer emprendedora y con esfuerzo ha hecho crecer su negocio hoy ella distribuye su producto en varias zonas de Comalapa de donde es originaria ya cuenta con un vehiculo que le sirve para repartir el producto esto le ha ayudado a tener mas ganancias pero necesita mas capital para tener producto en existencia para poder atender a sus clientes siempre y darles un mejor servicio llegando hasta la puerta de su casa, lo que es este momento desea es poner otras ventas de producto lo que quiere tambien es que sus hijos tengan una vida de calidad y hacerse profecionales.
texts.en:
Elena C. is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children who help her tend to her business named the Deposito Santo Domingo. She is a person with a great desire to succeed who dreamt of having a store; she managed to achieve this with God’s help and her husband’s support. She has been able to overcome challenges because she is a very entrepreneurial woman who, with great effort, has managed to grow her business. She distributes her products in various areas in Comalapa, the area she’s from, and has a vehicle that allows her to distribute her merchandise. Being able to do this has helped her increase her earnings, but she needs additional working capital so she can stock more products to meet customer demand. At this time, she would like to have a greater variety of products to offer for sale, as well as to provide her children with a higher standard of living so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks/sodas.

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en: Jilyn, 24, a resident of Banga, South Cotabato is a rice farmer. She manages a 2-hectare rice field, which is her main source of income. She has a 3-year-old child to support. She lacks capital, and that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 6,000 Php. This loan will help her a lot in providing fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma V. is from the village of Sta.Rosa, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lerma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing, shoes and slippers in the local community. Lerma has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Lerma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma is requesting her first loan, of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu T. H. was born in 1952. She lives in Dong Anh town with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son), both of whom are married. Mrs. Dieu and her husband are retired, and have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Now, Mrs. Dieu makes gloves which she sells at a factory. She has been involved with SEDA since 2009 and has repaid punctually. This loan cycle, she wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND to buy cloth to make more gloves.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make gloves

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em A. (presented in the photo), age 42 and her husband, Mr. Kimleang Toem, age 44, have been married 1991. They have six sons. Two are construction workers, one assists his parents in the business, two attend school, and another one is still young for school and stays at home. 

Em and her husband have been selling firewood for ten years. They cut the wood and also buy firewood from other villages. They sell their firewood in a nearby province. She hopes to continue expanding her business and is asking for another loan in the amount of $700 to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: G. Pierrette est née en 1959 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DOTOUVE François, un instituteur, Pierrette est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Pierrette a deux autres enfants à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Il y a environs six ans que la famille s'est installée à Danto, un quartier de Porto-Novo. Pierrette a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis s'est mise depuis une vingtaine d'année dans la vente de céréales (maïs, haricot, riz, etc.), de la farine de manioc et des galettes d'arachide à son domcicile. Pierrette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Ikpinlè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin. Pierrette a déjà obtenu une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien remboursé ledit prêt. Pierrette désire accroître son activité et ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits ; raison pour laquelle Pierrette sollicite un second prêt.
texts.en:
Pierrette G. was born in 1959 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Married to François DOTOUVE, a teacher, she is the mother of three children, all of whom have attended school. In addition to her children, Pierrette has two other children in her care. The couple provide for the various needs of the family together. Approximately six years ago, the family moved to Danto, a neighborhood of Porto-Novo. Pierrette left school at the high school level. Then, twenty years ago, she started to sell grains (corn, bean, rice etc.), manioc flour and peanut galettes from her home. Pierrette gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin and also at Ikpinlèm, a sales market for food products in Bénin. Pierrette has already received one loan from ALIDé that has been fully repaid. She is asking for a second loan because she wants to expand her business and open a shop to sell her products.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains and manioc flour

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat B., 56, is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells food and groceries for an income of $3 US per day. One of her children is a teacher at a public school in the province, earning an income of $5 per day.  

B. is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase more groceries for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Kennedy  Onyango

texts.en:
Kennedy A. is 33years old married man who lives in Rongo town in Western Kenya. He is married to Caroline Atieno, a business lady, and they have four children aged nine years, six years, four years, and one year,respectively.

Kennedy runs an open-air stall which sells household items like detergents, soaps, matches and much more. People prefer his products because they are cheaper compared to products on sale in big supermarkets.

Kennedy’s business is located along a busy highway which connects two towns: Rongo and Homabay. His main clients are road users along this route and also people from the nearby households.

Kennedy joined KADET and has qualified for a first loan of Kshs 20,000. He plans to use this loan to buy more household items to sell. He is sure of making more profits with this loan to boost his business. 

Kennedy’s dream is to one day construct a permanent premises, unlike his current open-air stall which is not conducive when it is raining.

loans.use: To increase his stock of home products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents from Lebanon. He is a relatively new business owner – he opened his own shop selling beauty products, perfumes and gadgets to local customers in 2008. Despite his young age, he has been able to attract customers to his shop by the variety of products offered. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to expand his inventory selection. He has high hopes for the future of his business; he is looking to continue expansion of his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To expand his inventory selection

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta es madre de familia de tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de comstruccion ya que piensa cambiar el techo de su casa de habitacion, ha trbajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y estos an sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

,
