texts.en: This client is the mother of three school-aged children.  The loan requested would be used to purchase construction materials, as she is thinking about replacing the roof on her house.  She has had three loans with Ceprodel, which she has used for home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for replacing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut P.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya, Bali. Ni Ketut P. is married and has one school-aged child. Ni Ketut P. has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut P. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,300,000 IDR from MUK which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from MUK. Ni Ketut P. plans to use additional income to financially support immediate members of her family. Ni Ketut P. is the leader of an 18 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kucup Mekar (PK-10337). About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Ketut P. 0 (0) merupakan 49 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut P. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 18 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kucup Mekar (PK-10337). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut P. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut P. menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut P. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut P. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.300.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.300.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school, while the others have graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a maandazi (dumpling) business selling from door -to-door to her neighbours. Wakati faces a major challenge of competition from other sellers in the market. She hopes to open a different type of business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase blocks to construct a house for her son. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to finance education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase blocks to construct a house for her son.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S., age 34, is a homemaker. Her husband, Mr. Rin Chansokphally, age 45, earns a living as a motor-taxi driver. They have two children who are unmarried and are employed as workers in the garment industry. 

The family resides in a small wooden house in a rural area outside Phnom Penh City. Their living conditions are not good at present because the house is very old and in need of repair. She will use her loan to pay for these essential repairs to her home.

loans.use: To pay for essential repairs to her home

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita N. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Nenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. She is also engaged in buying and selling vegetables like eggplants, tomatoes, squash & ampalaya. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Jeren

texts.en:
Ma. Jeren M. is from the village of Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 25 years old. Ma. Jeren is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Jeren owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ma. Jeren is just starting this business.

In 2010, Ma. Jeren joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Jeren has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Ma. Jeren is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma. Jeren from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 27 years old, married and has one child. Presently, her child has not attended school yet. Claudine sells charcoal, which she has done for 2 years. Her husband has no specific job. Claudine will use the loan to purchase more charcoal.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Claudine plans to increase the output of the business, and to start a new and different business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tènè

texts.fr:
Madame Tènè D. est une femme sans enfant, qui vit ses coépouses et enfants dans une famille polygame à Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Tènè fait le commerce d’articles divers et du stockage commercialisation depuis bientôt trois  ans. Après deux cycle en prêt solidaire tous bien remboursés, elle décide de venir au prêt  individuel de stockage commercialisation dans lequel elle est à son deuxième prêt, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.
Téné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1000  kilogrammes de riz, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre en une période  où le cours sera plus  élevé.
Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de  Fakola les jours de foire et dans les villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  41.670  F CFA.
Le bénéfice  sera  utilisé dans les frais  santé, d’habillement et le reste pour l’augmentation du capital.
texts.en:
Mrs Tènè D. is a woman without children who lives with her cowives and their children in a polygamous family in Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Tènè has been trading with various articles for almost three years, stockpiling and then selling them. After two cycles of solidarity loans, all repaid on schedule, she decided to opt for individual loans to finance her activity. This is her second loan, after having properly repaid her first loan. Tènè wants to use her loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice and 1,000 kilograms of millet that she will stockpile and resell once the price will have gone up. She gets her supplies at the market in Fakola on market days and in the neighboring villages.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 41,670 CFA francs a month, which she will spend on health services and clothing. Any remaining amount will be used to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel K. is a hard-working businessman. He runs his business nearly 24 hours a day. He now has employed one sales assistant, who works the hours of 8:30a.m to 7:30 p.m. Emmanuel is looking forward to another loan which he will use to improve the life of his family and also to educate his niece. Emanuel also plans on re-investing some of his profits back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Tin T. N. was born in 1959. She lives in Ha Lam 2 village and has two sons. Tin T. N. is a farmer who breeds pigs and cows. She is now raising 6 pigs  and two  cows.  Every 3 months, she earns 4,000,000 VND  profit from selling cattle. Tin T. N. intends to raise a large quantity of cows so she needs to increase her experience. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has always repaid her loans punctually. Tin T. N. would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND for pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman wH. lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending business. Her husband Joerald Sr., wH. is 42 years old, works as a food vendor at a bus terminal to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children wH. are between 6 and 17 years old. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Josephine is a Dungganon woman wH. is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community wH. has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Aloyse

texts.en:
Aloyse is 46 years old. She has three children who are between the ages three to seven years old. All her children are in schoo,l and her husband sells different kinds of items, depending on the maket demand.

Aloyse sells shoes, and she has done this business for three years and this business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more shoes. With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to renovate her house

loans.use: Buying more shoe inventory.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, D. 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia casa junto a su esposo Silverio D. 49 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña Marleni ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo D. L. tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una D. las principales productoras D. plátano, cacao, yuca, maíz y café D. L. provincia D. Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donD. llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos D. cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy segura D. poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar L. productividad D. sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marleni, age 42, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 49 year old husband, Silverio, and their six dear children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.  Ever since she was very young Marleni has worked with her parents farming the land.  With the years she has managed to buy her own land.  Now she is one of the foremost banana, cacao, yucca, corn, and coffee producers in the Chanchamayo province. 

This is the place where her buyers come to get her crops.  What she likes best about her work is taking care of her crops, and she does it with much affection.  She has been doing this activity for ten years.  She considers transporting her products to the market to be the most difficult part of her work.  That is because it is very difficult to find trucks that want to take the heavy sacks of crops.

In time she wishes to buy new land where she would be able to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very sure that she is able to make her payments on time because she has always been very punctual.  She is a very happy and supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve productivity of her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. Pov is the village bank president selected by the other members. 
 
Her husband, Mr. Brak, who was born in 1953, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. They have five children. One is seamstress in a garment factory, two are laborers, and the other two are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Pov earns a living by selling groceries in the local village. In order to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to expand her business activities

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una persona muy responsable y creativa, es originaria de la poblacion de Melchor Ocampo. Ella se dedica hacer bordados artesanales hace costuras como servilletas, almohadones, carpetas, manteles, dice que desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseño hacer ese tipo de costuras, ella las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población como Angangueo y en la ciudad de Zitacuaro, con el préstamo comenta que comprara marquice, agujas, ganchos, hilos de diferentes colores, tela etc. Ella esta casada con el señor Servando el cual es taxista y tienen 3 hijos estudiantes de secundaria y primaria. La meta que tiene la señora Guadalupe es hacer crecer su negocio poner un puesto en el tianguis de su localidad o poner una mesita fuera de su casa y ofrecerlas a las personas que pasan por su casa. Guadalupe esta agradecida con la financiera porque con este prestamo podra comprar un poco mas de material para hacer un poco mas de sus costuras artesanales.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very responsible and creative person.  She is originally from the town of Melchor Ocampo.  Guadalupe embroiders products by hand.  She makes napkins, pillow cases, place mats and tablecloths.  She tells us that when she was very young her mom taught her how to do this type of work.  She sells her products in neighboring towns such as Angangueo and in the city of Zitacuaro.  She tells us that she will use her loan to buy material, needles, hooks, different colored threads, fabric, etc.

Guadalupe is married to Servando, who is a taxi driver, and they have three children who are attending high school and elementary school.  Guadalupe's goal is to grow her business and to either set up a stall in the street market in her town or set up a small table outside her home so that she can offer her products to people who pass by her house.  Guadalupe is grateful to Fundación Realidad because this loan will enable her to buy a little more material so that she can do a little more embroidery work.

loans.use: to make embroidered products to sell

loans.name: Ayawa Enyovi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 04 enfants avec un chauffeur, à 48 ans   Mme Ayawa  est revendeuse de maïs et de charbon de bois à domicile, elle achète à Tchamba et à Atakpamé (02 villes  situées à l’intérieur  à quelques kilomètres de la capitale Lomé).elle souhaiterait satisfaire les besoins des consommateurs qui chaque jour ne fait qu’accroître. La vie au quotidien n’est pas facile vu ses charges et elle est décidée à se battre sans relâche pour épauler son époux et  satisfaire les besoins grandissants  de ses enfants.
texts.en: Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Ayawa, whose husband is a driver, sells maize and charcoal out of her home. She buys her goods in Tchamba and in Atakpamé (two towns located up-country, some kilometers from the capital, Lomé). She wants to satisfy the needs of the customers who are growing by the day. Daily life is not easy, taking into account her responsibilities, and she really wants to do her very best to help her husband out and satisfy the ever-growing needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and of maize.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe BALIMAYA sont tous des femmes mariées  qui  vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, co-épouses, frères, sœurs, et enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et  5 enfants. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Bougouni, quartier Hèrèmakono – Nord, région de SIKASSO république du Mali. 
Par des relations traditionnelles et de mariages ces clientes se sont connues. Pour consolider leur relation, elles entreprennent des activités génératrices de revenus. Avec l’intention d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et mieux satisfaire les clients, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe, les précédents n’ont pas l’objet de mauvais remboursement. 
La cliente Bassira, présidente du groupe compte acheter avec son nouveau prêt, 5  sacs de 50 kg d’oignons, 100 kg de graine de dah, 150kg de graines de Néré, 100kg de graine d’arachide et une quantité importante de feuilles vertes de baobab très appréciées dans la sauce africaine. Tous les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de la ville pour être revendus ensuite dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leurs activités.
texts.en: Made up of five women, the Balimaya group members are all women who live, for the most part, in polygamous families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, sisters and children.  They are 38 years old on average and have 5 children.  These women reside in the town of Bougouni, in the Hèrèmakono-North neighborhood, of the Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali.  These clients met one another through traditional relationships and marriages.  In order to consolidate their relationship, they started revenue-making businesses.  With the intention of growing their sales and better satisfying their clients, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance credit institution.  They are on their fifth group loan, with previous loans not being subject to poor repayment.  The client Bassira, the president of the group. expects to use her new loan to buy 5 bags of 50 kg of onions, 100 kg of dah seeds, 150 kg of Néré seeds, 100 kg of peanut seeds and an important quantity of green baobab leaves, which are valuable in African sauces.  All of the products are bought from suppliers in villages surrounding her town to be resold at the large market of Bougouni, at retail and for cash to a customer base essentially made up of women.  They expect to make a profit of 25,000 FCFA per month to be used as they wish in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase spices.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda 

600000

Doña Bernarda tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Heredia con su esposo quién tiene un taller de mecánica y 3 de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y cuenta con su propio trabajo, solo uno de ellos está estudiando todavía. Además la clienta cuida a su nieto por las mañanas. 
De amplia trayectoria en Fundación Mujer, doña Bernarda se dedica a la confección de colchas y edredones para camas además de comerciar con productos de catálogo. Desde hace cerca de 1 año inició en la compra de electrodomésticos, actividad que se ha incorporado muy bien a su negocio ya que cuenta con una clientela muy exclusiva, dado los años de trabajo en el comercio. Al ser productos de un precio alto (refrigeradoras, lavadoras, televisores, microondas, entre otros) requiere de un capital importante, ya que ella lo debe pagar de contado a su proveedor y después ella al cliente le cobra doce cuotas mensuales, teniendo un margen de ganancia superior al 60 %. El préstamo será dirigido a la compra de varios productos de este tipo, ya que tiene pedidos para el día del padre (próximo a celebrarse) y también para el día de la madre (15 de Agosto).

La clienta cuenta con una excelente trayectoria y un historial impecable en lo que respecta a la conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 55 years old. She lives in the city of Heredia with her husband, who has a mechanic's shop, and with three of her children, who are already grown. They have their own jobs, and only one of them is still in school. She also takes care of her grandson in the morning.   

A long time member of Fundación Mujer, Bernarda makes blankets and comforters for beds. She also sells products via catalogue. About a year ago she began to sell appliances. This activity has been incorporated very well into her business, since she has a very exclusive clientele, due to her years of experience in business. Since they are expensive products (refrigerators, washers, televisions, and microwaves, among others), she requires a lot of capital. She has to pay her supplier upfront, and then the customer pays in twelve monthly installments, with a profit margin of more than 60%. The loan will be used to by various products of this type, since she has orders for Father's Day (coming up soon), as well as for Mother's Day (August 15). 

This client has an excellent membership and impeccable history in regards to her payments.

loans.use: to acquire appliances at this time. This is a new business and it is producing good earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania D. 53 años, resiD. en la localidad D. Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor D. 51 años y su hijo menor Bryan D. 16 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado emprender el largo camino D. “la agricultura”. Todas las mañanas sale a trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. las venD. al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Además nos comenta que se dedica a la ganadería; donD. engorda a los animales para luego vender su carne, “siempre me va muy bien”, comenta. Ya que tiene el asesoramiento D. su esposo quien trabaja como ganadero en otras estancias ganando un dinero extra. Por ello para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania D. recibir sus apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varias cabezas D. porcino que cuesta un promedio D. S/. 150 soles cada uno.
texts.en:
With a great deal of effort Melania has managed to take on the long road entailed in farming.  Every morning she leaves to work in her fields in order to make them very productive.  She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans.  She later takes them to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  This is where she sells them wholesale.

Her crops have given her the income needed to support her family.  That is why she wishes to put all of her efforts into getting ahead in this business.  What she likes the most about her work is taking care of the crops.  She has been doing this for 30 years.  She feels that the most difficult part is transporting her products to Tarma. The bags she takes are very heavy, and they make her very tired.

She tells us that she also devotes herself to livestock.  She fattens the animals to later sell their meat.  “It always goes very well for me,” she says.  Her husband advises her.  He works with cattle on other farms, and he earns extra money.  

That is why, later on, she wishes to buy new fields in order to increase her production.

She belongs to the Virgen María Communal Bank.  This is her fifth loan with MFP, where she hopes for their assistance in order to continue on with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.

Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy several pigs that cost on the average of 150 soles for each one.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 41 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like noodles and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: El Sr. Eulogio trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas, trabaja en una línea  de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 3 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus Suegros, tiene un hijo, sus esposa por motivos económicos se fue a trabajar a España, El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio a los pasajeros, es una persona muy trabajadora deseando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Eulogio works in public transportation; he’s a member of the combined transportation providers union.  He works in a collective taxi route and has more than three years experience in this line of work and with the same route.  

He lives in his in laws’ house and has a son.  His wife, for economic reasons, moved to Spain to work.

The loan is to provide maintenance to his vehicle because it’s starting to have some mechanical problems that keep him from providing the best service to his customers.  He is a very hard-working person who wants to improve his and his son’s quality of life and is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo es una persona emprendedora  y   muy  trabajadora  que junto con    su esposa  atienden un puesto  de  tacos  que   tienen afuera  de  un  hospital  de la ciudad, contando  con  cinco  años  de  antigüedad  y  teniendo  ya   sus clientes  que  acuden  frecuentemente   a  su  negocio, es  por  ello   que  ellos  necesitan  realizar  la compra de mercancía  que  les permita  seguir  ofertando a sus  clientes el  excelente  servicio y  el  buen  sazón  que  los  caracteriza, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio y  obtener  mayores  ingresos  que  le  permitan brindar a  su  familia  una  excelente   calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Hugo is a very hardworking entrepreneur who works with his wife at a taco stand outside a city hospital.  They have been there  for 5 years and  customers stop frequently at his business.  It is  for the customers that they need to buy supplies, allowing them to offer the excellent service and great flavor that they are known for.  The loan will give them the possibility of growing their business and giving them greater earnings so that they can offer their family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to sell the food

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is 39 years of age with four school age children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, where he plants and harvests rice. Andres' wife is a housekeeper. With her determination to help her husband to carry their family out of poverty, she engages herself in a retailing business through which she sells snack foods, powder juice, drinks and breads. 

Through his income from farming, Andres is able to pay for his children's school fees. He wants to gain higher income from his yield in order to save some of it for the preparation of his children for college level education.

Andres wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like hybrid seeds, fertilizers and to pay for the expenditures of farming. He knows that with the loan he will gain higher income from the business because he will be able to buy and use the exact amount of farm inputs needed.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like hybrid seeds, fertilizers and to pay for the expenditures of farming.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y al cultivo de maíz, vive con sus cuatro hijos y tres nietos, su negocio es la crianza de cerdos y con la ayuda de sus hijos y nietos desarrolla la siembra de maíz,  también vende totillas, estas son sus fuentes de ingreso con las que cuenta para salir de sus gastos y comprar la alimentación para toda la familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, ya que desea invertir comprando algunos cerditos para engordar, también mejoras de vivienda,  con este préstamo podrá obtener dos beneficios con su negocio y la mejora de su vivienda.
Su mayor deseo es ayudar a sus nietos para que estudien y puedan prepararse desarrollando su vida mejor.
texts.en:
María works raising pigs and growing corn. She lives with her 4 sons and three grandsons. Her business is raising pigs and, with the help of her sons and grandsons, she is developing a corn crop. She also sells tortillas. These are the sources of income she depends on to cover expenses and buy food for all the family. 
She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and she wants to buy some piglets to fatten. She also wants to make some home improvements. Her greatest wish is to help her grandsons so that they can study and prepare to create a better life for themselves.

loans.use: to buy pigs for the farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married. She has five children and lives with them and her husband in Isabela. Lolita and her husband earn money by running a grocery store from the door of their house. They started this business nine years ago.

Lolita requires a loan to expand her business by purchasing many kinds of products, such as toothpaste, shampoo and personal sanitary items, to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, spices and bread for her store.

loans.name: Aboudala

texts.fr:
Aboudala est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse de céréales et ont ensemble 2 enfants.
Aboudala travaille comme un revendeur depuis 2009. Il est restaurateur dans son bar-restaurant. Il sert à ses clients des plats de spaghettis, de riz et de pâtes à base du maïs à Lomé. Il achète ces produits d’approvisionnement au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé.
Aboudala a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons et d’aménager son bar-restaurant. Il pense avec ces profits supplémentaires, s’acheter un terrain.
Dans les prochaines années, Aboudala voudrait agrandir son bar-restaurant. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit avoir une famille prospère.
texts.en:
Aboudala is a 34-year-old man.  He is married to cereal retailer and the couple have two children together.

Aboudala has been working as a retailer since 2009.  He manages a bar-restaurant which he owns.  He serves his customers spaghetti, rice and corn-based pasta dishes in Lomé.  He buys his supplies in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé.

Aboudala has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy drinks and to fit out his bar-restaurant.  He plans to use the additional profits he makes to buy a plot of land.

In the coming years, Aboudala would like to expand his bar-restaurant.  He says that, with the profits he makes, he expects to have a prosperous family.

loans.use: to buy drinks and to fit out his bar

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Sra. Felipa  es clienta antigua D. la institución,  mostrando responsabilidad   en los pagos D. sus cuotas cuenta con una buena actitud moral, ella tiene la determinación D. mejorar el negocio D. comida,  y que este sea conocido por la variedad D. platos que ofrece.  La señora Felipa es emprendedora, el puesto D. venta  se  encuentra en la  zona D. villa Tunari D. la ciudad D. el Alto, Bolivia, la señora se esfuerza por superarse ya que trabaja desD. la madrugada hasta que se pone el sol, el esposo  ayuda en la atención D. la pensión  el  apoya ese sueño D. convertirse en  una empresaria, con el dinero del crédito ampliara su pensión, comprando mesas y sillas ya que tiene mucha clientela, el mayor anhelo D. la clienta es llegar a ser reconocida por la sociedad en su lucha D. mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Felipa is an old customer of this institution. She has proven herself to be responsible in the repayments of her dues and she is of good moral values. She is determined to improve her food production activity in order to become popular for the variety of dishes she offers. Felipa is a resourceful person, and her stall is located in Villa Tunari, a neighbourhood of El Alto, Bolivia. She works hard to improve herself, working from dusk till dawn. Her husband helps her tending to the café and he also supports her dream of becoming an businesswoman. The loan she is requesting will be used to enlarge her café by buying tables and chairs as they have many customers. Her main wish is for people to acknowledge her efforts to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To make improvements to her café.

loans.name: Esther Nduku

texts.en: Esther is a 41 year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 months to 18 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are households. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuating prices. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle that will facilitate the running of the business. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other stalls that will specialize in the sale of groceries.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle that will facilitate the running of the business

loans.name: Esperanza Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Elizabeth es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Esperanza para el futuro” grupo conformado por 08 personas entre hombres y mujeres responsables y trabajadores. Elizabeth tiene 19 años de edad es soltera y actualmente vive con sus padres, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos como queques, alfajores, turrones, panes entre otros, la cual lleva trabajando de esta manera hace mas 01 año, gracias a este negocio a podido aportar con sus estudios ya que nos comenta que está en la universidad siguiendo la carrera de Administración y Negocios Internacionales. Elizabeth es una joven empeñosa que su mayor deseo es  de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y sabemos que con mucho esfuerzo lo va a conseguir.  Con el crédito que solicito va a invertir en su negocio comprando productos como alfajores, turrones, piononos y  queques y  así poder ofrecer a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Esperanza para el Futuro” agradece el crédito  brindado.
texts.en: Elizabeth is part of the Communal Bank "Hope for the future," made of up 8 people, both men and women, who are all responsible and hard-working. Elizabeth is 19 years old and is single.  She currently lives with her parents and she works buying and selling products like cakes, candies, nougats, and assorted breads.  She has been working in this area for more than one year.  Thanks to this business she has been able to pay for her schooling, since she has told us that she is in the University pursing a degree in International Business.  Elizabeth is a young hard-working woman, and her greatest desire is to finish her career, and we know that with much effort she will be able to accomplish that.  With the loan that she is requesting she will invest in her business buying products such as candies, nougats, speciality breads, cream puffs, and cakes and thus be able to offer them to her clients.  The communal bank "Hope for the Future" is thankful for the loan offered.

loans.use: to buy products such as candies, nougats, speciality breads, cream puffs, and cakes.

loans.name: Peter Severo

texts.es: el cliente de nombre Peter soltero de 30 años de edad,  dedicado al comercio (venta de plásticos (bañeras, basureros, bañadores y cestos) y ollas el cual las compra de Desaguadero frontera entre Perú y Bolivia, algunos plásticos los compra de una empresa Boliviana, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería en plásticos al por mayor ya que estas fechas de navidad tiene mucha demanda,  el cliente viaja a Desaguadero 2 veces al mes y  en algunas  ocasiones hasta tres veces al mes, el cliente vive en la zona de Pampahasi bajo, el Sr. Peter vive en la casa de su hermana de nombre Mery 38 años de edad la señora es madre soltera tiene un niño de 3 años los padres y su hermano Peter le ayudan con la alimentación y la vestimenta ya que es el único nieto y a parte que la señora es sola. Peter es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, le va muy bien en su actividad y con el tiempo desea incrementar aun mas su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
This client is named Peter. He is 30 years old, single, and in the retail trade. He sells plastic goods (wash basins, trash bins, wash pails, and laundry baskets) and cookware that he acquires in Desaguadero, which is along the border between Peru and Bolivia. Some of the plastic products are purchased from a Bolivian company. The money from this loan will be used to buy plastic merchandise in bulk since there is great demand during the Christmas season. Peter travels twice a month to Desaguadero, but occasionally he will make three trips.

He lives at his sister’s house in the District of Pampahasi Bajo. Her name is Mery and she is 38 years old and a single mother with a three-year-old son. His parents and his brother help Peter with the feeding and clothing of his only nephew since his sister is alone.

Peter is a hardworking and responsible person who has done very well in his business. In the future, he wants to increase his operating capital.

loans.use: to buy plastic wash basins, trash bins, wash pails, and laundry baskets.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is 44 years old and a farmer. He is very industrious; in addition to farming, he also raises chickens as an additional source of income. He is married and blessed with one school-aged child. To save for his child's future, he wants to improve his business. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for his corn field.

This loan would help him increase his income from his farming business, enabling him to provide for the needs of his family and his child's education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Dora Irma

texts.es:
La señora Dora Irma es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando su hija la mayor esta por terminar la universidad y su hijo esta estudiando la preparatoria desea que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de la universidad de su hija ya que en este año termina su carrera profesional. 
Doña Dora Irma es originaria de la ciudad de Zacatecas, ya tiene años radicando en Nuevo Laredo su propósito es que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro. Dora Irma trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos móvil en toda la ciudad y con este ingreso ha salido a delante.
texts.en:
Dora Irma is a single mother and has two children who attend school.  Her oldest daughter is about to graduate from university and her son is in high school.  She wants her children to have the best education.

This is why she’s asking for this loan; so that she can pay her daughter’s university expenses, especially now that she will finish her studies this year.

Dora Irma is originally from Zacatecas and has been living in Nuevo Laredo for years.  She wanted her children to have a better future.  Dora Irma sells mobile telephones all over the city and has gotten ahead with this income.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth tiene 28 años de  edad, se dedica  a la  venta de ropa  y de cosméticos de manera ambulante. No es la primera vez que solicita crédito, pues ha demostrado ser  responsable con sus cuotas, además  ella nos explica que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado con el financiamiento  ha aumentado sus mercadería y sus clientes. Lidia es una emprendedora que  tiene una gran experiencia en este tipo de negocios, y sabe identificar a sus clientes ofreciéndole variedad de productos para ellos. Lidia Ruth esta  solicitando crédito para la compra de calzado, cremas, polvos, ropa interior, prendas de oro laminado y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Lidia Ruth is 28 years old and she sells clothing and cosmetics door to door. This is not her first time to request a loan. She has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. Also, she explains that thanks to the help we have  offered with financing, her merchandise and her customers have increased.

Lidia Ruth is an entrepreneur with lots of experience in this type of business, and she knows how to identify potential customers, offering them a variety of suitable products.

Lidia Ruth is requesting a loan to buy shoes, creams, powders, underwear, gold-laminated jewelry, and clothing in general.

loans.use: buy shoes,creams, powders, underwear, laminated gold jewelry, and clothing in general to sell.
